The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. 

Khamal Ursula cooks well, and that is why her food stall is popular with neighbors in their area and with the local working community, who are her regular  customers. Aside from her food stall, she also has a small general store by her house. She earns a minimum of Php2,000 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Khamala Ursula is requesting a Php18,000 loan to buy additional raw ingredients such as pork, fish, chicken, coconut and pineapple juice for her food stall. With part of the loan she will add some grocery items to her store in preparation for the Christmas Holiday. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. Khamala Ursula plans to build and expand her business to secure the education of her children in order for them to have a better future.  

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients needed at her food stall and also to buy grocery items for her general store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer con un gran corazón, su ternura y su amor por los niños sobrepasa los límites, trabaja en una guardería donde recibe los recursos por parte del estado dado que los niños no se les cobra un solo peso ni por la alimentación, pero lo que recibe es muy poco y ella siente tanto amor por los niños que quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar unas reformar locativas, y comprar materiales didáctico.
Ayuda a esta mujer que solo le interés el cuidado y la educación de los niños de su guardería, piensa primero en ellos que en ella misma.
texts.en:
Betty is a woman with a big heart, her tenderness and her love for the children exceeds all limits, she works in a daycare where she gets resources from the government, since the children don't pay a single peso even for food, but what she gets is very little and she feels such love for the children that she wants to ask for a loan to make some structural changes and purchase some educational materials.

Help this woman whose only interest is the care for education of the children in her daycare, she thinks of them first, before herself.

loans.use: to offer the children a better learning space and educational materials.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel operates a boutique that he started in 2012 in Hoima Uganda. He started his business using the old loan. He desires to expand and develop his business using the loan facility. He will use the loan money to buy more shirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Non, a 48-year-old married rice farmer, lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has four children and three grandchildren. Two of the children are construction workers, one is a garment worker and another buys recyclable junk to resell. Her husband is a 47-year-old construction worker who is working in a city. Together, they can make approximately USD 28 daily. 

Now Non would like to request a loan to buy an ox for plowing. With the ox, she will be able to reduce plowing expenses. What she wants to do in the future is to build a new house for her family and send some of her children to take some skill courses so they will be able to change jobs.

loans.use: to buy an ox for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 34-year-old single Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, Said left school at an early age. He started working thirteen years ago as a taxi driver to help cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Said is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying his best to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open an auto repair and car painting shop. 

This loan is very important to Said, for it will help him make the first step toward a better life. Said hopes this shop will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open an auto repair and car painting shop

loans.name: Nilda Helen

texts.en:
Her name is Nilda Helen, 33, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Generoso, a boat captain, and the have three children, two of whom are in High School and one is in the Elementary Level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Nilda Helen has a small general store in their province. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, beverages, cookies and other grocery stuff. She expects an increased demand for grocery items in preparation for the Christmas Holiday. The store earnings are the family's source to meet their daily needs and to send the children to school. Nilda Helen is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Nilda Helen hopes to maintain and grow her business so she could uplift their lives. She aims to give her children the best education possible for a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Maria Angel

texts.es: María  de 42 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para poder sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años.  Ella es una mujer luchadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos desde hace 3 años. María sabe que para mantener un negocio es necesario realizar inversiones para que este progrese, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz y cal para incrementar su venta de tortillas, que es su mayor apoyo económico para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 42, is an admirable woman who strives each day to get ahead. She supports her family through her business of selling tortillas. María has been in business for three years. She is a determined woman who has been residing in her own home for the past three years along with her life companion and their four children.

María knows that in order to maintain her business she needs to make investments so that she can make progress. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest the funds in corn and lime powder so that she can increase her tortilla sales since she is the major breadwinner in her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Esqueli Yurnarda

texts.es:
Esqueli Yurnarda tiene 33 años de edad, su estado es casada. Vive con su familia, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). Esqueli Yurnarda vive en el distrito de Morropon. La comunidad se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, comercio de platano y agricultura. Ubicada en la distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Esqueli Yurnarda es a la venta de zapatos, ropa a través de pedidos, tiene experiencia en el negocio y cuenta con clientela fija. El destino del crédito será para invertir en mercadería para navidad. Es decir Esqueli Yurnarda desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos(zapatos, ropa, etc.) pues en esta temporada del año las ventas suben por lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Esqueli Yurnarda is 33 years old and is married. She lives with her family and has a connection to the public water and electricity supplies. Esqueli Yurnarda lives in the Morropón district, situated in the district and province of Morropón in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. The locals make a living by raising cattle, selling bananas and from agriculture.

Esqueli Yurnarda's business is selling shoes and clothing to order. She has experience in the business and has an established clientele. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for Christmas. In other words, Esqueli Yurnarda wants to increase the quantity and range of the products she stocks (shoes, clothing etc.) since at this time of year the sales increase. This will enable her to improve her income in the short term, increase her profits and so improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for Christmas.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. Leonor has been in the fish vending business for more than 10 years now. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Leonor is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. This loan will enable her husband to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Leonor hopes to improve her fish vending business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan esta felizmente casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus abuelos Aunque el lugar no es muy grande, la familia se las arregla, Juan es transportista publico o chofer y quiere un credito para pagar la inscripcion de su hijo al Colegio Militar, el hijo al proximo año empieza estudios superiores y ha escogido la milicia como vocación La esposa de Juan tiene trabajo  pero este esta sujeto a contrato por lo que no es seguro que siga aportando en la economia de la casa Por eso Juan solicita su ayuda
texts.en: Juan is happily married. He has two children and lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to his grandparents. Even thought the place is not very big, the family is accommodated. Juan works providing public transportation as a drive and he wants a loan to pay for his son's tuition to military school. Next year his son begins his high education studies and he has chosen the military as a vocation. Juan's wife works but this is subject to contract so it is not sure that she will continue supporting the household economically therefore Juan is seeking your help.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition to military school.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja está en E.E.U.U.- Ella trabaja como impulsadora de productos de primera necesidad.- Tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella, 2 de ellos asisten a la escuela y una ya se casó pero siempre vive en la misma casa con ella.

Mirna, trabaja de lunes a viernes, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. y los días sábados de 8:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d. ella no tiene otras fuentes de ingresos aparte de su salario.- Ella viaja 20 minutos en bus desde su casa hasta el trabajo, su hija también trabaja para cubrir parte de sus gastos. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para construir un cuarto más en su vivienda, ya que su hijo de 9 años no tiene su propia habitación, además de otras mejoras que hará en su casa.

Mirna, desea seguir trabajando y terminar de pagar la casa en la que vive, también sueña con ver graduados a sus hijos de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Mirna, who is 41-years old, completed high school.  She is married, and her husband lives in the USA.  Mirma works as a product promoter for basic necessities.  She has three children who live with her.  Two of her children go to school and one is married, but still lives in her home with her. 

Mirna works from Monday to Friday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and on Saturdays from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  She doesn't have any other source of income apart from her salary.  It takes Mirna twenty minutes to get to work from her home by bus.  Her daughter also works to cover a part of the household expenses. 

Mirna will use the loan to build another room for her home, as her 9-year old son doesn't have his own room.  She will also make other improvements to her house. 

Mirna wants to keep working and to pay off the house she lives in.  She also wants to see her children graduate with university degrees.

loans.use: to add another room to her house.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Amigas” lo integran cinco personas muy unidas que mantienen una buena relación. Alicia es una mujer trabajadora, en su comunidad la aprecian mucho y de cariño la llaman Ali. Tiene 42 años de edad y vive en unión libre con Damián quien trabaja como chofer en los transportes de carga pesada, ellos son padres de tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.

Ali tiene tres negocios: venta de ropa, venta de zapatos y una estética; lamentablemente los negocios no se encuentran cerca y resulta un inconveniente ya que no puede atender las tres actividades al mimo tiempo, “Mi estética esta en un buen lugar y si la cambio a mi comunidad seguramente fracasará” comento Ali. Donde ella vive, muchas personas saben cortar el cabello, la competencia es demasiada y no habría posibilidad de tener la clientela que tiene ahora. Entonces, los negocios de la ropa y zapatos permanecen cerrados hasta que su hija mayor regresa de la universidad. 

Ali se inició en el comercio vendiendo pollo hace tiempo, pero nuevamente la competencia se hizo presente y cambió a la venta de ropa. Al mismo tiempo su padre comenzó a vender zapatos y al ver que era un negocio redituable también agregó la mercancía a sus ventas. Poco a poco, con sus ganancias y esfuerzo fue adecuando los lugares donde vendía los productos. Las ganancias eran mejor de lo que ella esperaba y pudo pagar un curso de estilismo que al finalizar, le dio las armas para emprender el salón de belleza. 

Aunque por el momento, Ali quisiera invertir en botas por la temporada de frío que se acerca, en realidad está más apegada a su estética pero no quiere abandonar los otros negocios, pues así puede solventar los grandes gastos de educación de sus hijos ya que su marido ha tenido dificultad para conseguir trabajo. Uno de los grandes sueños de Ali es que sus hijos terminen una carrera profesional.

Los demás integrantes también se encuentran por la oportunidad de invertir en sus negocios. Don José y María Angélica invertirán en la cría y engorda de borregos; Tomás y Alejandra, en su florería.

*La fotografía se tomó en las escaleras del kiosko del muncipio donde viven los integrantes. Ali viste un suéter negro.
texts.en:
The “Las Amigas” is made up of five very close people who maintain a good relationship. Alicia is a hard-working woman, in her community they appreciate her a lot and with affection they call her Ali. She is 42 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Damián who works as a driver in heavy cargo transport, they are the parents of three children who are students. 

Ali has three businesses: clothing sales, shoe sales, and a beauty salon. Sadly, the businesses are not nearby, and it is an inconvenience since she can't take care of the three businesses at the same time "My beauty salon is in a good location and if I move it to my community, surely it will fail," said Ali. Where she lives, many people know how to cut hair, there is too much competition and there wouldn't be a possibility of having the customer base she has now. Then, the clothing and shoe businesses are closed until her oldest daughter gets back from the university. 

Ali began in the business selling chickens a while ago, but again there was competition and she changed to selling clothing. At the same time, her father began to sell shoes and upon seeing that it was a profitable business, again she added the merchandise to her sales. Little by little, with the earnings and her efforts, she adapted the places where she sold the products. The earnings were more than she expected and she was able to pay for a stylist course and upon finishing it, she struck out to open a beauty salon.

Although for the moment, Ali would like to invest in boots for the cold season that is approaching, in reality she is more attached to her beauty salon but she doesn't want to give up her other businesses because with them she can pay her children's large educational expenses since her husband has had difficulty finding work. One of Ali's greatest dreams is that her children finish professional degree programs. 

The other members also find themselves with opportunities to invest in their businesses. José and María Angélica will invest in raising and fattening sheep, Tomás and Alejandra in their florist shop. 

*The photo was taken on the stairs of the kiosk of the municipality where the members live. Ali is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to purchase boots.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es:
Mario, de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, su compañera de vida es ama de casa, tienen 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Desde que Mario abandono la escuela, empezó a trabajar como jornalero y corralero, para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.- Hace 5 años, aprendió el oficio de albañilería, también es agricultor en pequeño, y produce un área de 3,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz.- Todo esto con la intención de sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto. Y así tener una fuente de ingreso adicional y asegurar una mejor alimentación para su familia.

El sueño de Mario es, que sus hijos puedan estudiar y logren prepararse académicamente, para que puedan enfrentarse a los retos que la vida le presente.
texts.en:
Mario, 35 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, he is partnered, his life partner is a housewife, and they have two children who go to school. 

Since Mario left school, he began to work as a day laborer and a ranch hand to help his mother with the household expenses. Five years ago, he learned the job of bricklayer, and he is also a small farmer, and cultivates an area of 3,000 square meters with corn production. All this is with the intention of getting his family ahead. 

The loan will be invested in purchasing cattle. And in this way to have an additional source of income and assure better nutrition for his family.

Mario's dream is that his children can study and prepare themselves academically so that they can face the challenges that live will present them.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Leydi Patricia

texts.es:
Leydi, de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia. Leydi, anteriormente había trabajado vendiendo pupusas, hot-dogs y papas fritas, hasta que murió su madre.-
	
Actualmente, se dedica a los oficios de la casa, pero ella quiere volver al negocio que tenía anteriormente. 

Leydi, necesita el dinero para construir un cafetín para vender sus alimentos en el mismo lugar en donde vendía antes. 

Su deseo es que su negocio crezca y que su hijo estudie y tenga mejores oportunidades que las que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Leydi, 26 years old, went to school up to the third grade, she is a single mother and has a son who is going to school. Leydi previously had worked selling pupusas, hot dogs, and french fries until her mother died.

Currently, she takes care of the household chores, but she wants to return to the business she had before.

Leydi needs money to build a cafe to sell her foods in the same place where she sold them before.

Her desire is that the business grows and that her son goes to school and has better opportunities than the ones she had.

loans.use: to build a cafe.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un veterano de 68 años de edad, que se gana la vida trabajando en su negocio de salsamentaría, donde distribuye bebidas alcohólicas y crea un ambiente muy acogedor para personas de la tercera de edad.
Su principal problema es la inseguridad en su sitio de trabajo, pues vive en una zona muy afectada por la violencia.
Julio solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido entre cervezas y bebidas alcohólicas, con la ayuda de este podrá surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo los servicios a las personas de la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Julio, 68, is a veteran who earns his living working in his deli business where he serves alcoholic beverages in a very welcoming atmosphere for senior citizens.

His main problem is a lack of security in his place of business, because he lives in an area that's very affected by violence.

Julio's requesting a loan to buy a supply of beer and alcoholic beverages so he can stock his business and keep on offering services to senior citizens.

loans.use: to buy a supply of alcoholic beverages.  His business is a meeting place for senior citizens who enjoy spending time with each other in that atmosphere.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of 6 children. The income earned by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so Kaneez started her cattle trade business. She has also been selling milk for many years to generate an extra amount of income, and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Kaneez has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income for her family

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Micah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Micah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Micah is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for sound proofing and air conditioning

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 47-year-old married woman, and a mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of income.

Marilyn is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. This loan will allow Marilyn and her husband to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Marilyn hopes to expand their fishing business in the future. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, and both of them go to school. She has additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Del Pilar

texts.es:
Sandra del Pilar 24 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa familiar en el distrito La Matanza. Tiene 3 hijos. La vida en la comunidad se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como actividad económica principal. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Sandra del Pilar es la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora y piqueos. La actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año en el domicilio familiar. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el negocio se desarrolla de manera semanal y sus clientes son fidelizados. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en la culminación de su vivienda, comprará calamina para el techo de la misma. La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia, pues ya se acercan las temporadas de lluvias y Sandra del Pilar desea ofrecerles un hogar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Sandra del Pilar is 24 years old, her legal status is partnered, and she lives with her partner and children in the family house in the district of Matanza. She has 3 children. Life in the community goes on peacefully since the population works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary economic activity. Her community is located in the district of La Matanza, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú.

The work Sandra del Pilar does is selling beer, chicha de jora [corn beer] and snacks. She has done this business for 1 year in her family home. The market presents good prospects since the business is carried out weekly and her customers are loyal. The loan will be invested in finishing her house, she will purchase corrugated iron for its roof. The investment will help her to get a better quality of life for herself and her family, since the rainy season is approaching and Sandra del Pilar wants to offer them a home with better security.

loans.use: to invest in finishing her house, she will purchase corrugated iron for its roof.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, age 26, is a married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her milk sales business. Robina has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Indira is a 29-year-old, divorced woman. She lives with her 5-year-old daughter and mother-in-law. Despite having a high education diploma, Indira is unemployed. She looks after her daughter and stays home. As the family lives in poverty, Indira has decided to start her own business and generate income. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of USD 1,000 to open a bakery. She already has a place for the bakery and she needs money to purchase a stock of flour, sugar and so on, so she can bake sweets, rolls, and biscuits. Indira is very hardworking. She hopes that the business will be profitable and that she will be able to expand the business in the future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery and to bake biscuits, rolls and sweets.

loans.name: Arely Evarista

texts.es:
Arely, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, es divorciada y vive junto con sus padres y sus dos hijos, ellos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, posee casa propia, pero prefiere hacerle compañía a sus padres y la ubicación de la casa de sus padres es un punto estratégico para su negocio. Su padre trabaja es empleado en el centro de gobierno del departamento de La Unión, como ordenanza.

Arely, se dedica a destazar animales y vender su carne. Lleva más de 11 años dedicándose a esta actividad, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación se ha ganado la confianza de la gente que le compra carne. Los animales se los comprá a su ex-esposo quien se dedica al comercio de animales. Por las mañanas, trabaja en la escuela de la comunidad como niñera en algunas aulas, pero para llegar a la escuela, tiene que caminar 15 minutos todos los días.

Arely, necesita el préstamo para comprar vacas para destazó, ya que se acerca la época navideña y es cuando tiene mayor demanda de su producto y quiere estar preparada para esa época.

El sueño de Arely es, que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y personas de bien, también un ejemplo en su comunidad. Además, quiere que su negocio sea perdurable a lo largo del tiempo, para que este sueño llegue a ser realidad.
texts.en:
Arely, age 30, is a hardworking and determined woman. She has a high school education. Arely is divorced and lives with her parents and her two children who study at the community school. She has her own house, but she prefers to be with her parents since their house is situated in a strategic location for her business. Her father is a government employee for the Department of La Unión and works as a messenger.

Arely butchers animals and sells the meat. She has been in this line of work for more than 11 years. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has gained the trust of people who buy meat. The animals are purchased from her ex-husband, who is in the livestock trade. In the mornings, she works at the community school as a caretaker over some of the classes. Getting to the school requires a 15-minute walk each day.

Arely needs a loan in order to buy cows for butchering. With the Christmas season approaching, there will be greater demand for her product. She wants to be prepared for this time. Arely dreams of seeing her children become professionals and successful people, as well as examples in their community. In addition, she would like for her business to endure over time and dreams of making this a reality.

loans.use: to buy cows for butchering.

loans.name: Leonel Iván

texts.es:
Leonel, de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado de educación básica, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque la situación económica de su familia era escaza y tenía que trabajar para ayudarla.

Leonel, cultiva pipián desde hace 6 años, anteriormente trabajaba con alguien que cultivaba este tipo de verduras, fue de esa manera que aprendió y decidió practicarlo. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultiva y para comprar abono y pesticidas para la tierra. 

Leonel, planea cultivar en un terreno más grande de tierra su próxima siembra y su mayor deseo es ver a su hijo graduarse de una carrera universitaria para que tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Leonel, 22 years old, went to school up to the 8th grade, he is partnered and has a 2-year-old child, He couldn't continue with his schooling since the family economic situation was very limited and he had to work to help it.

Leonel, has grown pipián squash for the past 6 years, previously he worked with someone who grew this type of vegetable and it was in this way that he learned and decided to do it.  

The loan will be used to pay the rent for the land he cultivates and to purchase manure and pesticides for the land.

Leonel plans to cultivate a larger plot of land his next planting and his greatest desire is to see his son graduate from a university program to have better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land he cultivates and purchase manure and pesticides for the land.

loans.name: Sreynai

texts.en: Sreynai is a 19-year-old, nursing student in a city. She is a single daughter from a family in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Her parents are farmers with six children. Most of her siblings have their own business. While she is lacking of finances to pay her tuition fees for three years, she would like to secure a loan. This loan will help her to graduate successfully. After graduation, she is going to find a job in the city.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 22-year-old, married woman. She lives in Khelvachauri district with her husband, an infant daughter, and her parents-in-law. Irina owns a beauty salon and works there as a stylist. She owns another flat and wants to rent it out, but she doesn't have money for renovation. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of USD 3,000 to renovate a flat. As the flat is renovated, Irina will rent it out and will get additional stable income, to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and to rent it out in order to increase income.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
La señora Ciriaca de 63 años de edad vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia  se dedica desde hace 12 años  a la venta de productos lácteos, vive en San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Ciriaca esta solicitando el préstamo para invertir en su negocio desea comprar queso fresco, seco y mantequilla ya que tiene buena clientela de este producto, espera que con esta inversión mejoren sus ingresos y pueda seguir apoyando a su familia.
Doña Ciriaca uno de sus sueños es que su negocio siga prosperando.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Ciriaca is 63 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She has been selling dairy products for the past 12 years. Ciriaca lives in San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras.

Doña Ciriaca is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in her business. She plans to buy fresh cheese, dry cheese, and butter since she already has a good clientele for these products. With this investment, she hopes to improve her earnings and continue supporting her family.

One of Doña Ciriaca’s dreams is to see her business continue prospering.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, dry cheese, and butter.

loans.name: Iliya Lado

texts.en:
Iliya Lado is a maize farmer from Gayya village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya Lado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Iliya Lado, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a fisherman residing in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. He is a 38 year old married man with three children ages 17, 15 and 8. He sells fish to the nearby community via his motorcycle. He has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years.

Due to financial problems, Michael is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP buy fishing materials like fishing nets, and to provide additional capital for his fish vending business. This will help improve his ongoing catch and probably help continue his fish vending livelihood. He can now pay for fuel for the motorcycle, purchase foam (for fish storage) and even pay other expenses that comprise this activity.

In the future, Michael is hoping that he could handle his business successfully and that it will help him support the education of his children. He is hoping that he could also have some savings in order to start raising hogs.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, and provides additional capital for his fish vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rahila Hassatu

texts.en:
Rahila Hassatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahila Hassatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Rufai and Peter.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila Hassatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila Hassatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Rahila Hassatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mkonga Road Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her mid 20’s, is a divorced and has no children. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Zena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy saucepans and plates, and to increase food stock, so that she can serve more people. She dreams of trying another business besides mamalishe.

Zena will share this loan with her loan group "MKONGA ROAD" which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy saucepans and plates, and to increase food stock, so that she can serve more people.

loans.name: Cisne Group

texts.es:
El municipio donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo se identifica por su producción de caña. La fiesta más importante es la de San Eulogio en honor al santo patrón del municipio, durante la fiesta se puede disfrutar de los juegos mecánicos, fuegos artificiales, exposiciones agrícolas y ganaderas, así como los bailes popoulares. La región atesora una gran danza tradicional en la cual los bailarines hacen gala del traje típico que consta de un huipil (falda) hecho de manta, listón y bordados a mano. 

Cisne es el nombre del grupo que integran cinco mujeres; el nombre lo eligieron por la admiración y gusto que tienen el animal. Las integrantes del grupo son:
Erika -Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo
Elizabeth –Venta De Refrescos, Calzado Por Catalogo 
Keren -Venta De Antojitos
Cecilia -Servicio De Carga
Avelina- Venta De Ropa

Avelina  es madre soltera de un niño de 8 años que estudia la primaria y por el momento viven en casa de los padres de Avelina, a quienes apoya con los gastos de la casa con el ingreso obtenido de su tienda de ropa, actividad que inició desde hace ya 4 años. Todos los días, Avelina abre su local después de dejar a su pequeño en la escuela; mediodía cierra nuevamente para ir por él a la escuela y comer con su familia; por la tarde, los dos regresan al local y sigue vendiendo mientras le ayuda a hacer la tarea. "Más que su madre, soy su mejor amiga" dice Avelina, ya que el niño le cuenta todo.

La idea de vender ropa surgió por el gusto por las compras, ella siempre viajó a la capital del país para comprar ropa para ella y para su hijo. Un día sus padres le animaron para que comprara más ropa y de regreso a la comunidad comenzó vendiendo de manera ambulante. Ahora ya cuenta con un local fijo y las ganancias las reinvierte en ropa casual para dama, caballero y niños además de satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su hijo. Avelina necesita un préstamo para aprovechar la temporada de frío que se acerca y comprar chalecos, suéteres, sudaderas, chamarras, entre otras prendas porque aunque la región donde vive es calurosa, durante diciembre y enero, sí hay una baja de temperatura. 

“Gracias por la oportunidad de crecer con nuestros negocios al otorgarnos un préstamo” comentó Avelina.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de la señora Erika, Avelina viste de blusa color naranja.
texts.en:
The municipality where this group is located is identified for its production of sugar cane. The most important festival is for San Eulogio, in honor of the patron saint of the municipality and during the festival one can enjoy rides, fireworks, agricultural and animal shows, and also the popular dances. The region has a great traditional dance in which the dancers display the traditional costume which consists of a huipil (skirt) made of a blanket, ribbon and embroidered by hand.

Cisne [swan] is the name of the group that is made up of five women. They chose the name for the admiration and the pleasure that the animal has. The group members are:

Erika - shoe sales by catalog
Elizabeth - soft drink sales, shoes by catalog
Keren - snack sales
Cecilia - delivery service
Avelina - clothing sales 

Avelina is a single mother of an 8-year-old son who is a primary school student and at the moment they live in the house of Avelina's parents, who she supports with the household expenses with an income she gets from her clothing store, a business she began 4 years ago. Every day, Avelina opens her shop after dropping off her little one at school. At midday she closes again to get him at school and eat with her family, in the afternoon, the two go back to the shop and continue selling while she helps him with his homework. "More than his mother, I am his best friend," Avelina says, since the boy tells her everything. 

The idea to sell clothing came up from her enjoyment of shopping, she always traveled to the country's capital to purchase clothing for herself and her son. On day, her parents encouraged her to buy more clothing and when she returned to the community she began to sell it as a street vendor. Now she has a fixed locale and she reinvests her earnings in casual clothing for women, men, and children, in addition to meeting the needs she and her son have. Avelina needs a loan to take advantage of the cold season that is approaching and purchase vests, sweaters, sweatshirts, and jackets, among other clothing because although the region where they live is warm, during December and January there is a drop in the temperature.

"Thanks for the opportunity to grow with our businesses by offering us a loan," Avelina says. 

*The photo was taken in Erika's house, Avelina wears the orange blouse.

loans.use: to purchase vests, sweaters, sweatshirts, and jackets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Sarah sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last four years. She gets additional income from two rental houses. She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACC0 to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses.

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Shahboz

texts.ru:
Шахбоз родился в городе  Истаравшан  в  семье рабочего. Ему 19 лет.  Он не  женат. Шахбоз учится на первом курсе Худжанского Государственного Института. Он очень трудолюбивый и добродушный парень. В свободное от учебы время он занимается ремонтом машин в мастерской. В день он зарабатывает от 30 до 35 сомони. Отец Шахбоза торгует на местном рынке. 
     Шахбоз хочет получить кредит для оплаты договора учебы. Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Shahboz was born into a worker's family in the town of Istaravshan. He is 19 years old. He is not married. Shahboz is a first-year student of the Khujand State University. He is a very hardworking and kind young man. He is involved in repairing cars at an auto shop in his free time. He earns from 30 to 35 somoni. Shahboz's father sells at a local market. Shahboz wants to obtain this loan to pay for his university tuition. He thanks MDO Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of ice cream flavors, disposable serving items and cutlery to serve her ice cream

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer from Tajiri village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Emmanuel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She has operated a retail shop at the market for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more cooking oil, soap, flour, beans, rice, boxes of biscuits and crates of soda. Her challenges include high rental charges and electricity. Her dream is to increase her sales, so as to stock more goods. The weekly repayment program attracted her to join MCDT.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, flour, beans, soap and crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, en casa propia en el caserío de Cerro León, es una comunidad pequeña donde se respira la paz y tranquilidad. Sus pobladores están dedicados básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jose Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte urbano en su mototaxi, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro, Jose Luis presta este servicio en su distrito y los alrededores, él solicita préstamo para el arreglo de su vehículo, pues con esto Jose Luis pretende asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo; dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros y así poder captar nuevos clientes y seguir fidelizando a los que ya tiene, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 25 year sold, lives with his spouse in his own house in the village of Cerro León, a small community which breathes peace and tranquility. Its inhabitants work basically in agriculture, animal husbandry and in trade. This community is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Labayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Jose Luis works offering urban transportation service with his motorcycle taxi, with more than 3 years in this field. Jose Luis offers this service in his district and the surrounding area. He asks for a loan to repair his vehicle and, with this, Jose Luis plans to assure the proper functioning of his work tool. This investment will serve him to be able to offer a better service to his passengers and in this way attract new customers and continue developing the loyalty of those he already has. In the short term, this will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings, and in the end, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle, since with this Jose Luis plans to assure the proper functioning of his work took.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una viuda de 55 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos 3 de ellos jóvenes con ilusiones y sueños de entrar a una universidad, lo cual aún no ha podido lograr pues Tatiana no tiene el capital para sostener una casa y pagar la costosa matricula. Tiene una venta de mercancía de uso doméstico y uso personal como cremas de manos, licuadoras, desodorante, talco, electrométricos etc.
Tatiana busca a través de un crédito invertir en electrodomésticos pues son productos de buen movimiento de venta y que dejan buena utilidad.
Sus sueños son poder comprar una casa, tener un carro para pasear con sus hijos, pero se enfocara en mejorar su negocio para poder cumplir los sueños de sus hijos de darles un estudio.
texts.en: María is a 55 year old widow, mother of 4 children, 3 of them teens with illusions and dreams of studying at the university, which they have not yet been able to achieve as Tatiana doesn't have the capital to support her home and pay the expensive tuition. She has a business selling household and personal use merchandise such as hand creams, blenders, deodorant, talcum powder, small electrical appliances, etc.  Tatiana seeks a loan to buy electrical small appliances, which are products that tend to sell during this season and are very useful. Her dreams are to be able to buy a house, have a car to go out with her children, but she is focuses on improving her business in order to be able to meet the dreams of her children in giving them an education.

loans.use: to buy electrical small appliances, which are products that tend to sell during this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products such as perfumes, clothing, deodorants, and cosmetics among others.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Маърифат жительница село Турсунзода  Шахристанского района. Маърифат замужем и имеет двух детей.  Её дочь учиться  в  Худжандском Государствнном Университете на третьем  курсе. Она  занимается дехканством, а  её муж пастух.  Она по объявлению узнала о том, что в МДО Арванд выдают  кредит для оплаты учебы студентов по низким процентам.Она подала заявку на кредит  Маърифат  заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Marifat is a resident of the Tursun-zoda village of the Shahriston district. Marifat is married and has two children. Her daughter is a third-year student of the Khujand State University. Marifat is involved in dekhan farming, and her husband is shepherd. She learned from an advertising that MDO Arvand offers low-interest education loans for students. She put in a request for the loan. Marifat is grateful in advance for the financial support and help.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university education

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Julius, Anthony and Lobina.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Joseph would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Joseph can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Joseph spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат замужняя женщина в возрасте 36 лет. Ее муж гастарбайтер в Российской Федерации. Она живет вместе с тремя детьми в Таджикистане, в населенном пункте под названием Турсунзаде. Турсунзаде маленький район с не большим населением. Малохат дома занимается животноводством. У нее имеется корова и одна коза. Малохат имеет все условия для животноводческой деятельности, в том числе коровник и корм. Единственная преграда, по которой Малохат не может расширить бизнес и увеличить доход, чтобы улучшить жизненные условия семьи, является нехватка финансов. У нее нет денег, для купли скотин. Она собрала немного денег, но ей все равно необходимо сумма для купли скотов. Малохат решила обратиться за кредитом, и считает, что это является правильным выбором. Поддержите Малохат!
texts.en: Malohat is a married 36-year-old woman. Her husband is a guest worker in the Russian Federation. She lives together with her three children in Tajikistan, in a residential area called Tursun-zoda. Tursun-zoda is a small district with not a lot of  population. Malohat is involved in animal husbandry at home. She has a cow and one goat. Malohat has all of the necessary conditions for the animal husbandry business, including a cowshed and livestock feed. The only barrier to her expanding the business and increasing her income in order to improve the family's living conditions is a shortage of finances. She does not have money to buy livestock. She saved some money, but still needs money to buy livestock. Malohat decided to request this loan and thinks that this is the right choice. Please support Malohat!

loans.use: to buy small livestock and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelving to store his products.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman living in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is 33 years old and has four children. She earns a living by mean of raising and selling hogs. She has been selling hogs for almost nine years now. 

Michelle has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy pig feed, to pay for the construction of a pigpen, and to buy farm supplies for a start-up. She will be very grateful, that she will now continue her livelihood, and probably this could be the way of going to the piggery business. At the same time, she could now start farming, toiling the land and growing rice. Thus, this could help Michelle's family improve their status of living. She is hoping that she can handle both of her businesses for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, to pay for the construction of a pigpen, and to buy farm supplies for a start-up.

loans.name: Isiyaku Mallam

texts.en:
Isiyaku Mallam is a maize farmer from Makera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku Mallam would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Isiyaku Mallam, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine has a grocery business in Eldoret town, and she has been running this business for five years now. She is 27 years old, widowed and a mother of two children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, vegetables and cereals for use in her business. This will enable her to serve more customers and to make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy stock of potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Yaneth De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Yaneth es una mujer de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Tierra Alta con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de bebidas tipo bolis. 
Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de estas bebidas. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido, intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 
Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido de bebidas en bolis al por mayor y para adecuaciones locativas exigidas por el INVIMA.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Yaneth is a woman who has fought a thousand battles over her lifetime. She lives in the Tierra Alta municipality with her husband and two minor children. She is a very hard-working woman and for some time she has been working selling beverages in juice pouches ("bolis"). Her business consists of buying and selling this kind of beverage. She offers her products as a street vendor and when a client has a request, she tries to satisfy the request to the best of her ability. She states that is is a simple business to do. She seeks a loan to buy a stock of beverages in pouches at wholesale and to make legal adaptations required by INVIMA. The loan will give her the opportunity to capitalize her business and give her a considerable push in her business, enabling her to obtain the economic resources for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of beverages at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35-year-old, single lady. With her five years of experience in selling shoes and bags, she decided to open her own shop almost a year ago, to increase her income and to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of three.

Today, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter shoes to satisfy her customers' needs in the Christmas season.

Fatima is the sole earner of her family, and she is trying desperately to satisfy their needs. Thus, this loan is very important to her, for it will increase her income and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter shoes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband is a fisherman.

Lelanie wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Therefore, she joined CEVI to borrow a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, biscuits and snack foods. With a loan, Lelanie will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Lelanie hopes to improve her store in order to generate more income. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 29 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She has a beauty salon and a boutique. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of beauty products, body lotions and clothes to sell in her boutique business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and body lotions for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es:
Gloria una mujer casada sin hijos que opera ambulantemente un negocio de venta de mercancía, entre la que se destaca accesorios para mujer y toda clase de repuesto para celulares, y accesorios para ellos.
Su negocio ha ido sufriendo un declive pues la competencia que tiene con los diferentes almacenes que ponen los proveedores principales de celulares en el país es muy fuerte en cuanto a precios.
Pensando en este problema la señora gloria quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de accesorios y estuches para celulares, sin descuidar sus accesorios para mujer.
Gloria sueña con ser una competencia para estas empresas pues depende de su negocio para comer, para pagar una cuenta de servicios públicos. para todo
texts.en: Gloria is a married woman without children who operates a mobile business selling merchandise, which includes women's accessories and spare parts and accessories for cell phones.  Her business has been suffering a decline, as there is stiff competition from various stores that sell the goods of major cellular providers in the country.  In thinking of this problem, Gloria requests a loan to buy accessories and cases for cell phones, without neglecting her women's accessories.  Gloria dreams of competing with these businesses, as she depends on her own business to be able to eat, pay the bills, and for all her expenses.

loans.use: to buy telephone accessories and accessories for women

loans.name: John

texts.en: John needs a loan to pay school fees. He is a single hardworking man. He has been a banker for three years. Due to the demand of a living, he joined banking. John dreams of completing his studies but he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to pay his tuition on time. John has thus asked for a loan to pay his school fees when due.

loans.use: to pay his school fees when due.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en: Habibu is a maize farmer from Auchan village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Habibu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate the house.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a 32-year-old, hard-working man. He is married with one eight-year-old child who attends school. He deals in produce, mainly in the buying and selling of maize and beans, among other items. He desires to grow and expand his business. However, price fluctuations hinder his desire. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Brigida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Brígida, de 35 años de edad, está soltera y aun no tiene hijos.- Vive con sus padres en el campo.

Actualmente, se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y pollos de engorde, negocio que le genera buenos ingresos para el sustento de ella y su mamá.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para sus animales y engordarlos para venderlos el próximo mes.- Además, quiere arreglar un corral para que tengan más espacio ya que una cerda está a punto de parir y tienen que estar en un ambiente adecuado para sus crías.

Brígida, en un futuro sueña con tener una granja propia con más espacio para sus animales y hacer crianza de otras especies como pavo, cabras y vacas.
texts.en: Brígida is 35 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives with her parents in the country. Today she raises and sells pigs and chickens, a business that generates good income to support her and her mother. The loan is needed to buy feed concentrate and vitamins for her animals and fatten them to sell the next month. In addition, she wants to fix the corral so that they have more space as a certain pig is at the point of giving birth and they have to have an adequate place for the piglets.  Brigida dreams about having her own farm in the future with more space for her animals and raising other species such as turkeys, goats, and cows.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate and vitamins for her animals and fatten them to sell the next month.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of her niece. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis and she has been in this business for the last 19 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She generates additional income from hiring out her motorcycle. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used bales of clothes. She aspires to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Yeni Dolores

texts.es: Yeni tiene 38 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, casada con un grado de estudios de primaria completo. Sus hijos 3 de ellos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación y uno está en el kinder. Ella aprendió dicha actividad de sus padres y en compañía de su esposo sigue ejerciendo dicha actividad pues como fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia es la única forma ya que en la comunidad donde habitan no hay fuentes de empleo que puedan dar una estabilidad laboral y generar un salario digno y estable a finales de cada 15 días o cada mes. En ocasiones mientras su esposo está en el campo ella también realiza otra clase de actividades como la elaboración de tamales de res y de cerdo además del pan de casa productos que son vendidos en la comunidad entre sus vecinos, amigos y demás que ahí habitan. El terreno donde vive y tiene sus cultivos son patrimonio por parte de su esposo quien le apoya a varias actividades agrícolas y en lo económico, sus terrenos de cultivos están cerca de su casa por lo cual le permite tener más cuidado sobre los mismos y un mejor mantenimiento. Yeni Solicita financiamiento a través de los fondos KIVA para mejorar las condiciones de sus cultivos de café, de esta manera mantener sus plantas en mejores condiciones para esta nueva temporada pues es una de sus mayores necesidades a cubrir en este momento ya que esto generara al final de la cosecha utilidades sobre su cafetal y de esa manera poder comprar útiles escolares y alimentación para sus hijos. Su meta poder hacer la limpieza de su propiedad, mejorar la producción y los ingresos económicos ya que quiere sembrar 3000 plantas más de café esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas.
texts.en:
Yeni is 38 years old, a mother of 4 children, married, and completed an elementary education. 3 of her children study in the community school in different grades and one is in kindergarten. She learned how to farm from her parents and in the company of her husband she continues working as this is the source of income for their family and it is the only form of work in the community where they live as there are not any other sources of employment that can give steady work and a dignified salary every 15 days or monthly. On occasion while her husband is in the field she also does other work such as making beef and pork tamales, bread, and other products that are sold in the community among the neighbors, friends, and others that live there.

The land where they live and have their crops were inherited from her husband's family. He supports them through farming and the land they cultivate are near their house which enables them to have more care for the land and allows for better maintenance.

Yeni seeks financing from KIVA to improve her coffee crops, in this way maintaining her plants in better condition. During this new season this is one of the greater needs to be covered at this moment so that at the time of harvesting the coffee there will be income to be able to buy school supplies and food for the children.

Her goal is to be able to clear the land, improve the crop production and income as they want to plant 3000 more coffee plants. They are hoping to be supported by the various investors.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to provide assistance to her coffee, corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Elsa Lisseth

texts.es:
Elsa, de 23 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora y madre soltera, apoya económicamente a su familia.- Sus hermanos tuvieron que emigrar a Estados Unidos para mejorar la condición económica en que vivían, pero lastimosamente no lo lograron. 

Elsa, decidió estudiar y terminar su bachillerato, luego estudió un curso de cosmetología, para colocar una sala de belleza, pero no lo consiguió. 

Elsa, trabaja como ordenanza en una escuela para niños con capacidades especiales, tiene cuatro años de trabajar allí; ella dice que le gusta su trabajo. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar carne, pollo, camarones, tomates, cebollas, chiles y todo lo necesario para hacer comida y venderla.- El negocio es de su madre, está creciendo y necesita invertir, adicional a este negocio también tienen cien pollos de engorde que esperan venderlos en época navideña.-

Actualmente, les hace falta concentrado para completar el proceso de engorde, pero con estas inversiones, Elsa, espera que su familia tenga mayores ingresos al finalizar el año.

El principal sueño de Elsa, es retomar sus estudios, ya que con eso tendrá  mejores oportunidades para superarse.
texts.en:
Elsa is 23 years old. She is a hardworking young woman and a single mother who supports her family financially. Her siblings had to immigrate to the United States to improve the financial condition they were living in, buy unfortunately they didn't achieve that. 

Elsa decided to go to school and finish high school. Later she studied cosmetology in order to open a beauty salon, but she wasn't able to.

Elsa works as an administrative assistant in a school for children with special needs. She has been working there for four years and she says she likes her job. She will use the loan to buy meat, chicken, shrimp, tomatoes, onions, chiles and everything she needs to make food and sell it. It is her mother's business. It is growing and she needs to invest. She also has one hundred broiler chickens that she hopes to sell at Christmas time.

Right now, she needs concentrate to complete the fattening process. With these investments, Elsa hopes for her family to have more income at the end of the year.

Elsa's main dream is to return to her education, because that will bring more opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, shrimp, tomatoes, onions, chiles and everything she needs to make food and sell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flagstone flooring for his home renovation project.

loans.name: Blenda Carolina

texts.es:
Blenda, de 28 años de edad, es una  joven emprendedora, está acompañada y tiene un hijo, es dueña de un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, que les ayuda para el sustento de su casa, día a día ellos promueven sus productos a sus clientes, ellos están involucrados y comprometidos con el desarrollo económico de su familia e  indirectamente a su comunidad. 

Blenda, se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, el negocio comenzó con productos básicos y necesarios para las familias de la comunidad pero con el pasar del tiempo la demanda comenzó a subir, es así como ella decide adquirir otros productos.- Ahora ella cuenta con su tiendita, manteniendo su clientela por su forma de atender y la confianza generada por su amabilidad.

La actividad económica que ellos realizan se encuentra en crecimiento de clientes y demanda de productos, es por eso que se necesita el apoyo de la institución para comprar arroz, azucar, frijoles, pan, cafe, entre otros. Además, quiere hacerle mejoramientos y ampliación al local. 

Para un futuro Blenda, espera que su actividad económica logre crecer con el apoyo que la institución le dé.
texts.en:
Blenda, 28, is a young entrepreneur. She is married and has a son. She owns a small business selling staple goods which helps her to sustain her home. Everyday she promotes her products to her customers. She is very involved and committed to the economic development of her family and, indirectly, the development of her community.

Blenda has been in business for several years. She began the business with basic products and necessities for families in the community. With the passage of time, the demand began to rise which is how she decided to acquire other products. Now she has her store. She keeps her clientele by her way of caring and generating trust by her kindness.

She performs this economic activity and the demands of her customers for products is growing. She needs the support of this institution to buy rice, sugar, beans, bread, coffee, and more. She also wants to make improvements and expansions to her store. 

For the future, Blenda expects her income to grow with the support given by the institution.

loans.use: to stock her store with rice, sugar, beans and more.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Kitopeni Group

texts.en:
Mohamedi, who is 43 years old, is married and a father of three children in school. He is a businessman, supporting his family by running a genge (grocery store) selling fruits and vegetables. He has been in this business for 12 years, working from 5:00am to 6:00pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, he used the previous one, since paid successfully, to buy genge (grocery store) items. Mohamedi earned an extra income, which he used to cover school fees and food costs for his family. In order to keep moving forward, Mohamedi approached Tujijenge again to request a new loan. He will invest this credit to buy fruits and vegetables. He dreams of managing a big shop selling a variety of products. 

Mohamedi will share this loan with his group, Tujikomboe Kitopeni, totaling five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Renejoy

texts.en:
From Iloilo, Philippines, Renejoy is a thirty-year-old married man and the father of a four-year-old child. For the past seven years he has earned an income running a small carenderia, or restaurant.

Renejoy would like to be able to cook and sell more food to his customers, so he is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy more ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice and soft drinks. He is always working to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the meals he serves at his carenderia.

loans.name: Lucero De La Villa Group

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 7 hijos de 21, 20, 19, 17, 15, 12 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área colonizada por nativos de la etnia ‘Ayoreos’ y por mineros relocalizados del occidente del país. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Erika es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio. su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores trabajan y los 4 menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Sus ganas por ampliar su negocio la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de fruta, venta de tomates y confección de tejidos, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, como; pantalones de jean y blusas de mujer. Las variedades que ofrece varían en colores, texturas, diseños, etc. Su venta la realiza en la calle bajo una sombrilla en donde cuelga sus prendas y otras las exhibe sobre una mesa, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 9 de mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. “debes ser lo más cauteloso posible a la hora de mostrar lo que ofreces, no se debe descuidar detalles, piensa que tienes que hacerlo como si fueras a presentarlo a la productora o cliente más importante...” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia donde pueda vender bajo techo, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa usada por mayor para abaratar costos y cumplir con sus clientes de temporada. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para cumplir con sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Erika is a 48 year old woman. She is married and has 7 children, aged 21, 20, 19, 17, 15, 12 and 10. Her business is selling used clothing.  She is a good mother who is cheerful, optimist, happy, and has a good attitude. She is committed to her work and is responsible and hardworking. She does her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ area. It is colonized by the ‘Ayoreos’ ethnic group and by miners who have relocated from the western part of the country. It has a warm, tropical and humid climate with a temperature that varies between 18-35 degrees celsius during the day.
  
Erika has dark skin, long, black hair she wears tied back, and is of medium stature. Her maternal tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for business.  She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and their children. The three oldest work and the 4 youngest go to school. They live in their own home made of brick. It has potable water and electricity.
