Wanting to expand her business drove her to make a bank of people with businesses such as selling sandwiches, artisanal items made from plaster, selling beverages, a bookstore, selling fruit, selling tomatoes and making weavings. This was so that they could ask for a loan and prosper in their businesses. Her business is selling used clothing such as jeans and women's blouses. The clothing she offers varies in color, texture, design, etc. She sells in the street under an umbrella where she hangs some items, while she displays others on a table. She does this work every day of the week from 9 a.m. until 7 in the evening. “You have to be very careful when you are showing what you offer. You can't ignore details. You have to do it as if you were going to show it to the most important producer or customer...", she says. Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell under a roof. She wants to make an investment in her business through buying used clothing wholesale to lower costs and meet her customers' demands for the season. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in 5 years that she has been doing this activity.  

That is why Erika is asking for a loan to buy used clothing wholesale to meet her customers' demands for the season.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing wholesale to meet her customers' demand for the season.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. For the past several years she and her husband have earned an income fishing using such gear as the net pictured beside her.

Elizabeth is is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new outboard motor. This loan will enable the couple to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Elizabeth’s expressed hope is to see their fishing business be a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new outboard motor.

loans.name: Majnun

texts.en:
Majnun is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“My name is Majnun, a graduate of Aga Khan Lyceum in Khorog, Tajikistan. Upon passing my final examinations as a school leaver, I set a goal to pursue a career in the field of Business Administration. It has been a part of my plans since I became aware of the role and function of the economy in a country’s prosperity. 

Tajikistan was the poorest republic of the Soviet Union and is now the poorest country in Central Asia. At present, the youth of Tajikistan are trying to get good educations in foreign countries and then return and support their own country. I am one of them; I care not just about my family and my relatives, but also my country. 

I have a big family of five: my parents, me and two brothers. My father worked as an Instructor at school, but currently is unemployed due to the expiration of contract terms; he is looking for a new job. My mother has always worked as a doctor at the local polyclinic, which is her second home. My elder brother is a university student and my youngest one is a school-boy. Although my family’s income is not so much, my parents have always tried to support us as much as possible, but I know it will not be sufficient to cover my university tuition fee.

I was a diligent student at school and even won the President Grant in 11th grade; my parents were so proud of me. That grant is given to the school-children who had good academic performances and the best extra-curricular activities in school life. 

So, now I dream of getting a high quality education at the most prestigious university in Central Asia. AUCA is the place where I can improve my skills and gain sufficient knowledge in the area I wish to pursue.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard lives in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of beans, maize, and g-nuts (peanuts), among other items. He also gets additional income from farming. He has a dream of expanding and developing his business into new markets. However, price fluctuations hinder his business desire. Benard will use the loan facility to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Sor Aleida

texts.es:
Sor es una confeccionista a terceros de 33 años madre de una hija de 4 años y felizmente casada que inicio su negocio en el 2009 gracias a las enseñanzas de un amigo que la entreno y la capacito en todo lo relacionado en confección.
Sor busca mejorar sus ventas, incrementar sus ventas, pero tiene un impedimento que son los altos costos de insumos de confección y de la maquinaria.
Sor presenta una necesidad y es una maquina plana ya que la que tenia se le averió y no tiene arreglo por ello solicita un crédito para comprarlo y empezar nuevamente funciones.
Sor necesita tu ayuda urgente apoya a esta mujer que solo tiene su negocio para generar ingresos.
texts.en: Sor is a seamstress. She is 33 years old and mother of a 4 year old daughter. She is happily married. She began her business in 2009 thanks to a friend's teachings that trained her and taught her everything related to the profession. Sor seeks to improve her sales, but she has an impediment to increasing her sales in that the costs of sewing supplies and machinery are high. Sor has the need for a sewing machine as the one she had is broken and can't be fixed. So she seeks a loan to buy one and begin to work again. Sor needs your support urgently as she only has this business with which to generate income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine as the one she has is broken.

loans.name: Elianna

texts.en:
Elianna is a 24-year-old, single lady who started seven years ago working as a manicurist to help in covering the needs and expenses of her family.

Elianna is a self-made lady of professional skills who succeeded with her talent to gain loyal customers. She is a very ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan to buy special nail polish colors and nail care tools to satisfy her customers' needs and provide them with better service.

Elianna hopes to expand her business more in the future through buying a laser machine to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy special nail polish colors and nail care tools.

loans.name: Selvi

texts.es:
Selvi es una mujer de 42 años de edad que con su empresa busca cambiar vidas, que las personas adopten hábitos salubres, tratar de inculcar y difundir la importancia de cuidarse uno mismo, por ello inicio con la venta de productos de consumo personal que ayudan al cuidado del cuerpo.
Selvi también mira esto tanto como razón social como empresa pues gracias a los ingresos que obtiene por las ventas puede mantener su hogar conformado por 2 hijos adolescentes. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar en la empresa que trabaja mayor cantidades de productos para el cuidado del cuerpo y sueña con que su mensaje sea oído y aplicado por muchas personas y que inicien de una vez a adoptar un hábito saludable de alimentación
texts.en:
Selvi is a 42-year-old woman who seeks to change lives with her business, specifically, by helping people adopt healthy habits and by trying to instill and spread the importance of caring for oneself.  This is why she started selling products for personal consumption to help care for one’s body.  Selvi sees this as much of a social mission as a business.  Thanks to the income that she obtains from her sales, she can sustain her household, made up of two teenage sons. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase greater quantities of healthy products for her business.  She dreams that her message be heard and put to use by many people and that they start to adopt healthy eating habits.

loans.use: to buy health-focused products for personal consumption in order to change others’ eating habits

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is forty years old and has two children who both attend school. He farms as well as sells tomatoes and onions in the marketplace. One problem he identifies as a vendor is selling a perishable product.

Charles is applying for a 500,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy more tomatoes to sell. He has hopes of developing his business as well as educating his children.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Estelia Noemi

texts.es:
Estelia de 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad que acaba de cursar su primer año en el kínder. Solo pudo estudiar hasta primer grado, al ser madre soltera tiene que trabajar para mantener a su hijo. Vive con su madre y su hija.

Es comerciante, tiene una venta de refrescos, golosinas y comida rápida desde hace tres años, también vende artículos de belleza como perfumes y cremas por catálogos. Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el negocio de artículos de belleza, ya que es muy importante tener productos de muestra para garantizar la mercadería al cliente.

Espera que su hija estudie y tenga las oportunidades con la que ella no pudo contar para que se gana la vida más fácil.
texts.en: Estelia is 24 year old, single, and has a 5 year old daughter who just finished her first year of kindergarten. Estelia could only complete 1st grade. As a single mother she has to work to support her child. She lives with her mother and daughter. She has had a business selling refreshments, candy, and fast food for three years. She also sells beauty products such as perfumes and creams by catalog. She seeks a loan to buy beauty products, as it is important to have products to show in order to guarantee merchandise for the customer. She hopes that her daughter attends school and has opportunities that she didn't have so that her daughter can earn a living more easily than she.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en: Bunthy is the 19-year-old daughter of a farmer family in Prey Veng province in Cambodia and she is studying accounting and finance in her first year at the university in a city. While she is lacking financial support, she would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees for four years. This loan will help her graduate and provide her with a skill for her future job. After graduation, she wants to work in a company in the city.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Edita, who is in her early 30's, is married with three children, two of whom are still in school and the other one is still young. She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and a genge (grocery store) business, for five years now.  

This will be Edita's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and restock the out-of-stock items in the genge (grocery store). She dreams of building her own house. 

Edita will share this loan with her loan group "Saranga," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal and restock the out-of-stock items in the genge (grocery store).

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros has sold clothes for twenty years now in Armenia. He rents a stall in his city’s marketplace where he sells women’s and men’s clothes, such as jeans, trousers, blouses, dresses, etc. From Yerevan’s wholesale market he drives his merchandise in a rented car to his stall once a month. His business is the only source of income for his family, which is why he works hard not only to keep his regular customers but also to attract new buyers.

Petros greatly wishes for a third loan through Kiva and Nor Horizon both to pay for educating his son and developing his business. With 400,000 AMD he will buy new winter clothes to sell, as until next spring they will be in great demand.

loans.use: to buy new winter clothes to sell from his market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs, vegetables, and fruits to go out on the street with his cart and look for customers.

loans.name: Josué Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer de 25 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos de de 5 y 3 años de edad. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica, porque su familia no pudo pagar sus estudios. Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos dependen de él.

Elmer es comerciante vende pan dulce y francés en su motocicleta tiene más de 4 años realizando esta actividad que aprendió gracias a un amigo. Trabaja todos los días recorriendo aproximadamente 22 kilómetros. Solicita el préstamo para reparar su motocicleta e invertir el su negocio. Sueña con dar estudio a sus hijos y construir su propia casa
texts.en:
Elmer, 25, is in a relationship and has two children ages 5 and 3. He was only able to attend school through fourth grade of primary school because his family couldn’t pay for his education. His wife works from home and just she and their two children depend on him.

Elmer is a vendor who sells sweet bread and French bread from his motorcycle. He has done this work for over four years and learned from a friend. He works every day, traveling around 22 kilometers. He is requesting this loan to repair his motorcycle and invest in his business. He dreams of giving his children an education and building his own home.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Solidario Triunfadoras En Jesus Group

texts.es: Solidario Triunfadoras en Jesus La encargada de este grupo es la señora Maria Paula quien se dedica a la venta de verduras como ejote, tomate, papa, güisquil, zanahoria,  hierbas como macuy, acelga, chipilín también vende quesos, leche por botella y crema desde hace 20 años. Su sueño es tener un lugar grande, bonito, con techo ya que vende en una esquina de la calle de la colonia donde tiene su puesto de verdura que lo está alquilando y el lugar es muy pequeño. Las buenas fechas de venta están cerca y los clientes ya están comprando por varias libras de verdura porque vende por mayor, necesita comprar entonces mas verdura para no quedarles mal a las personas que confían en ella y aprovechar las ventas de estas fechas de fin de año muy buenas para vender.
texts.en: The woman in charge of the Solidary Group Triunfadoras en Jesus is Maria Paula who makes a living selling vegetables like green beans, tomato, potato, pear squash, carrot, and herbs like macuy, chard, and chipilín. She has also been selling cheeses, bottled milk, and cream for 20 years. Her dream is to have a large, beautiful place with a roof since now she sells on the corner of a neighborhood street where she has her vegetable stand which she is renting and the space is very small. The best dates to sell are near and the customers now buy various pounds of vegetables because she sells wholesale. So she needs to buy more vegetables in order not to disappoint the people that trust her and to take advantage of the sales at the end of the year which are very good for selling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Independencia Group

texts.es:
El camino que conduce a la comunidad donde se consolidó el grupo llamado Independencia está rodeado de plantaciones de caña y muy cerca también se ubica una fábrica azucarera. Durante la época de cosecha, los habitantes que trabajan en la fábrica, inician su día a las 4 am. 

El grupo eligió su nombre debido a que se consideran personas independientes, por ejercer una actividad que les ofrece libertad y ganancias para procurar a su familia. Los integrantes del grupo son:

Teresa –Manualidades Y Bisutería
Karem - Venta De Ropa Para Dama
Pablo -Venta De Abarrotes
Laura -Venta De Perfumes Y Oro Laminado
Francisco -Carpintería
Rogelio -Venta De Comida Y Taco
Juana -Venta De Plata Y Bolsas

Doña Teresa tiene 44 años de edad y está casada con el señor Humberto, tienen una hija de 17 años y un hijo de 16. Don Humberto trabaja como chofer y ella como auxiliar de un médico. Hace dos años Teresa recibió un curso por parte del gobierno donde le enseñaron a elaborar bolsas de manta bordadas con listón o pintadas. Más tarde recibió otro curso de bisutería donde aprendió hacer pulseras, collares, aretes los cuales vende entre sus conocidos. Demostrando su entusiasmo y participación, hace poco Teresa también participó en un curso de repostería y ahora también se dedica a hacer pasteles que vende únicamente por pedido. Teresa se muestra feliz con sus actividades y apoyada por su familia, porque saben trabajar en equipo, en muchas ocasiones, tanto su esposo como sus hijos le apoyan en la venta de sus productos ofreciéndolos en los círculos donde se desenvuelven. 

Actualmente Teresa necesita un préstamo para comprar hilo, manta, pinturas, pedrería de diferentes colores y palitos para aretes, debido a que es el material que le falta en estos momentos. El formar parte del grupo y que VisionFund les dé a todos una oportunidad, motiva aun más a Teresa para continuar con sus actividades. Con sus ganancias y el sueldo de su esposo quiere continuar apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios de la mejor manera. En lo profesional comentó  “espero poder abrir una pequeña pastelería en casa pues en un año dejaré de trabajar con el médico, y tendré todo el tiempo para estar en casa produciendo ganancias”

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Francisco, Doña Teresa viste falda color café y suéter beige.
texts.en:
The road leading to the community where the group called "Independencia" was formed is surrounded by sugarcane plantations, and there is also a sugar factory very close. During harvest time the inhabitants who work at the factory start their day at 4 am. The group chose their name because they consider themselves independent people since they work in jobs that offer them freedom and earnings to support their families. The members of the group are: Teresa – Handcrafts and costume jewelry, Karem - sale of women's clothing, Pablo - sale of grocery store items, Laura - sale of perfumes and laminated gold, Francisco -Carpentry, Rogelio -Sale of food and tacos, Juana -Sale of silver and bags. Teresa is 44 years old and is married to Humberto. They have a 17 year old daughter and a 16 year old son. Humberto works as a driver and she works as a doctor's assistant. Two years ago Teresa took a class offered by the government where she learned how to make painted bags and bags embroidered with laces. Later she took another class of costume jewelry where she learned to make bracelets, necklaces, earrings, which she sells to acquaintances. Showing her enthusiasm and participation, recently Teresa also participated at a baking course, and now she also works making cakes that she sells only by order. Teresa is happy with her activities and supported by her family, because they know how to work as a team. Many times her husband as well as her children support her in selling her products by offering them in the places where they socialize. Currently, Teresa needs a loan to buy thread, blanket, paint, glass stones in different colors and pins fro earrings, which is the material she does not have at the moment. Forming part of the group and VisionFund's opportunity motivates Teresa even more to continue with her job. With her earnings and her husband's salary, she wants to keep on supporting her children so they finish their education in the best manner. Professionally she commented: "I hope to be able to open a small bakery at home, because in a year I will stop working with the doctor and I will have the whole time to be at home producing income”.
*The photograph was taken at Francisco's house. Teresa is wearing a brown skirt and a beige sweater.

loans.use: to buy thread, blanket, paint, cut crystal stones in different colors and little pins for earrings.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, de 54 años de edad, es una persona que se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella no estudió, es divorciada y tiene un hijo que ya ésta acompañado. Gloria vive con la compañera de vida de su hijo y su único ingreso son las remesas que le envía el hijo como aporte a los gastos que se realizan en la casa y alimentación. 

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, arena  y grava para mejorar su vivienda, ya que no tiene suficientes fondos para cubrir los gastos que se generaran en materiales para reparar partes de la casa dañadas, tales como: el techo y parte de las paredes de la casa porque no son seguras.

En un futuro desea tener una casa más segura y una mejor así su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria, 54, is a person who dedicates herself to household duties. She did not attend school She is divorced and has a son who is already married. Gloria lives with her son’s wife and their only income is the remittances sent by her son as a contribution to the expenses of the house and food.

She is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and gravel to improve their home because she does not have sufficient funds to cover the expenses of these materials. It will be used to repair damaged parts of the house such as the roof and walls that are not safe.

In the future, she will have a safer home and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to fix her home's damaged roof and walls

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old and the single mother of one child. She has a stationery and photocopying shop which she has run as a business for three years. 

Sarah has requested her second loan from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loan. She will use this loan to buy more stocks of printing paper, pens, envelopes, notepads and notebooks, as well as another photocopying machine. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her child's school fees. 

In the future, Sarah hopes to open more stationery shops and to be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of printing paper, pens, envelopes, notepads and notebooks to sell, as well as another photocopying machine

loans.name: Hannatu Yakubu

texts.en: Hannatu Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Benjamin, Sadik and Nahemiah.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu Yakubu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu Yakubu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hannatu Yakubu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isaac David

texts.en: Isaac David is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isaac David joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Manasseh, Nathan and Moses.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isaac David would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isaac David can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isaac David  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for  doors, balconies, glass for windows and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beers to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Mariela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mariela es una madre que se gana la vida vendiendo mercancía de uso personal, como lo son perfumes, estuches para el maquillaje, y frascos para depositar alimentos.
Ella es una responsable, correcta y honrada mujer que tiene a 3 princesas como hijas ya mayores de edad, una de ella tiene 18 años y le pide como regalo de navidad poder entrar a la universidad. Mariela conmovida por este deseo busca la forma de mejorar sus ventas, llegar a más personas por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de paquetes promocionales por catálogo, donde le dan la oportunidad a las inscritas de comprar en cantidades a bajos precios y ella vendiendo podrá mejorar su utilidad recibida por cada prenda.
Mariela espera su apoyo, ella no solo quiere concederle el deseo de estudio a su hija, quiere comprar una vivienda y seguir siendo un apoyo incondicional para ellas.
texts.en:
Mariela is a mother who earns a living selling merchandise for personal use, such as perfumes, make-up cases, and containers for food.

She is a responsible, courteous, and honest woman who has three princesses as daughters, who are already adults. One of them is 18, and as a Christmas gift, she is asking to be able to enter the university. Mariela, moved by this desire, is seeking a way to improve her sales by reaching more people. To do this, she is applying for a loan to purchase promotional packets by catalog, where they give her the opportunity to buy in quantity at low prices to those registered, and on selling she will be able to improve the profits received for each item.

Mariela hopes for your help. She not only wants to concede to the desire of her daughter for an education, she also wants to buy a house and continue being an unconditional support for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy personal products, cosmetics, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Elsy Yaneth

texts.es:
Elsy, de 31 años de edad, está estudiando último año en la carrera de licenciatura en educación.- Con mucho esfuerzo ha podido seguir adelante con su estudio e ir criando a su pequeña hija.- Ella es madre soltera, después de tener a su hija, se separó de su compañero de vida por problemas en la relación. Ella pudo superar todos estos obstáculos; es así como ahora está a punto de graduarse.

Su familia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de condimentos para la comida y algunos son de uso medicinales.
También, trabaja como asesora de productos de belleza desde hace un año y los fines de semana los utiliza para estudiar.

El préstamo lo utilizará para pagar el derecho de graduación, que incluye pago de vestimenta académica, elaboración del título, entre otros gastos.- Estos son requisitos que debe cumplir para graduarse, pero en este momento no tiene la cantidad de dinero suficiente para cubrir esta necesidad. 

Con el préstamo podrá cumplir con los requisitos y logrará su sueño y posteriormente con su nuevo trabajo podrá ir pagando el crédito.

Su principal y más cercano deseo es, graduarse de licenciada en ciencias de la educación y de esta manera optar por mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Elsy, 31, is studying in her final year for a degree in Education. With hard work, she has progressed with her studies and raised her small daughter. She is a single mother. After having her daughter, relationship problems caused her to separate from her partner. She was able to overcome all these obstacles. This is how she is now about the graduate.

Her family has a small business selling condiments for food and some have medicinal purposes as well. She also works as a consultant selling beauty products for the last year. She uses her weekends for studying.

The loan will be used to pay for the fees related to graduation including the payment for academic dress, preparation of her diploma, and other expenses.

These are the requirements she must meet in order to graduate but, at this time, she does not have a sufficient amount of money to meet this need. With this loan, she can qualify for graduation and fulfill her dream. Later, with a new job she will repay the loan. Her main and most important desire is graduating with a degree in science education for even better job opportunities.

loans.use: to pay fees and expenses required to graduate

loans.name: Grisselda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Grisselda, de 27 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es propietaria de una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, también, tiene crianza de cerdos, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable.- 

Ella trabajo en una tienda cuando era joven y fue allí donde adquirió experiencia, luego decidió adquirir un crédito para poner su propia tienda y así comenzó con su negocio y lo mantiene hasta el día de hoy.- Con ayuda de su esposo dan el sustento diario a su familia y garantizan los derechos fundamentales a sus hijos. 

Grisselda, tiene 10 años de experiencia en trabajar con tienda y crianza de cerdos, dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres. 

El dinero será invertido para la ampliación y mejoramiento de su negocio y para comprar más cerdos para crianza.- Este negocio se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, las ganancias serán invertidas en el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

Los sueños de Grisselda son: ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad y que sean profesionales de éxito, también desea ampliar su negocio y montar otra tienda en otro caserío de su comunidad; todo esto lo va lograr con ayudad de otro financiamiento según expreso y también se proyecta comprar un vehículo en el futuro para que le facilite el traslado de los cerdos.
texts.en:
Griselda, who is 27 years old, has two children. She is the proprietor of a store where she sells basic necessities. She also has a business raising pigs. She is a very hard-working and responsible person.

She worked in a store when she was young, and it was there that she acquired experience. Then she decided to acquire a loan to set up her own store, and thus she began her business and she has maintained it up to this day. With the help of her husband, they give daily sustenance to their family and guarantee the fundamental rights of their children.

Grisselda has 10 years of experience in working in her store and raising pigs, an activity she learned from her parents.

The money will be invested to expand and improve her business and to buy more pigs to raise. This business has become her principal source of income. The earnings will be invested in improving her house.

Gisselda's dreams are to see her children graduate from the university and be successful professionals. She also wants to expand her business and set up another store in another village in her community. She is going to achieve all this with the help of another loan, as she says, and she also plans to buy a vehicle in the future to facilitate the transportation of the pigs.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business and buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

Grace sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 9 years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. She gets additional income from selling juice and drinking water. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes.

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Novedades Brayan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Novedades Brayan está integrado por tres mujeres que se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras, tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor; ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua, aunque poco a poco se ha estado perdiendo su cultura indígena, de hecho Raquel y Maricela no hablan la lengua de sus padres y Doña Emma ya ha olvidado algunas palabras por la falta de práctica. 

Raquel tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con Juan quien también es comerciante y juntos han formado un hogar con dos hijos: Brayan quien está estudiando su educación primaria y la pequeña Camila quien aún es pequeña para tomar clases. Hace 8 años Raquel y su esposo emprendieron la venta de ropa “Brayan ya existía en nuestras vidas por eso mismo necesitábamos tener un ingreso seguro para cubrir sus necesidades” comentó Raquel, aunque Juan ya contaba con la experiencia en ventas adquirida desde pequeño gracias a su padre. Cuando la pareja inició, no podía invertir demasiado en mercancía y no contaban con un lugar estable ya que la renta de los locales eran muy elevadas y lo poco que ganaban no era suficiente para cubrir ese gasto.

Raquel comenta que Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, pero sobre todo al apoyo de VisionFund, ahora tienen un local estable en un municipio muy concurrido lo que ayuda a tener buenas ventas. Raquel viaja con Doña Emma, su suegra, todos los días para llegar hasta donde tienen sus locales. 

Las tres integrantes están muy agradecidas con VisionFund y KIVA porque su préstamo les ayudará a tener más mercancía para aprovechar las ventas de ésta época del año. Específicamente Raquel podrá comprar chamarras y pants ya que el invierno ha llegado a México y este tipo de ropa se vende muy bien. Maricela, comprará más zapatos para vender y Emma comprará ropa e hilos. 

*La fotografía se tomó en el jardín del municipio. Raquel viste una chamarra color café.
texts.en:
The Novedades Brayan group is composed of three women who are characterized as hardworking. They have great entrepreneurial spirit. They are part of the Mazahua indigenous community but they have been gradually losing their culture. In fact, Raquel and Maricela do not speak the language of their parents and Emma has forgotten some words due to lack of practice. 

Raquel is 30 years old. She is married to Juan who is also a merchant. Together they have formed a household with two children, Brayan who is studying in elementary school and little Camila who is still too young for school. Eight years ago, Raquel and her husband began selling clothes. Raquel says: “Brayan already existed in our lives, that is why we needed to have a secure income to meet his needs.” Juan already had sales experience from when he was young thanks to his father. When the couple began, they could not invest too much in foods and did not have a stable store because the rents were very high. How little their earned was not enough to cover this expense. 

Raquel says that, thank to their effort and dedication but especially the support of VisionFund, they now have a stable home in a busy municipality that helps them have good sales. Raquel travels with Emma, her mother-in-law, everyday to get to where they have their store.

The three members of the group are very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because their loan will help them have more merchandise sales to take advantage of this time of year. Specifically, Raquel can buy jackets and pants as the winter has come to Mexico and this type of clothing is sold very well. Maricela will buy more shoes to sell and Emma will buy fabrics and threads.

*The photograph was taken in the park of their municipality. Raquel wears a brown jacket.

loans.use: to purchase jackets and pants to sell during the winter

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito, de 34 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora que día a día arriesga su vida por conseguir el sustento para su familia, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, ellos se encuentran estudiando educación básica y su pareja se encarga de los oficios domésticos.

Hipólito, se levanta muy temprano todos los días, con la esperanza y la fe de regresar en la noche para estar con su familia y poder cumplir su rol de padre después de un día agitado de mucho trabajo.

Desde muy joven, se interesó en aprender a manejar vehículo, de ahí surgió la necesidad de obtener la licencia.- Con el tiempo se le presentó la oportunidad de ejercer su labor como motorista en autobuses, en donde lleva 5 años desempeñándose como motorista.

A Hipólito, se le dificulta transportarse al lugar donde trabaja; aproximadamente tiene que caminar 5 kilómetros para llegar a ejercer sus labores, afectando mucho con sus horarios y actividades programadas para su trabajo y el tiempo que dedica a su familia. Es por eso que decidió solicitar un préstamo para comprarse una motocicleta y movilizarse fácilmente del trabajo a su hogar y viceversa.

El mejoramiento de su vivienda es una de las principales aspiraciones y espera que en un futuro se le concediera otro préstamo para realizarle mejoras.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 34 years old.  He is a hardworking person who puts his life at risk every day to support his family.  He is married and has two young children.  His children attend school and his partner takes care of their household.

Hipólito gets up early every day with the hope and faith of returning at night to be with his family and be a father after a hectic day of work.  Since he was young, he was interested in learning to drive, so he decided he needed to get his license.  In time, he got the opportunity to work as a bus driver, and he now has five years of experience as a bus driver.

It is difficult for Hipólito to transport himself to the place where he works.  He has to walk about five kilometers to get to work.  This affects his schedule and required activities for his work and his time with his family.  This is why he decided to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle so that he can get to work and home easily.  

One of his main goals is to renovate his home, and he hopes that in the future he can take out another loan to make improvements.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es:
Ana, de 45 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado de educación básica, solo se crió con su abuela y su situación económica no le permitió continuar estudiando.- Esta acompañada y su compañero de vida es agricultor, tienen 6 hijos de los cuales solo 2 estudian.

Ana, ha trabajado desde la edad de 10 años, ayudando a su abuela en un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, también trabajó como jornalera.

Hace 12 años empezó a trabajar vendiendo frutas y verduras en las calles, cuando tiene tiempo le ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de maíz y frijol, y cuida una novilla, ya que le gusta mucho criar ganado. 

Ana, utilizará el préstamo, para comprar ganado de repasto.- De esta forma podrá invertir en una actividad productiva y que además le gusta mucho.

Ana, lo que más desea es tener más ganado para continuar trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, studied up to first grade.  She grew up only with her grandmother, and her financial situation didn't allow her to continue.  She's in a relationship and her life partner's a farmer.  They have six children, only two of whom attend school.

Ana has worked since the age of 10, helping her grandmother in a small business selling tortillas.  She also worked as a day laborer.  Twelve years ago she started to work selling fruits and vegetables in the street.  When she has time, she helps her husband grow corn and beans.  She also takes care of a heifer because she loves to raise livestock.

Ana will use the loan to buy grazing livestock.  That way she'll invest in productive work; besides, it's a job she likes.

What Ana wants most is to have more livestock so she can keep on working and to help her children continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy grazing livestock

loans.name: Jairo Emiliano

texts.es:
Jairo, de 35 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, estudió hasta bachillerato, creció con sus padres quienes fueron los que le enseñaron sobre la agricultura; trabajo que realiza desde su niñez.- Su familia está conformada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos y su hijo que está en primaria.

Jairo, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar donde siembra su propio maíz y frijol y el resto del día trabaja de ayudante en otros siembras, para obtener un ingreso adicional

Jairo, necesita el préstamo para pagar la desgranadora de maíz, los ayudantes y el transporte para recoger su cosecha, la cual espera poder vender a un buen precio y obtener un buen ingreso para el sustento de su familia y poder adquirir una vaca lechera. 

El planea en un futuro comprar vacas lecheras para iniciar un negocio de venta de lácteos ya que le desea mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente tiene su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo, who is 35 years old, works in agriculture. He completed secondary school. He grew up with his parents, who were the ones who taught him about agriculture, work that he has done since his childhood. His family consists of his wife, who supports him with the domestic tasks, and his son, who is in primary school.

Jairo gets up at 4:30 to go to work, where he raises his own corn and beans, and the rest of the day he works as a helper on other plantings in order to obtain additional income.

Jairo needs a loan to pay to shell his corn and pay for helpers and for transportation to harvest his crop, which he hopes to be able to sell at a good price and obtain a good income for the sustenance of his family and to be able to acquire a dairy cow.

In the future he plans to buy dairy cows to begin a business of selling dairy products, since he wants to improve the living conditions that his family now has.

loans.use: to pay to thresh his corn, pay his helpers, and pay for transportation to harvest his crop

loans.name: Kilómetro 13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Kilometro 13” lo integran cuatro mujeres mazahuas que aún conservan sus tradiciones y lengua materna. A ellas les encanta vivir en su comunidad porque dicen que es muy tranquila y la mayor parte de la población es muy amable.

Alejandra es una madre joven con aspiraciones muy claras en la vida, es sonriente, amable y siempre está en la mejor disposición para ayudar a quien se lo solicite. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada desde hace 15 con Jacinto quien se dedica a la construcción de casas y juntos han formado una familia con 2 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando. 

Hace cuatro años Alejandra comenzó a rentar un pequeño molino de nixtamal, su negocio marchaba muy bien y tenía un buen número de clientes, pero ellos mismos comenzaron a preguntarle si vendía productos de abarrotes como leche, pan, huevo azúcar, café para preparar el desayuno de sus familias y así nació la idea de abrir una tienda. Con las ganancias del molino adquirió los productos de abarrotes más esenciales y una de sus hermanas le ofreció un espacio en su casa para adecuarlo como tienda. Alejandra creyó que la ayuda era una buena opción ya que estaría más cerca de la carretera central. Al final, la ubicación influyó mucho en el crecimiento del negocio por el número de ventas. Todos los días, Alejandra abre su tienda desde las 6:00 am, ahí pasa todo el día hasta las 11:00 de la noche; le dedica mucho tiempo a su negocio porque hay personas que necesitan de su servicio en todo momento. 

Alejandra platica que el único reto es el traslado de su mercancía desde el municipio hasta su casa, que es donde compra todos los artículos. Cuando viaja en el autobús es muy incómodo porque lleva varias cajas pesadas, pero es más económico pagar $13 pesos (US$1.00) que viajar en un taxi especial que cobra $120 pesos (US$9.00). Por lo anterior, uno de sus sueños es comprar una camioneta para mover su mercancía sin ningún problema, aunque también comenta que le hace falta un refrigerador más grande para los lácteos o carnes frías que vende porque por el momento utiliza el de su casa y es muy pequeño.

Ella y el resto del grupo están muy agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque con sus préstamos podrán invertir en sus negocios: Andrea y Lucía, en sus borreguitos; María Luisa, en la venta de ropa y Alejandra podrá comprar más productos como pan, huevo, leche, productos lácteos, refrescos, detergentes etc. para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.

*La fotografía se tomó en las escaleras del kiosko en el municipio donde viven las integrantes. Alejandra es quien lleva usa una gorra.
texts.en:
The group Kilometro 13 is composed of four Mazahua women who conserve their traditions and mother tongue. The women love to live in their community because they say it is very tranquil and the majority of the population is very friendly. 

Alejandra is a young mother with clear aspirations in her life, and is smiley, friendly, and is always in the best spirits to help when someone requests it. She is 33 years old, and had been married for 15 years to Jacinto who makes a living constructing house and together they have formed a family with two children who are of school age. 

Four years ago, Alejandra began to rent a small hominy mill. Her business goes very well, and she has a good number of customers but some asked if she would sell grocery products like milk, bread, eggs, sugar, and coffee in order to prepare breakfast for their families and this is what gave birth to the idea to open a shop. With the profits from the mill, she bought the most essential grocery products and one of her sisters offered a space in her house to serve as a shop. Alejandra believed that this offer was a good option because it was near a major highway. Finally, the location influenced the growth of the business due to the number of sales. Everyday Alejandra opens the shop at 6:00 am, and spends the day there until 11:00 at night; she dedicates much of her time to her business because there are people who need her services all of the time.

Alejandra says that the only challenge is the transporting of her merchandise from the town, where she buys all of her things, to her house. When she travels in a bus it is very inconvenient because she has to carry various heavy boxes, but it is more economical to pay $13 pesos ($1.00USD) than to travel in a special taxi that charges $120 pesos ($9.00USD). Because of the aforementioned, one of her dreams is to buy a pick-up truck to move her merchandise without a problem, although she also comments that she lacks a larger refrigerator for her milk and cold meats because for the time being she uses the one in her house and it is very small.

She and the rest of the group are very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because with their loans they can invest in their businesses: Andrea and Lucía,  in their sheep; María Luisa, in her clothing sales, and Alejandra will be able to buy more products like bread, eggs, milk, dairy products, sodas, detergents, etc. in order to stock her grocery store. 

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the gazebo in the town where the partners live. Alejandra is the one wearing a cap.

loans.use: to buy more products like bread, eggs, milk, dairy products, soda, detergent, etc.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 51 years old and from a small village in the Gori district. She lives with her son and his family. Tamar is a grandmother of 3 grandchildren. Her son does physical work and her daughter-in-law works at local cafe. They both get a small monthly income, which is not enough for a 6 member family.

Tamar was actively involved in the animal husbandry business years ago and she is experienced in this field. She decided to start up a husbandry business and help her family financially. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1500 GEL. With this credit, she will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products to sell. She will also use them to feed her family.

Tamar is very motivated to generate her own income and help her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products to sell and also to feed her family.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 - Trần Phú - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Ms. Xuân operates a small restaurant that sells rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook for her restaurant. 

Xuân is 52 years old, single, and has one child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 - Trần Phú - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook for her restaurant

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, James would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, James can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

James, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hairdressing chair and mirrors, and to renew her tools like brushes, combs, and flat irons.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio, de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la carpintería, su mayor  preocupación es el bienestar de su esposa y de sus hijos, esto lo ha convertido en un hombre eficiente. Aprendió dicha profesión a la edad de 20 años y fue un amigo de la comunidad que le enseño esa profesión.

Sus padres de edad avanzada, lo intuyeron en la vida para que fuera una persona honesta y con buenos principios.- Actualmente, Evelio vive con su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y a cuidar su hijo.

Evelio, dedica todo su tiempo al trabajo en la carpintera, los fines de semana dedica tiempo a cultivar maíz y frijol  y el tiempo libre lo dedica ocupa para descansar y a pasar tiempo con su familia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos que necesita para la siembra de hortalizas.- De esta forma Evelio, espera tener una fuente de ingresos adicional y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

Las proyecciones que Evelio tiene para un futuro son: mejorar y diversificar sus cultivos, servir en su comunidad como miembro de la asociación de desarrollo comunal, e impulsar el desarrollo en su comunidad mediante la organización de los miembros.
texts.en:
Evelio, 48, is a carpenter. His biggest concern is the welfare of his wife and children. This has made him an efficient man. He learned his profession at the age of 20. A friend in the community taught him this profession.

His parents are elderly. They have made him an honest and good person. Currently, Evelio lives with his wife who does household work and childcare. 

Evelio devotes all his time to woodworking. Weekends, he spends time cultivating corn and beans. He uses his free time to rest and spend time with his family.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other inputs needed for planting his crops. Thus, he expects an additional source of revenue to meet the needs of his family. Evelio projects that in the future he will improve and diversify his crops, to serve in his community as a member of the Association of Community Development, and promote development in his community by organizing his neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other inputs he needs to sow his crops

loans.name: Julio Adriano

texts.es:
Julio Adriano tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos y vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Julio Adriano se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, adobes, contando con herramientas propias como su moto carguera roja en la cual transporta su producción que fabrica a sus clientes, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, Julio Adriano solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo compra de insumos(tierra, arenilla, entre otros), dicha inversión le servirá para tener más stock de ladrillos, con gran influencia en el negocio; Julio Adriano piensa incrementar su producción y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Adriano is 25 years old. He lives with his partner and has no children. He lives in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock raising, and business.

Julio Adriano works in making adobe bricks. He has his own tools such as his red cargo vehicle, in which he transports the production that he makes to his customers. He has more than five years of experience in his business, which is located at his home. Julio Adriano is applying for a loan for working capital, to buy supplies (earth and grit, among other items). This investment will serve him to have more stock of bricks, with a great influence on the business. Julio Adriano is thinking of increasing his production and thus being able to serve the various needs of his customers in the zone. In the near term, this will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings, and in the end, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy supplies (earth and grit, among other items)

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en:
Pacifique is 34 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 3 and 17 years, all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 7 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy maize fertilizers to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy maize fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
En el negocio de Fidelina encontrarás una amplia  variedad de productos, desde juguetes, cosméticos hasta calzado, donde cada día puede mover su negocio a un punto diferente. FidelinaComenzó su negocio desde los 22 años, siendo su primer negocio lo ha logrado conservar durante 15 años eso gracias a la perseverancia y los animos de seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos a prepararse. Fidelina tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 20 años nació con problemas de discapacidad, este fue el empuje para que Fidelina pudiera salir adelante, sin importar las circunstancias Fidelina siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos, trabajando duro para brindarles las mejores oportunidades. 
El negocio de Fidelinaprácticamente se ha desarrollado en las calles de Matagalpa. Fidelina solicita el crédito para la compra de nueva mercadería que le permitirá aumentar más su negocio. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que este le ayudara a mejorar su estabilidad económica. Fidelina es una mujer visionaria al éxito por eso es que su negocio nunca ha declinado por su constancia, este crédito le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio, mostrarle una gran variedad a sus clientes y seguirá ofreciéndolo en varias localidades, aunque sus planes a futuros es establecer un local estable, comenzara con este crédito para incrementar sus ganancias y  de esa manera ahorrar para planes futuros.
texts.en:
In Fidelina's business you'll find a wide variety of products, from toys and cosmetics to footwear.  Every day she takes her business to a different level.  Fidelina started her business when she was 22.  It was her first business and she has managed to keep it for 15 years, thanks to her perseverance and desire to keep on working to help her children 

Fidelina has two children.  The oldest, 20, was born with handicaps, which motivated Fidelina to get ahead.  She's always concerned about her children's well-being, regardless of the circumstances.  She works hard to give them the best opportunities.

Fidelina's business developed practically in the streets of Matagalpa.  She's requesting the loan to buy new merchandise so she can further expand her business.  She's placing her trust in the loan because it will help her improve her economic stability.

Fidelina's a farsighted woman about success, which is why her business has never declined.  This loan will help her strengthen her business, show her customers a wide variety, and keep on selling in different areas.  Although her plan for the future is to set up a stable retail space, she'll start with this loan to increase her profits so she can save for future plans.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Ephrem

texts.en:
Ephrem is 48-years-old. He is married with 3 children, who are between the age of 10 and 20 years, all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize for sale.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yohanna expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Celio

texts.es:
José, de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está soltero, cuida a su mamá y es el menor de sus hermanos.

José, actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, lo ha hecho desde niño, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre quien también fue agricultor.- Además de trabajar en lo propio, trabaja como jornalero y también tiene ganado de repasto; todo esto le genera un ingreso económico adicional para el sustento de el y su mamá.

Horario fijo no tiene, pues sale muy temprano de su casa y regresa hasta terminar con lo programado en ese día.

El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará para comprar ganado de repasto; el espera venderlo al cumplir un año.

Los sueños de José, son tener vida y trabajo para darle mejores condiciones de vida a su madre y tener mas ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
José, 25, studied up to his third year of high school, is single, takes care of his mother, and is the youngest of his siblings.  José currently makes a living  by working in agriculture, which he has done since he was young.  He learned this work from his father who was a farmer.  In addition to this work, he also works as a day laborer and has grazing cattle.  All of this generates additional income for taking care of himself and his mother.  He does not have a fixed schedule because he leaves the house really early in the morning and returns when he has finished whatever is scheduled for that day.  

The money from the loan will be used to buy grazing cattle.  He plans to sell it at the end of a year.  José's dreams are to have life and work in order to provide better living conditions for his mother, and to get more livestock.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: José Rubén

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor que vio la oportunidad de hacer dinero utilizando su automóvil, es una persona muy amable, muy respetado por sus conocidos.- Actualmente, vive con su compañera de vida, quien se encarga de las actividades domésticas; los dos se apoyan en las decisiones tomadas para su bienestar, se caracterizan con la gente como una pareja amigable y con muchos deseos de superación. 

Su trabajo es de realizar viajes en su vehículo, ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, el transporta cualquier tipo de equipo, personas o cualquier cosa que pueda halar en su vehículo, de esta manera obtiene ingresos y a la misma vez, beneficia a muchas personas que necesitan transporte.

Durante estos tres años su vehículo se ha depreciado y ha sufrido mucho desgaste, es por eso que necesita el dinero para arreglar las partes dañadas de su vehículo para seguir laborando normalmente y con seguridad.

José, desea llegar a obtener un vehículo más nuevo para su comodidad y la de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
José, 28 years old, is an enterprising young man who saw the opportunity to make money using his automobile. He is a friendly person who is very respected by those who know him. He currently lives with his life partner who takes charge of the household duties. The two support each other in the decisions made for their wellbeing. People characterize them as a friendly couple with a lot of desire to improve.

His job is to carry out trips in his vehicle. He has done this work for three years. He transports all kinds of equipment, people, or anything that he can pull with his vehicle. In this way he obtains income and, at the same time, many people who need transportation benefit.

During these three years his vehicle has depreciated in value and suffered a lot of wear. That is why he needs money to fix the damaged parts of his vehicle in order to continue working normally and with security.

José wishes to one day have a newer vehicle for his convenience and that of all his customers.

loans.use: to fix the damaged parts of his vehicle.

loans.name: Hudu

texts.en: Hudu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hudu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hudu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Hudu is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cathia

texts.en:
Cathia is a 48-year-old married woman who sells clothes, cosmetics and accessories to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.  Cathia is an ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her customers. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs in the Christmas season. 

Cathia hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes for the Christmas season

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is 53-years-old. He is married. He is a farmer and has been farming for 19 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers of maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers of maize for sale.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús, de 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijas, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su esposo está en el extranjero, sus hijas aún viven con ellas, la mayor tiene un bebe y su otra hija estudia.

Jesús, recibe ayuda de su esposo pero, ella también recibe ingresos de la venta de gallinas indias y compra leche de vaca para elaborar cuajada.- Además, paga jornaleros para que trabajen en un pequeño terreno cerca de su hogar para que siembren los granos necesarios para el consumo del hogar.

El dinero lo necesita para arreglar el techo de su vivienda ahora que ya terminó el invierno y quiere hacerlo antes de la temporada navideña.
En un futuro desea que su hija mayor retome sus estudios, para que pueda convertirse en una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Jesus is 59 years old, married, and has two daughters. She dedicates herself to house work, while her husband is working abroad. Their daughters still live with them. The elder daughter has a baby but her sister is still a student.

Jesus receives help from her husband and earns some income from selling Indian hens, and she buys cows' milk to make curds. In addition, she pays day laborers to work a small piece of land near her home, cultivating the grain that the household consumes.

The loan is needed to repair the roof of their house right away, since the rainy season is over and she wishes to do the job before Christmas.

In the future, Jesus wants her elder daughter to take up her studies anew, so that she can become a successful professional.

loans.use: repair the roof on their house.

loans.name: Nhóm 28 - Tô Vĩnh Diện 1 -Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Lan is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Lan operates a small restaurant selling breakfast. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 28 - Tô Vĩnh Diện 1 -Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Lan has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook and sell for breakfast.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and sell for breakfast.

loans.name: Karent Emilcen

texts.es:
Karent, de 33 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora, muy reconocida por la comunidad por su personalidad y amabilidad con las personas.- Karent, es propietaria de una tiendita, ella vive con sus dos padres y sus dos hijos que son el motivo por el cual ella desea salir adelante, para poder darles una vida mejor.

Karent, siendo una persona de un pensamiento emprendedor, pensó en la posibilidad de poner una tiendita hace 3 años, para tener un ingreso y ayudar a la comunidad para que pueda obtener los productos básicos del hogar más cerca.

El préstamo será destinado para mejorar la infraestructura de su tiendita y para surtir más el negocio.- La demanda que tiene la comunidad es muy grande, porque ofrece sus productos a precios considerables,

Como prioridad, ella desea terminar de construir su casa, para sea apta y digna de ser habitada por su familia.- Karent, espera lograr esto para que mejoren las condiciones de vida de sus padres e hijos.
texts.en:
Karent, 33 years old, is an enterprising person, very well known by the community for her personality and friendliness with people. Karent is the owner of a small store. She lives with her two parents and her two children who are the motivation for which she wishes to get ahead - to be able to give them a better life.

Karent, being a person of entrepreneurial thinking, thought of the possibility of putting up a store 3 years ago, to have income and help the community so that it could obtain basic home products closer.

The loan will be earmarked for improving the infrastructure of her store and to stock the business more. The demand that the community has is very large, because she offers her products at considerable prices.

As a priority, she wishes to finish constructing her house, so that it will be apt and dignified to be inhabited by her family. Karent hopes to achieve this so that the living conditions of her parents and children improve.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her store and to stock the business more.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 45 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 12, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been for seven years. After getting his loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve his farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize

loans.name: José Rufino

texts.es:
José, de 70 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, no pudo estudiar por la situación económica de su familia y por esa razón tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar.- Creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades que realiza desde hace más de 60 años;  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido del ganado.

José, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar en sus parcelas, en donde siembra maíz y frijol y en la tarde ordeña las vacas y las alimenta.

José, ocupará el préstamo para comprar una novilla, para que incremente su producción de leche, ya que le generara ingresos adicionales para el sustento de el y su esposa.

El planea en un futuro adquirir otro crédito para comprar una parcela donde poder tener sembrar y tener su ganado, ya que donde alquila está bastante retirado de su casa y le genera gastos adicionales para sacar su cosecha e ir a cuidar sus animales.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 70 years old, works in agriculture and ranching. He could not attend school because of the economic situation of his family, and for this reason, he had to begin working. He grew up with his parents, who taught him this occupation over 60 years ago. His wife takes care of domestic affairs and looks after the cattle. Jose wakes up at 5:00 a.m. to go to work on his plots of land, where he sows maize and bean, and in the afternoon he milks and feeds the cows. 

Jose will use the loan to buy a heifer, to increase his milk production, as this generates additional income to support himself and his wife. He plans to ask for another loan in the future to buy a plot of land where he can sow and raise his cattle, because the place he is renting now is quite far from his home, which generates extra expenses to get his harvest and take care of his animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer .

loans.name: Ubale

texts.en:
Ubale is a Babban Gona maize farmer.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ubale would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ubale can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Ubale expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Manuela Ramos Group

texts.es: Noemí de 36 años de edad es casada, ella es socia del grupo “Manuela Ramos” conformada por 06 socias emprendedoras y responsables. Ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes. El deseo de Noemí es continuar implementando su negocio con más variedades de sus productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de muñecas, peluches y carritos. El grupo “Manuela Ramos” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Noemí es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste abrigo plomo.
texts.en:
Noemí is 36 years old and married. She is a member of the group “Manuela Ramos”, which consists of six enterprising and responsible members. Noemí sells toys and wants to keep her business in operation by selling a wider variety of these products. She is requesting a loan in order to buy dolls, plush toys, and toy cars.

The group “Manuela Ramos” appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to continue working hard. Noemí is the third person in the photo wearing a gray coat.

loans.use: to buy dolls, plush toys, and toy cars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat, like plywood, nails, hard wood, epoxy, paints and others

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 53 year old fisherman. He is married and a father of six dependents. His oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 12. He lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. He catches and sells fish. Aside from fishing, he also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like cooking oil, sugar, noodles and beverages. He has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 20 years.

Emmanuel is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP buy stock for the store, fishing nets and fish feed. This will help Emmanuel filled his store with a variety of merchandise. This will also help him improve his fishing, as this it will create a higher yield. He will be able to pay for his obligations and other household expenses.

In the future, he hopes that he could handle his both businesses properly as this will help him to be financially stable and he could also support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks for his sari-sari store as well as fishing nets and fish feed.

loans.name: Gladys Noemi

texts.es:
Gladys Noemi tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es madre soltera. Su casa cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). Ella vive en Morropón, tiene un hijo que trabaja en Lima y este le apoya, los pobladores de Morropón se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y ventas de todo tipo. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Gladys Noemi es el servicio de confecciones y costuras, además de sembrar arroz en la chacra de su papa (fallecido). Ella tiene su negocio en su casa ubicada en Morropón donde confecciona ropa y realiza costuras, tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro. Gladys Noemi solicita crédito porque desea invertir en comprar grandes cantidades de tela porque por la campaña navideña tiene varios pedidos de confección de adornos y telas decorativas. El crédito le ayudará a poder cumplir con sus pedidos y a su vez captar a nuevos clientes por la calidad de su servicio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Noemi is 58 years old. She is a single mother. Her house has public utilities (water and light). She lives in Morropón. She has a son who works in Lima and this supports him. The people of Morropón work in raising livestock, business, and all kinds of sales. Said district is located in the province of Morropón, region of Piura, northern coast of Perú.

Gladys Noemi works in dressmaking and sewing, and she also plants rice on her father’s small farm (deceased). She has her own business in her house located in Morropón where she produces clothing and does sewing. She has several years of experience in this field. 

Gladys Noemi requests this loan because she wishes to invest in buying greater quantities of fabric because for the Christmas season she has several requests to produce adornments and decorative fabrics. The loan will help her to be able to fulfill her requests and at the same time attract new customers for the quality of her service, which will allow her in a short time to improve her income, expand her earnings, and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in buying greater quantities of fabric because for the Christmas season she has several requests to produce adornments and decorative fabrics.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 40 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Karine is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works as a driver. She has a higher education and is a professional accountant. Currently, she works at the school of her specialty. She also gives paid private courses in accountancy at her house. She has a lot of students who attend these courses.

Karine will be happy to receive this loan, since she wants to buy a computer and professional literature.
