Both of these are very important since, with the help of the computer, she will be able to work from her house, and the new literature will refresh her professional library and give her the chance to be aware of innovations in her professional field.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 35 years old. He is married with 2 children, aged between 4 and 6 years, and both of them go to school. He has been a farmer for 7 years. After getting his loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve his farming.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 41 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 4 and 6 years, and both of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 8 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and buy food for consumption in his home.

He would like to use a Kiva loan to support his labor costs and buy fertilizers in order to increase maize production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Polin

texts.en: Polin is a 21-year-old single student studying English literature in his second year at a university. He lives with his widowed mother and other married siblings in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Nowadays, he also works at a hotel in the province, making $3 daily. He has started his second year, but since he lacks the finances to pay his tuition, he has decided to take a loan. With this loan, Polin will be able to go through the second year successfully. For his dreams after graduation, he is going to find a better job and then save money to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathias would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathias can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Mathias is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to enlarge his flock.

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemy, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres.

Noemy, se levanta junto a su esposo a las 5:00 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias en la agricultura. 

Se dedica a trabajar en el terreno que poseen, oficio que realiza durante la mañana junto a su esposo. En el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su esposo a trabajar en otras parcelas ajenas.

Noemy,  ocupará el préstamo para comprar dos novillas, para que en un futuro produzcan leche e iniciar un negocio de venta de lácteos y obtener un ingreso adicional para su hogar

En un futuro ella planea ser dueña de mucho ganado lechero, para producir más lácteos y venderlos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Noemy is 34 years old and studied through the sixth grade. She is in a relationship and works in agriculture. She learned this trade from her parents. Noemy and her husband wake up at 5:00 A.M. so that they can begin the daily farm chores. She and her husband work together in the morning on the land that they own. In the afternoons, Noemy takes care of the household chores while her husband works on farmland owned by other people.

Noemy will use this loan to buy two heifers for future milk production. She will start a business of selling dairy products so that she can generate some additional household income. In the future, her dream is to own many dairy cows so that she can produce more dairy products that she can sell in her community.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Shehu Dandikko

texts.en:
Shehu Dandikko is a maize farmer from Gangarida village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu Dandikko would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu Dandikko can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shehu Dandikko, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna Maikaji

texts.en:
Haruna Maikaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna Maikaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna Maikaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Haruna Maikaji expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer from Jaki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Emmanuel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 36 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 5 years, and they do not yet go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for his maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for consumption in his home. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his maize crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the people who will help him reap his maize and bean harvests, and to pay for transport to bring his harvest to his house

loans.name: Massy

texts.en:
Massy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children all of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She has been selling chicken and chips for the last five years, working seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, chicken, spices and cooking oil. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to own a big shop. The weekly repayment program attracted her to join MCDT - SACCO.

She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, chicken, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edith Melene

texts.es: Edith una joven de 23 años que estudia la carrera de Idiomas pasa a su segundo año obteniendo buenas calificaciones. Gracias a su constante esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus padres puede salir adelante. Actualmente se encuentra laborando en una tienda de atención al cliente, lo cual le permite cubrir una parte de los gastos de sus estudios. Solicitó el crédito para el pago de sus pensiones y útiles de estudio. El deseo de Edith es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera e insertarse al mercado laboral. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Edith is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She is in her second year of studying languages and is earning good grades. Thanks to her constant efforts and the support her parents, Edith is able to get ahead. She is currently working in customer service at a store so that she can cover part of her educational expenses.

Edith is requesting a loan so that she can pay for room and board and also buy school supplies. She wants to complete her degree successfully and then join the workforce. Edith appreciates the Kiva lenders for the support they have offered.

loans.use: to pay for room and board and also buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Positivas” está conformado por 07 socias dinámicas y entusiastas. Nireyda de 28 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de especerías al por mayor. Hace más de 01 año que viene distribuyendo a los puestos de mercado quiénes son sus principales clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo su negocio le va bien y se siente feliz por que le permite darles una mejor educación a sus menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de canelas y laureles. Su mayor anhelo es contar con su propio local de venta.  El grupo “Mujeres Positivas” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Nireyda se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo morado.
texts.en:
Mujeres Positivas Group is made up of seven dynamic and enthusiastic members.

Nireyda, 28, is separated and has two dependent children.  She earns a living selling spices wholesale.  For more than a year she has been distributing to her main customers at the market stalls.  Her business is going well for her thanks to her effort, and she's happy because it allows her to give her young children a better education.  Her biggest desire is to have her own retail space.

She requested the loan to buy cinnamon and bay leaves.

Mujeres Positivas group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.  Nireyda is standing in the back; she's the third person from the left and is wearing a purple t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon and bay leaves

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 30 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one currently in school. For the past two years, Ismail has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for sale. This will help Ismail to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for his child. It will also provide food for the family. Ismail hopes that in the future he will be able to see his business grow more than it is now.

Ismail is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ismail who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is a 38-year-old garment worker who is from Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has three teenage children who are in school. She has worked in a factory in a nearby province since 2011. Her husband is a 39-year-old rice farmer. Together, they can make about six dollars per day. To find a way to improve her family's finances, Sokhorn would like to request a loan to buy a rice milling machine for her husband. This will allow him to keep bran for pig fattening.

This loan will help her husband generate other income for the family. After buying the machine, she is going to expand pig fattening, build fences around her house, and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a rice milling machine.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Claudia de 38 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella pertenece al grupo “Las Margaritas” que está constituida por 05 socias responsables y entusiastas. Claudia se dedica a la venta de cereales ambulatoriamente. Fruto de su esfuerzo su negocio sigue creciendo y de esta manera puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de quinua, trigo y chía. El grupo “Las Margaritas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Claudia se ubica en la parte frontal  y viste camisa blanco.
texts.en: Claudia is 38 years old and married, with 3 children who depend on her. She belongs to the group “Las Margaritas”, which is made up of 5 responsible and enthusiastic members. Claudia makes a living by traveling to different neighborhoods and selling grains. As a fruit of her effort, her business keeps growing and this way she can cover household expenses. She asked for a loan to buy quinoa, wheat, and chia. The group “Las Margaritas” thanks Kiva investors for the support they bring. Claudia is in the front of the group and is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, wheat, and chia.

loans.name: Tayiba

texts.en:
Tayiba was born in 1993. She is not married and lives with her parents in a rural area. Tayiba is a university student. She studies well, reads many books, and is smart.

Tayiba always wanted to be a journalist and now studies journalism. She is asking for a loan because she needs money. Her father died when she was little and her mother is a migrant in Russia. Tayiba really needs your support. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Martha Marina

texts.es:
Martha, de 44 años de edad, es una persona humilde y sencilla, solidaria con sus vecinos y familiares.-  Vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, tres varones y una niña que le ayuda en los oficios domésticos, sus hijos varones ayudan al papá en la agricultura, que es su única fuente de ingreso.

Martha, necesita el dinero para pagar el tratamiento de salud de su madre, el cual es indispensable, si su mamá no recibe este tratamiento, está propensa a sufrir de muchas enfermedades, es por eso que es necesario el cumplimiento del tratamiento, para que goze de salud estable.  

El sueño de Martha es, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para el bienestar de la salud de su madre.- Uno de sus objetivos para el futuro es poder apoyar a su esposo en la agricultura, ya sea en la compra de insumos o ayudando en las actividades diarias.
texts.en:
Martha, age 44, is a humble and modest person who gets along with her neighbors and relatives. She lives with her husband and their four children, three sons and a daughter who helps with the household duties. The sons help their father with the farm work since it is the family’s only source of income.

Martha needs money to pay for her mother’s essential health treatment. If her mother does not receive this treatment, then she is prone to many illnesses. For this reason it is necessary for her to complete the treatment so that her health remains stable.

Martha’s dream is to improve the conditions at home for the benefit of her mother’s health. One of her goals for the future is to help her husband with the farm work, such as buying supplies and assisting with the daily activities.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's health treatment.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 58-year-old widowed mother of two children who has worked as a manicurist and artisan since she was twenty two years to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved kids.

Norma is the sole earner of her family. She is trying desperately to provide better living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her house registration and subscription fees for the state's water supply.

loans.use: to pay her house registration and subscription fees for the state's water supply.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is married and 51 years old. She is married to Abel and together they have been blessed with six children, ages 10 to 25 years old.

Hellen runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last 11 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 100,000. She has requested her 10th loan with VisionFund Kenya in the amount of 30,000 KES. This will be used to add stock to her shop, such as washing and bathing soap, cooking oil, cooking flour, bread, milk, and other household goods. With the anticipated profits, Hellen will be able to repay her loan.

Hellen's future hope and dream is to build a home for her family as she educates her children to the university level.

loans.use: to add inventory to her shop.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa, de 43 años de edad, solo estudió hasta séptimo grado de educación básica, ya que en ese tiempo había mucha inseguridad debido a la guerra en el país. Está casada y su esposo es albañil y tienen 3 hijos, quienes trabajan. 

Teresa, empezó a trabajar junto a su madre vendiendo marisco, también trabajo en un restaurante de comida rápida como mesera. 

Además, tiene 18 años de experiencia en panadería, oficio que aprendió gracias a su hermana. Teresa, elabora quesadillas y sale a venderlas a 5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa. 

El crédito será invertido para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar, levadura y otros insumos necesarios para el negocio de panadería.- Teresa disfruta mucho haciendo lo que mas le gusta. 

El sueño de Teresa, es que su negocio crezca y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Además, desea hacerle algunos arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
Teresa, 43, only studied up to seventh grade because at that time there was a lot of uncertainty from the war in her country.  She's married and her husband's a bricklayer.  They have three children, who are working.

Teresa started working with her mother selling shellfish.  She also worked in a fast-food restaurant as a waitress.  She also has 18 years of experience as a baker, a trade she learned thanks to her sister.  Teresa makes "quesadillas" [sweet cheese cakes] and goes out to sell them five kilometers from her home.

The loan will be invested in buying flour, eggs, sugar, leavening, and other ingredients necessary for her bakery business.  Teresa enjoys doing what she likes most.

Teresa's dreams are for her business to grow and to improve her family's quality of life.  She also wants to make some modifications to her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, leavening, and other ingredients necessary for her bakery business

loans.name: Roxana Beatríz

texts.es:
Roxana, de 21 años de edad, está estudiando bachillerato; esta acompañada, tiene una niña  y su pareja es empleado, en su casa vive su suegra.

Roxana, ademas de estudiar, trabaja haciendo flores artificiales para vender, también tiene venta de ropa en su casa.- Aprendió a hacer flores por medio de toda su familia, quienes toda su vida se han dedicado a esta labor, horario fijo no tiene, pero se levanta muy temprano para ir a estudiar y por la tarde atiende la venta de ropa y su suegra le cuida su hija.

El dinero del préstamo sera utilizado para comprar mas ropa como: camisas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa interior, entre otros, porque en Diciembre se incrementan las ventas.
 
Los sueños que Roxana tiene son: terminar sus estudios, tener una casa propia y un negocio mas fuerte.
texts.en:
Roxana, who is 21 years old, is studying high school. She has a partner and a daughter, and her partner is employed. Her mother-in-law lives in her home.

Roxana, apart from studying, works making artificial flowers to sell. She also has a clothing shop in her home. She learned to make flowers from her family, who all their lives have made a living doing this work. She does not have a fixed schedule, but she gets up very early to study, and in the afternoon she works in the store, while her mother-in-law looks after her daughter.

The money from the loan will be used to buy more clothing such as: shirts, pants, dresses, underwear, among others, because sales increase in December. 

Roxana’s dreams are: to finish her studies, to have her own home, and a stronger business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, such as: shirts, pants, dresses, underwear, among others, because sales increase in December.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise.

loans.name: Ya'u

texts.en: Ya'u is a maize farmer from the Magajin Gari village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ya'u would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Ya'u can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ya'u, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland.  He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulrahman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrahman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Abdulrahman expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Ibrahim expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Isuhu, Monday and Comfort. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: Este es la Alcancía Comunal “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” está conformada por 07 socias entusiastas y solidarias. Nieves de 65 años de edad es casada con 07 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida así como el arroz con pollo. Hace más de 05 años que viene desempañándose en dicho negocio lo cual le va bien. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, pollo, papa y cebolla.  Su mayor deseo acondicionar su local y de esta manera dar un mejor servicio a sus comensales. El grupo “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Nieves  es la cuarta del lado derecho y viste polo amarillo.
texts.en:
This communal bank, Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo, is made up of seven enthusiastic and supportive members.

Nieves, 65, is married and has seven independent children.  She earns a living selling food, such as chicken and rice.  She has been working in this business for more than five years and it's going well for her.  Her biggest desire is to renovate her retail space so she can give her guests better service.

She requested the loan to buy rice, chicken, potatoes, and onions.

Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan.  Nieves is the fourth one on the right; she's wearing a yellow t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, potatoes, and onion

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 28 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Julius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell. This will help Julius to generate greater profits and to provide his family with enough food and other basic needs. Julius hopes that in the future he will be able to improve on the good quality of supplies.

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Julius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 42 year old married woman and a mother of 8 children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is their source of income.

Nilda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With a loan, Nilda and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus allowing them to sell more fish to the market.

In the future, Nilda hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her brothers` children.

She has been selling big yellow bananas and green bananas in the market for the last four years, working seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO for more yellow bananas to sell. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to be able to become a farmer and supplier of yellow bananas in a busy trading center.

She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school dues.

loans.use: to buy bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 35 años de edad, su estado civil es Casada. Vive con su familia, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). La comunidad se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, comercio de plátano y agricultura de arroz. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Marleny es la crianza y comercilaización de aves (patos, conejos, pavos, gallinas, entre otros) en su casa, Marleny es natural de la zona de la sierra Catalina de Mossa, pero tiene varios años viviendo en la zona de Morropón, además Marleny se dedica a lavar ropa y hacer limpieza en hogares de sus vecinos. Marleny solicita crédito para invertir en la compra de pavos para engordarlos y venderlos en navidad, dicha venta permitirá tener mayores ingresos y reinvertir en el negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 35 years old and married. She lives with her family and they receive public services, such as running water and electricity. Her community is known for raising cattle, selling bananas, and growing rice. This area is located in the District and Province of Morropón, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Marleny raises and sells poultry (ducks, turkeys, chickens), as well as rabbits and other livestock from her home. She is a native of the District of La Sierra Catalina de Mossa, but has been living in the District of Morropón for several years. In addition, Marleny does laundry and housekeeping for her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of turkeys for fattening, which she will then sell for Christmas. This will provide her with more income that she can reinvest into her business. In the short term, Marleny will be able to increase her earnings, improve her income, and eventually improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy turkeys that she can fatten and sell in time for Christmas.

loans.name: Naciendo Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL NACIENDO CON ESPERANZA, ESTA CONFORMADA POR  OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PERSONAS  RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN  PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTA DE LA COMPANIA DE LA SUS HIJOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA BRINDARLE MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES A SUS FAMILIAS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES YAMILEHT Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS EN SUS CASA DE HABILITACIÓN. ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE DEDICA UNA DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTO, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DESDE LAS CUATRO DE LA MAÑANA PARA NISKESAR EL MAÍZ MOLER EL MAÍZ  Y ELABORAR LAS TORTILLAS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA COMO: MAÍZ, LEÑA, BOLSAS, CAL, COMAL.  PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. NACIENDO CON ESPERANZA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN  A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Naciendo con Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man, responsible people who want to improve themselves personally.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the region.  They're known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement.  In their free time they enjoy being with their children.  Currently they're striving to give their families better opportunities.

Yamileth is the coordinator, thanks to her desire to get ahead.  Her business is making and selling tortillas in her home.  She devotes some 12 hours a day to selling her product.  This woman works from 4 in the morning preparing and grinding the corn and making the tortillas.

The loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with a purchase of raw material such as corn, firewood, bags, lime powder, and a comal so she can earn more income in the near future.

Naciendo con Esperanza is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to decent work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as corn, firewood, bags, lime powder, and a comal to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Idris joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Saidu, Hassan and Ibrahim.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Idris  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg Group

texts.en:
Soudamini has a stall selling food such as breakfast and snacks (typical odishi food like bada, samosa, idli, dosa, etc.). She, along with her group, is requesting this loan. With her loan portion she will purchase more material to make foods for sale.

Soudamini is 30 years old, and she is married and has two children. She is the group leader of the Jay Jagannath Shg, which is comprised of ten members. She lives in Boudh district, a rural area in Odisha state.

In 2014, Soudamini joined Peoples Forum to improve her business. This will be the first loan for this group. The main hardship that Soudamini faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Soudamini hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food making and selling business

loans.name: Ana Emelina

texts.es:
Ana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar quesillo, harina, aceite, gas propano, bebidas y otros ingredientes para elaborar la venta de pupusas, contara con la materia prima que le permita seguir trabajando y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Con ayuda del financiamiento anterior cuenta con un negocio más rentable y más grande, con las nuevas ganancias ha cumplido con el pago de su deuda y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ana needs another loan to buy quesillo [soft cheese], flour, oil, propane gas, beverages, and other ingredients to make pupusas.  She'll have the ingredients to keep on working and keeping her customers satisfied.

With the help of the previous loan she has a more profitable and bigger business.  With her additional profits she has been able to pay back her debt and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy quesillo cheese, flour, oil, propane gas, beverages, and other ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover loan obligations with moneylenders.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old. She is married and, together with her spouse, blessed with one child who is 10 years old.

She is a tailor, a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000.

Lucy has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 22,500 which she will use to buy more textiles and kente clothing for dressmaking.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to buy organic fertilizers, seeds for planting, and materials for making more clothes.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve the living standards of her family as well as diversify into becoming a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy more textiles and kente clothing for dressmaking

loans.name: Wence

texts.es:
Wence, de 57 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería; el creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, está casado, su esposa le apoya con los oficios domésticos y sus hijos  estudian.

Wence, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Para preparase con sus hijos e ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en otras parcelas ajenas o cuidando sus animales.

Con el préstamo, podrá comprar una vaca que le generé una buena producción de leche; Wence cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en el cuido de animales.

Wence, planea en un futuro obtener otro crédito para sembrar jícama e involucrar a su esposa e hijos en esta nueva actividad que desea comenzar.
texts.en:
Wence, age 57, works in agriculture and cattle raising.  He grew up with his parents, who taught him these activities.  He is married.  His wife supports him with household tasks, and his children are in school.

Wence gets up at 4:00 a.m to get ready with his children.  He goes to work in the morning on the plot of land that he rents, and during the rest of the day he works on other people’s land or takes care of his animals.

With the loan, he will be able to buy a cow which will produce a good output of milk.  Wence has many years of experience caring for animals.

In the future, Wence plans to obtain another loan to sow jicama, and to involve his wife and children in this new activity he wants to start.

loans.use: to buy a cow that will produce a good milk output.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She has been selling clothes from a shop that she rents for the last three years, working six days a week. She operates her business on a retail basis.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more skirts, blouses, t-shirts, and dresses for sale. Her challenges include seasonality of her clothes. Her dream is to become an importer of second hand clothes. She joined MCDT because of the objective of helping women to get out of poverty.

She rents a house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, oil, bags of lime powder, etc.

loans.name: Jhenuz1 Group

texts.en:
Jasmin is the featured borrower of Jhenuz1 group.  She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they left their hometown, Philippine, to come to Lebanon and work as housekeepers, to provide their families a better living. 

Jasmin is a 34-year-old single mother of one child, for whom she works hard to provide with the necessary living needs and education.  She hopes that one day he will be a reputable person in the region. Her loan will be sent to Philippine to cover her child's increasing living and educational needs, since her income barely covers her necessary living needs and her child's daily living needs.

She is the lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Maybel is the lady at the center of the picture, while Cynthia is the first from the right.

loans.use: to cover her child's increasing living and educational needs,

loans.name: Kifayet

texts.en:
Kifayet is 37 years old. She is married and raising two kids. Kifayet is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and she lives with her family in Bilasuvar region.   The main source of income for the family is raising and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumbers, onions, greens, etc.)  This brings her 180 AZN monthly but she also gets additional earnings working as a tailor in her free time.

Raising vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan because there is a high demand for fresh vegetables. People use this produce to prepare delicious fresh salads and national dishes. 

Kifayet’s husband is ill   and he needs good care but this isn’t possible with their small income. So she wants to increase productivity and income and provide her husband a good life, because it’s very hard for refugees to pay for medicines. She applied for 500 AZN in order to buy new good fertilizers and garden tools. Please support Kifayet

loans.use: to pay for medicines

loans.name: Aminamo

texts.en:
Aminamo is 20 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents in Tajikistan. She loves her Tajikistan very much. 

She has dreamed since childhood to be a doctor. Now, she is a student of the second course at the Medical University of Tajikistan. She studies well and reads a lot of books. 

Aminamo’s parents are workers and have no opportunity to pay her university's annual fee. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Ghazal Group

texts.en:
Hamda is the featured borrower for Ghazal Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hamda is a 39-year-old married mother of one child who started long ago working in a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. In addition to the grocery shop, she started working ten years ago in handicrafts to increase her income, but due to increasing living costs, her income is not enough anymore. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy fuel for the winter season to protect her family from the cold weather.

Hamda is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Nagham is the first lady on the right of the photo, and Reema is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the winter season.

loans.name: Khairiya

texts.en:
Khairiya is a 41-year-old married mother of three, who works in a school to help her beloved husband, who is also employed in the same school, in covering her family's increasing living needs.

Khairiya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for necessary medical treatment expenses she has to undergo, in addition to preparing herself for the upcoming winter season with a special diesel oil request for warming up. She will also use part of the acquired loan to help her son in his engagement expenses.

She hopes that in the future she can open a grocery store of her own and develop her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To pay for necessary medical treatment expenses she has to undergo, in addition to preparing herself for the upcoming winter season with a special diesel oil request for warming up

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 20-year-old single man who has an internet cafe and hooka services. He is working hard to cover his needs and expenses. Jaafar is an ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through opening International call center to attract more customers and satisfy their needs. This loan is very important to Jaafar for it will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To develop his business through opening International call center to attract more customers and satisfy their needs.

loans.name: Amine

texts.en:
Amine is a 24-year-old single man, who has been working in the transportation business for four years ago. He specializes in transporting agriculture needs, and water supplies.

Amine is a hard worker; he used to help his father in a similar business where he got a wide experience in this domain.

Amine is working hard on developing his business in a well-managed way, but his income isn't good enough to develop it properly because of his other family commitments. He is the sole earner of family including two other members.

Thus, to develop his business, he acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to renew his tractor which he is using for his business to make sure he can improve his provided services.

Amine hopes to keep on developing his business as much as he can and recruit someone to help him in the future.

loans.use: To renew his tractor which he is using for his business to make sure he can improve his provided services.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish and new clothes, accessories, perfumes and other items to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase appliances for her house.

loans.name: Salwa Group

texts.en:
This is Salwa group. It is the same group with the same members of the first loan. They applied for a second loan of 180,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Fatema also, is the same leader of the group. She applied for the first loan from Kiva lenders to buy perfumes, incense, and clothes to sell. The first loan helped Fatema very much in increasing and enlarging her business more. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their loan. She didn't complete the repayment of all the installments of the first loan yet and instead applied for a second loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase another amount of perfumes, accessories, incense, and clothes to expand her business more and to be able to attract a lot of customers.

All the members of the group hope to be financed in this loan too.

loans.use: to purchase more perfumes, accessories, incense, and clothes to expand her business more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electronic items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material to manufacture dental surgical goods

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. She belongs to an ultra-poor family, which cannot afford the children's educational expenses. Most of her children are day laborers. One of her sons helps Rashida's husband in his blacksmith business.

Rashida's husband provides welding services for his customers both in his blacksmith shop and on-site. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding supplies such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to continue his business. To fulfill the demands of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs capital to buy more welding supplies. Rashida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he can buy the welding supplies.

Rashida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for welding service.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Victor, Musa and Samaila.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Daniel  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Farhan Ali

texts.en:
Farhan has a general store for selling general items in Karachi. He is a hardworking and fair person. He has gained good experience in this business, and feels it’s the right time to invest more in the business to make it more profitable, given the increasing demand for general items. 

Farhan is 51 years old and the father of four children. 

He wants to start saving money for his children’s marriages, and has therefore requested a loan to purchase general items to grow sales. He is hopeful for his business and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their ready assistance.

loans.use: to purchase general Items

loans.name: Nawaz Awan

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is Nawaz. He is 36 years old and living in the popular area of Karachi, Pakistan. He has been running a medical store for many years, and it is not working very well due to a shortage of sufficient financing. His shop is situated under a populated area, and a lot of customers are available here to offer miscellaneous medical items. He wants to keep sufficient inventories at his store; however, due to the lack of availability of funds he is unable to buy most demanded inventories. 

Therefore, Nawaz Awan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to buy the inventories. Nawaz Awan is very glad of the offer to receive this loan and is hopeful that he will succeed to fulfill each request from his customers and abstain from the disappointment. 

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase medical items for his shop.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
A young and enthusiastic entrepreneur, Tariq runs a tea shop (hotel) in Karachi. He is 32, married, and father of two children. He is gaining more experience with time, and has improved his business a lot. His tea is very famous in the community and he has made many loyal customers over time. People come to his shop to have a sip of his famous tea and get energized.

He is organized and disciplined; Tariq wants to boost his sales. For this purpose, he has requested a loan to get more established and improve his living standards.

He is very thankful Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase tea & milk for his shop.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yahaya expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Asel

texts.en:
Asel is a freshman at the in college. Here is her story:

“Nowadays, living is very hard without higher education. In Kyrgyzstan you can’t find a good job if you don’t have a higher education and diploma. It’s unusual for our employers to give a job place to a person, just according to her/his possibility or skills as in America, where a lot of famous people even without higher education could be who they are now. So, understanding that I live in Kyrgyzstan, I dreamed of getting a degree in European Studies at college.

Since my school years I was wondering why European and Asian people are so different. We have different way of life, culture, cuisine. We loved to listen to our teachers while they told us of their trips to other countries and adventures they had. I wished I could also go, explore and feel those emotions. That’s why I did not need time to think what I would study; I knew that I had to enter college. My college has prominent foreign teachers, international atmosphere, where staff and students are like one big family. I had a chance to be a member of it while studying at the New Generation Academy at my college last year, when I won a full scholarship for one-year-study. I met a lot of friends from various countries, had memorable events out of class and a unique spirit with my classmates.

My studies as an undergraduate student brought much headache to my parents as they don’t have enough money for my tuition. They are school-teachers; they are budgetary organizations’ workers with a low salary. We also have land and we grow cotton, sunflower, corn and vegetables there. Of course, this income doesn’t allow me and my brothers to buy what we want or study where we want. Because, the work in the field is a seasonal work and depends on other circumstances.

I am thankful for Kiva to giving us such a chance to get a loan for my studies and my family waits for your mercy.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Safaraly

texts.en:
Safaraly is married and has four children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that ten years ago, he began his own business with taxi driving. Thanks to the good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, Now his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

Safaraly is asking for a loan to buy new car. 

In this way, Safaraly's business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income. This will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat was born in 1981. She is a very sociable woman. She is married and has 3 children, and lives with her family in northern Tajikistan. She has her  own business. 

She is a sewer and offers her services to local people. She makes a variety of clothing. Malohat has worked in this way for 8 years. She has regular customers, thanks to her high quality service. 

She wants to increase her working capital and maximize profit, so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabrics. She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Zoirjon

texts.en: Zoirjon is 35 years old. He comes from a rural area. Zoirjon is married and has four children. His wife is Zebo. Zoirjon and his wife try to offer their children a good living standard. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than two years. He buys cows, feeds them for some months, and then sells them in a local market. Zoirjon manages the business alone. He has an additional business, a crop-farming business. He grows crops and sells them in a local market. Zoirjon is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to buy a cow. He awaits your support, and in advance thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is a married woman from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children; one is single and three are married. To make a living, in 2005 she opened a grocery store to serve people in her community. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy construction materials to renovate her house. 

She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded, to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona is a 30-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has had a sari-sari store business for 8 years. Rhona  sells items like canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, coffee, milk, chips and soap. Rhona works hard to improve her business and her family's living situation. This is also her way of helping her husband who is a fisherman. 

Rhona requested a loan to buy more merchandise to replenish her stock such as canned goods, coffee, chips, candies, eggs and milk. When her shelves are fully-stocked, it  looked more attractive to her customers and she will have a better chance of increase income. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business. This will also help support her two children, aged one and twelve, with their schooling fees and providing a healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy stock such as canned goods, coffee, chips, candies, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a 41-year-old, married woman, and a mother of three children, from Concepcion, Iloilo. Mary Jean runs a small restaurant, locally known as a "carenderia." She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for more than 14 years.

Mary Jean is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her prepared foods, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, and others. With a loan, she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers.

Mary Jean hopes to expand her food business in the future, so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food to sell, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, and rice.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida engages in fishing. She earns a living by selling fish to the nearby community.She is a 47 year old, married woman with eight dependents. Five of her children are still attending school. To augment her income, she also engages in producing and selling tuba (coconut) wine.

Aida is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat, fishing net and ingredients in making tuba like tungog -( it gives maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation). She can now improve her fishing technique and hopefully it could create higher yields. She could also produce more tuba wine for her respective customers. This will result in providing her family with a nutritious diet and suitable living conditions.

Aida hopes that she could manage both her businesses well so that she could finance her children to a college education for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat, fishing net and ingredients  in  making tuba like tungog -( it gives  maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation)

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman, who engages in a chicken feed retail business. She is thirty-four years old and a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. She sells chicken feed like crumbles, pellets and mash. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years now. In the photo, Glenda displays chicken feed already packed for retail basis. 

Glenda has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock of chicken feed. This will help Glenda filled her store with a variety of stock, cater to more customers, and hopefully help augment her daily income. In this way, she could pay her loan and roll back her capital to any business venture.

In the future, Glenda would like to expand her business to make it productive and profitable for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of garments and blankets for her business

loans.name: Sonam

texts.en:
Sonam is a 22-year-old married woman. Her husband is involved in business running beauty salon since 8 years. Some years back Sonam has joined her husband's business. Now they are doing it together and earns sufficient income to meet their household expenditures. Sonam offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. She has become well-known in her community for the quality of the services she provides. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Sonam is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for her parlor. For this reason she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to buy greater quantities of hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams. 

Sonam is hopeful she will be able to cater to more customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
62-year-old Estrella raises and sells hogs in Macarthur, Leyte. She is married with two grown children. She also earns an income as a fisherwoman.

Estrella is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP through CEVI to buy pig feed and tilapia bait. This investment could enable Estrella to raise and sell more hogs and catch more fish to sell, so improving her livelihood. She wishes to see her businesses be stable and her life’s conditions improve.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and tilapia bait.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, 40, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, her business partner, and has three children; two are in college, and the youngest is still in high school.  She and her husband together manage their own household. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expenses and the school needs of her children.

Leah has been into the food business for a number of years already. She and her husband roast and sell "litson manok" (roasted chicken). She has three employees who assist them in their business. "Litson manok" is one of the favorites of Filipinos. It is always in demand for its yummy taste, and it is cheaper than beef. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to pay for more kilos of chicken, a cart, charcoal, and other ingredients needed in her business. She is positive that her sales will significantly increase this coming Christmas holiday. She is thanking God and you in advance for the good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Leah dreams that her business will continue to grow. She aims to give her children a good education in order for them to have a good future. She prays for a happy and united family. She faithfully meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for dozens of chickens, a cart, charcoal, and other ingredients to roast chicken to sell.

loans.name: Kundamalen Shg Group

texts.en:
Surabhi is 25 years old and is married with two children. Surabhi lives in Boudh district, a rural town in Odisha state. She is the leader of a ten-member group, the Kundamalen Shg Group. Surabhi works in agriculture raising goats. She has been involved in this business for more than four years. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase baby goats to raise for future sale. In 2014, Surabhi joined Peoples Forum to improve her business. The main hardship that Surabhi faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Surabhi hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby goats to raise for future sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for decoration and furnishing of the hair and beauty Salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Keneth, Tabitha and Ross.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Glory Jean

texts.en: Glory Jean is a 30-year old high school graduate and lives in Pulupandan. She is married to Aristeo who works as an OFW in Dubai. They have 2 children aged 6 and  4. Their total monthly family income is only Php20,000.00 ($455). Glory Jean needs to help her spouse but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed the selection process, she needs your help with her tuition. A few months from now, she should be able to take the first steps in securing a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a 24-year old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Michael, who works as a fisherman. They have 2 children ages 4 and 1. Their total monthly family income is only Php8,000.00 ($182). Luzviminda wants to help her spouse but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Luzviminda starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Rezil

texts.en: Rezil is a 33-year old college graduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Markel, who works as call center agent. They have 8-year old child. Their total monthly family income is only Php10,000.00 ($227). Rezil also wants to be a call center agent to be able to  help her spouse that's why she Bagosphere's selection process and passed it. She needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Rezil starts earning, she can contribute to her family's basic needs and then save some money for her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala is 38 years old. She is living in the Fuzuli region with her family. For the past 22 years Kamala and her family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from the city of Fuzuli. She has been selling food products for seven years already. Today she wants to increase the family retail business and for that she needs a loan in the amount of 2,350 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to pay for new types of daily cleaning products (washing powder, shampoo, bleaches, and etc.). She hopes that this loan will develop her business and her monthly income will increase. Kamala says great thanks to the Kiva organization for the loan and help to her for increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to increase her monthly income, and make repairs to her store in the future.

loans.name: Farig

texts.en:
Farig is an I.D.P. (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city, now living in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has four children.

Farig has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years.  He breeds cattle.  Winter is coming, and Farig now needs a loan of AZN 1,300 to buy vaccination for his animals. This is his third loan. 

Farig said: "My business well developing, and great thanks for every loan to Kiva organization and lenders."

loans.use: to buy vaccination for animals

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang (in the photo) is 37 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal district in Kandal province, along the Mekong River, Cambodia. She has been married since 2008 and has one daughter and two sons. They are still young.

Heang is a grocer with two years of experience, while her husband is an ambulance driver with six months of experience. She would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike and groceries and to repair her house, because she wants to increase the business and repair the house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and groceries and to repair her house.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun (Shown in photo) is 40 years old, and lives in the Khsach kandal district along the Mekong river.
She had been married since 1992 and has four daughters. Two attend school and another one is a factory worker. 

Yeun is a farmer planted the lotuses 10 years in her experiences, while her husband is a fisherman with 10 years of experience. She wants to apply for a loan to purchase wood to repair her house. Because the house is old, she wants to repair it.

She comments that she will have a new house and a comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: To fill the land around her house.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: На фотографии Хайринисо. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж преподаватель. Хайринисо честная, доброжелательная и приятная в общении женщина. Она занимается продажей риса. Столько времени Хайринисо покупала и перепродавала рис на местном рынке. Она хочет расширить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Она решила обратиться за кредитом и на заемные деньги приобрести веревки, нитки, посуду, железные цепи, ошейники для собак и многое другое. Для нее продажа таких товаров как новая деятельность. Она недавно купила только веревки и уверена что с увеличением ассортимента товара увеличиться и доход. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
In the photo you can see Khayriniso. She is 56 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. Khayriniso is an honest, friendly and pleasant woman. She works with selling rice. 

Khayriniso has for a long time purchased and sold rice at the local market. She would like to expand her assortment of goods to sell. She decided to apply for a loan and use the borrowed money to purchase ropes, strings, utensils, iron chains, dog collars and other products. Selling these types of products is a new activity for her. Not long ago, she purchased only ropes and she is sure that increasing the assortment of goods will also increase her income. She extends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to purchase ropes, strings, chains and other products to expand her assortment of goods

loans.name: Abos

texts.ru: Абосу 51 год. Он уроженец района Сарбанд. Сарбанд находиться на юго-западной части Республики. Абос в течение 5 лет работает водителем. Его сыновья работают в Российской Федерации. Младший сын учиться в Университете и параллельно работает таксистом в свободное от учебы время. Абос видит, как старается сын работать и учиться одновременно. Его сын не бросает работу, чтобы покрыть свои расходы, но старается уделить больше времени и внимания учебе. Абос видит старания сына и хочет помочь ему. Сына еще не оплачен учебный контракт и Абос обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатить учебный контракт. Тогда он сможет продолжить учебу и стать специализированный кадром.
texts.en: Abos is 51 years old. He is a native of the Sarband district. Sarband is located in the south-western part of the Republic. Abos has been working as a driver for 5 years. His sons work in the Russian Federation. The youngest son attends a university and also works as a taxi driver during his time free from school. Abos sees how his son tries to work and study at the same time. His son is not quitting his work to cover his expenses, but tries to devote more time and attention to his studies. Abos sees his son's efforts and wants to help him. His son has not yet paid for his university tuition, and Abos is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition, enabling his son to continue his studies and becoming a qualified resource.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru: Нурбиби продолжает свою животноводческую и сельскохозяйственную деятельность на протяжении 15 лет. Она опытный животновод и растениевод. Свой предыдущий кредит она брала для увеличения поголовья скотов и уже успешно погасила этот кредит. Сегодня она повторно обратилась за кредитом с той же целью, а именно для купли пару голов крупнорогатых скотин. Нурбиби в данный момент в своем скотном дворе не имееет других скотов, кроме осла, который изображен вместе с ней на фотографии. Поэтому этот кредит поможет ей приобрести необходимое количество коров, продолжить животноводческую деятельность и сохранить источник дохода. Поддержите Нурбиби в этот нужный момент.
texts.en: Nurbibi has been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming for the past 15 years.  She is an experienced livestock breeder and farmer.  She used her previous loan to increase her cattle headcount and she successfully repaid her loan.  Today, she is once again taking a loan with the same goal, specifically to buy a couple of cows.  At the moment Nurbibi doesn't own any other animal than the donkey pictured with her in the photo.  For this reason, this loan will help her to purchase the necessary number of cows, in order to pursue her animal husbandry activity and keep her source of income.  Will you please support Nurbibi at a time when she really needs it?

loans.use: to buy several cows

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Его зовут Абдурасул. Ему 33 года. Он работает водителем маршрутного такси. Абдурасул женатый мужчина. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка и Абдурасул один кормит семью. У Абдурасула есть брат, который не имеет работу. Абдурасул хочет получить кредит и купить микроавтобус, для брата, чтобы тот тоже имел работу и начал зарабатывать. Его брат сам не может обратиться за кредитом и поэтому Абдурасул является кредитоспособным и сам вызвался помочь брату. Он не безразличен к судьбе брата и всячески старается поддержать его. Абдурасул надеется, что вы также не останетесь равнодушным и поддержите его семью.
texts.en: Meet Abdurasul.  He is 33 years old and he works as a taxi driver along a transportation route.  He is also married and the father of three children.  His wife is a homemaker, so Abdurasul is the family's only breadwinner.  Abdurasul has a brother who doesn't have a job at the moment.  He wants to take a loan in order to buy a minivan for his brother, so that his brother will also have a job and will be able to make a living.  His brother doesn't have the means to apply for a loan himself, so it is Abdurasul himself, who is eligible for a loan, who is applying on his brother's behalf.   He is very concerned about his brother's fate and he is trying to support him as best as he can.  He is hoping that you will also not stay indifferent, and that you will support his family.

loans.use: to buy a minivan for his brother.

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz is 47 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a great father and loving husband. His son studies in his first course of college and his daughter goes to 10th class. Amina is Novruz's wife. She is a housewife and helps Novruz in his business. Novruz’s family has been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city for 22 years already and now they live in Füzuli region.
 
Novruz has cows. He sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc.), which are made by Novruz and his wife. Now Novruz wants to buy cows. Therefore, he needs a loan of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

He is thankful for this loan from Kiva and the Komak organization. In the future, to increase his business, Novruz wants to repair his stall.

loans.use: to buy cows, increase business and, in the future, to repair his stall

loans.name: Jalem

texts.en:
Jalem is 27 years old, single, and a resident of Ozamiz City. He earns a living through his small eatery business.

He has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000. He will use the loan to buy spices and meat for the carenderia business (cafeteria), to sustain the needs of the family. Jalem deeply wishes to maintain his status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy spices and meat for the carenderia business (cafeteria), to sustain the needs of the family.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is widowed, with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luciana is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Luciana has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, utensils, etc. for her food production business.

Luciana has been in this business for a year.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Excelsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Excelsa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like spices, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, etc for her food vending business.
