Excelsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like spices, cooking oil, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee. Delia has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 49 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a nipa roofing "buy and sell" in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more nipa roofing to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 62 years old and a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Consolacion has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Consolacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Consolacion would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Shiela is 28 years old and has one child in school.

Shiela has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Shiela requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Shiela has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Milad

texts.en: Milad is a 22-year-old single man living in Ajloun. He is studying to get his bachelor's degree in economics and Islamic banking,and he is now in his fourth year. His parents work as teachers, but recently they are facing some financial problems that lead Milad to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Milad’s future plan is to find work in the same field.

loans.use: pay for semester fees

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak is 29 years old and he lives with his nice wife in the village Gugark in the Lori region. They are just married and have no baby yet. Arshak’s wife is unemployed. Arshak has already worked for five years as a driver-distributor. This is his own business. He buys a great range of cans and various soft drinks from different companies and all these he keeps in his own storage garage. Every day he fulfills more than 50 orders because in his region he works with 400 big and small food shops and markets that give him orders and buy from him. Arshak is a very punctual man and he works honestly, always on time and with an offer of fresh and tasty products.

Arshak seeks a loan of 110,000 Armenian drams because he wants to repair his storage garage, which is very old one and really needs some repairs. Arshak wants to be sure that all of his products are kept in a safe and clean place.

loans.use: to repair his storage garage because it is very old

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: Tamer is an 18-year-old single man living in AlMafraq. He is studying to get his Bachelor's degree in math and he is now in his first year. His parents work in the military and his family consists of four members. But recently they are facing some financial problems that led to Tamer applying for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Tamer’s future plan is to find work in the same field

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Recarte

texts.en:
Recarte is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retailing gasoline business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional container of gasoline to sell for his retailing gasoline business.

Recarte has been in this business for eight years. Recarte earns more income from pig fattening.

Recarte has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional container of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a conservative married lady.  She asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.

Maha is a fifty one year old, who lives in AlBaqaa with her family. Hasan has been working as a barber since he was young and gained a lot of experience in this field. Eleven years ago, Maha and Hasan decided to open their own barbershop based on his experience. Now they want to do remodeling of the shop, repair the chairs and buy new equipment. For that reason, Maha is applying for this loan.

loans.use: to do remodeling for the shop, repair the chairs and buy new equipment.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is a twenty-four-year-old single man living in al Baqaa – one of the Palestinian refugee camps in Jordan. He finished the diploma degree in engineering but did not find a job that meets his ambitions. So he turned to the idea of having his own business. Baker worked to set up a shop to sell household cleaning materials and detergents to serve the people in his district. 

Baker is applying for a youth loan to add new kinds of detergents to the shop to increase his profit.

loans.use: To add new kinds of detergents to the shop to increase his profit.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 51-year-old single man living in al Baqaa, one of the Palestinian refugee camps in Jordan. He opened a grocery store five years ago to serve the people in his district. Mohammad is applying for a loan to add new kinds of products for the shop to increase his profit.

loans.use: to add new kinds of products for the shop to increase his profit.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is a 43-year-old woman who is looking after her children from her first marriage besides supporting her new family. In order to do so, Ekhlas is doing a detergent selling business from home. Sometimes she has to mix it in her backyard and then pour it into different size bottles. 

Ekhlas is trying to increase her income so she can have her storage room where she can mix the detergents far from home and from the children. But now Ekhlas is applying for a loan to buy more detergents and more bottles for her business.

loans.use: To pay for buy more detergents and more bottles for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a conservative woman, so she asked her son Eyad to appear in the photo in her place. 

one of Halima's children is Eyad, a 24-year-old single man. Eyad goes to college to get a diploma degree, as enrolling in a university was expensive for them. Now Eyad is in his last year, and he needs to buy some books and register for the final diploma exam, which they can’t afford at this time. For this reason, Halima applied for this loan to help her son pay for the exam registration and the needed books to help him pass it and get his certificate.

loans.use: To pay for her son's final diploma exam registration and for the needed books to help pass it

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees  is 44 years old and married woman. The man shown in the photo is Balqees ’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Balqees  has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR, for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Balqees is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts

loans.name: Kaihang

texts.en:
Kaihang was a successful businessman previously. Now he is 34 years old and a divorced man who is raising two children alone. He did not read many books when he was a student and he went to work as a teenager. The poor family let him become a more sensible child than his typical peers very early. He is diligent and hardworking.

Last year was the most desperate time in his life. His business failed and he was forced to divorce his wife. At that time, his father was sick heavily, and in order to cure his father, he sold his house. Unfortunately, his father still passed away this year. Now, he has to support two children who are both in school and take care of his 86-year-old mother.
 
He didn’t shrink from the heavy burden of the family. With the help of his friend, he opened a shop to sell fishing tackle. Kaihang requested￥10,000 from MicroCred. He will use the money to purchase finishing rod and fish bait so that he can expand his business and earn enough money to support his family. Kaihang hopes that he can try his best to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase finishing rod and fish bait

loans.name: Hülya

texts.en:
Hülya has a child. She started creating ornaments and crafts voluntarily. She gave lessons in primary schools, associations and to mentally retarded people. Later on, when she started living with her child, she sold these ornaments, thus making a contribution to the family budget. 

She bought materials for her ornaments with the help of the loan she got. She is planning to increase her sales.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hülya Hanım bir çocuk annesi .  Takı ve el sanatlarına gönüllü olarak başlamış.  İlkokullarda, derneklerde, zihinsel engellilere ders vermiş.  Daha sonraki yıllarda, çocuğumla beraber yaşamaya başlayınca ,ürettiğim takıları satmaya başlamış.  Evine ,aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamış.  Aldığım kredi ile taķı malzemesi almış ve üreterek satışlarını artırarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for her ornaments

loans.name: Pampa

texts.en: The borrower lives in Jogeshgunj village, West Bengal. Pampa is actively involved in educating school children about the health problems of changing food diets and the benefits of nutritious traditional food diets. She is also engaged in seed production with Sundarbans Seed Producers Group. Her husband and daughter also help in her business. The income that she is generating now is not adequate to maintain her family household, for which she wants to enlarge her seed production business. The loan will be used for establishing a desi vegetable seed farm. With the additional income, she wants to change her standard of living and secure her future.

loans.use: to enlarge her seed production business.

loans.name: Inaam

texts.en:
Inaam is a 51-year-old Lebanese woman. She is widowed with three children. She has been a farmer since 2008 and is the sole bread earner for her family. Her work as a farmer is essential to her and allows her to support her large family.

Through the loan she will obtain from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she wants to purchase equipment for her business such as irrigation tools and crops. In this way, she can increase and improve her production capacity.

In the future, she hopes she can improve the quality of the harvest and exploit whatever land she still owns more efficiently in order to increase her income and her ability to provide a better life to her family and kids.

loans.use: to purchase equipment.

loans.name: Union Crucena Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área caracterizada por agrupar a empresas y oficinas de todo tipo. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente entre 21-35 grados centígrados que varía durante el dia.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello color castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio (fila de atrás, primera de la derecha, usa blusa negra). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que está construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de polleras, servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos como; maquillaje facial, perfumes, lápiz labial, mascara de pestañas, y otros. Lo realiza de forma ambulante ofreciendo sus productos mediante catálogo y regalando algunas muestras, en oficinas, tiendas de ropa, universidades, etc. Labor que realiza de lunes a domingo en horarios de oficina. “me gusta mi trabajo porque de esa manera me relaciono con mucha gente y me recomiendan a nuevos clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda distribuidora de cosméticos. Ella desea realizar la compra de cosméticos por mayor para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a 21-year-old woman, single with no children, and her business is in cosmetic sales.

She is sweet, caring, sensitive, sincere, independent, responsible, and hard working.  She does her business in the “Mutualista” Zone, an area characterized by groups of all types of businesses and offices.  It’s a warm, tropical, humid climate, with an ambient temperature of 21-35 degrees Celsius, which varies during the day.

Maria has a dark complexion, long brown hair, and is of medium height.  Her native language is Guarani, and she speaks Spanish for business.  She is in the back row, the first on the right, wearing a black blouse.  She lives in her parents’ house, which is made of brick and has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.  Her desires to get ahead drove her to form a group of people with businesses, such as traditional skirt making, flower sales, tea service, and a sewing workshop, to request a loan and expand their businesses.  Her business is selling cosmetics, such as facial makeup, perfume, lip pencils, mascara, and so on.  Her business is mobile.  She offers her products through a catalog and gives away some samples in offices, clothing stores, universities, etc.  She works Monday through Sunday during business hours.  She says, “I like my work because that way, I interact with a lot of people, and they recommend new customers to me.”  Her dream is to have a cosmetic distribution store.  She wants to purchase wholesale cosmetics to meet her customers’ needs.  This is her first loan cycle with the lending institution during the year she has been carrying out this business.

It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics, to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Mohsenah

texts.en:
Borrower Mohsenah is a 56-year-old Lebanese widowed woman with two children. She owns and operates a homemade food business that she runs from her own kitchen at home. She is a hardworking woman and acts as the sole breadwinner for her modest family.

Through the loan she will obtain from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l., she is planning to purchase raw material and other items such as cooking equipment to grow her business and increase her production capacity.

For the future, she aims to develop her business to meet the potential demand for homemade food in the area and thus to improve the standard of living of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase raw material and other items such as cooking equipment

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, all of whom are attending school. She produces food at her domicile to be conserved, and she really makes appetizing provisions that can be kept for a good period of time, as they are well preserved. 

Currently, she seeks to make use of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase necessities such as bottles, pots and jars that can quite improve her business and increase its productivity. Khadijeh is impatient to receive the loan, and she is certain that the loan will have a positive effect on her income.

loans.use: purchase necessities.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 45 years old, married, and has three adult children. She operates a sari-sari (general) store, which she has been doing for more than nine years. She earn a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. 

Lucila requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to purchase stocks like beverages and grocery items. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks such as beverages and groceries

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora lives in Sto.Niño, Pagadian City, and supports her three daughters by building houses, from the ground up. She has applied a loan which she used to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paints, and to pay the workers.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing dental services.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is driven by passion in selling. She is age 57, married, and lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City. She runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family.

Every day, she patiently tends her store until evening. Narcisa wants to expand her business; she recently signed up for her membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurance and financial assistance.

Now, she has borrowed a loan to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Minea's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Minea is 26 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is too young for school. The main source of her family income is from growing cassava. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income for his family. The current business earns her about 53,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Minea has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully repaid back the past loan. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for supporting her cassava. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for supporting her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Battambang Province, Cambodia, Rom is 51 years old and a mother of three children. As her main source of income, she grows rice on two and half hectares. For Rom, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader of three, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 34 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y solo vive con ella y sus dos hijos, solo ellos 3 depende de él. Juan es agricultor y siembra granos básicos, aprendió de su padre que se dedicaba a la misma actividad, además es integrante de un grupo musical, practica con su hijo y de esta manera percibe también unos ingresos cuando cubren algún evento.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar los gastos de cosecha, tiene que contratar mano de obra para sacar la producción y tener el grano lista para guardarlo o venderlo. Como todo buen padre espera dar a sus hijos el estudio completo para que tengan una vida más fácil que la suya.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, married and has two children who are one and nine years old. His wife is a housewife, and he only lives with her and his two children. The three of them depend on him.

Juan is a farmer and grows staple foods. He learned from his father, who earned a living the same way. He's also a member of a musical group and practices with his son. When they cover an event, he also receives some income from this.

He's asking for a loan to pay for harvest costs. He has to hire day labor to complete the production and have the grain ready to save or sell. Like every good father, he wants to give his children complete schooling so they can have an easier life than his.

loans.use: to pay harvest costs.

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en:
Kun, 54, is a widow living with her seven children in a rural village of the Korng Pisey district in Kampong Spue province, Cambodia.

She earns a living through farming rice and she has been in this business for 36 years, earning about KHR 17,000 per day. She is able to save about KHR 7,000 each day for future needs after expenses. Sometimes, she earns additional income by working as a paid worker to better support her family. The main challenge for her business is from drought.

Kun is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Kun wants to use her portion to construct a decent latrine for use by her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine for use by her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en:
Leab is a 43-year-old mother of four dependent children living in a rural village of Korng Pisey District, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 25 years. Her husband supplements the family’s income by working as a garment worker. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan cycle for Leab with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Leab wants to use her portion to build a decent latrine to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 44 years old and has two children. She lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She grows rice on one hectare, which she has been doing for many years, and earns 33,300 KHR (8 USD) per day. 

Sok requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use  to buy fertilizers and rice seed to support her rice farm. She leads a group of two members. She hopes to improve her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke's previous loans have been for buying materials and tools for her metalworking lathe.This time around she needs a loan to make basic repairs to their family home that is almost collapsing and to pay for her pension contribution. She did not like being photographed in her house due to the uneasiness she felt, so she chose to be photographed in her little shop that she is fond of. 

Luke wanted to thank all her lenders and wished them 'happy season' ahead.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to the family home that is almost collapsing

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila has been photographed here with her husband, Sadik, and their youngest child. What they are holding in their hand are chilli peppers.
 
The loan that they are requesting this time is to buy chilli peppers, as the couple receives orders from wholesale buyers for this product. This type of activity lasts only up until the end of November. With the rest of the loan they will buy other items such as shoes, clothes, kitchenware and electronics to resell.

loans.use: to buy chilli peppers and sell them to whole buyers

loans.name: Tikeran

texts.en:
Tikeran is 35 years old, a differently-able man who lives in Kalahandi district of Odisha state, India with his parents, wife and two children. He is engaged in a tailoring service business. He is expert in shirts, trousers, suits and ladies' salwar outfits. He makes 6,000 INR per month. He is the only earning person in his family. His father is a farmer who produces paddy rice. His wife helps him in the tailoring business.

Tikeran has a plan to expand his business and for this reason he has requested this loan to buy two new sewing machines. He hopes that will make him able to earn more money from his investment. He will keep a laborer for stitching clothes.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Living with her child and husband, Elvira wanted to improve more their livelihood and in turn improve her family's condition of living. 

Originally hailing from a province in Visayas, Elvira and her family migrated to Cavite to find better income opportunities. She started out working in a mini-grocery store as a helper and from which learned about the trade. In 2013 she was invited by a neighbor to join SEED and was consequently provided an loan which  she used to set up a small retail store selling basic commodities in her community. Thereafter and on her 9th loan cycle now with SEED, Elvira has steadily grown her retail business and was able to surpass in several folds the meager income she had when she was still employed. To date, Elvira needs PhP 30,000 to buy additional cavans of rice and sugar which she repacks and sells in retail to customers in her community. Elvira is fully aware that repacking basic goods such as rice and sugar in smaller quantity makes it more affordable to customers to buy relative to selling in bulk volumes as other stores are doing.

With the business working well, Elvira was able to finance the education of her child. She hopes one day to see her child finish school and obtaining a good life.

loans.use: To buy additional cavans of rice and sugar to be repacked and sold in retail.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa's life was a story of perennial migration due to livelihood conditions. Born in Pasay, Manila, Marissa and her family went back to Leyte when her father lost his job. As conditions were also difficult in the province, Marissa had to work as a house helper in an aunt in Caloocan. With diligence and hard work, Marissa was able to finish college and began working in a known paper company in Manila. There, Marissa met her husband and started to build her own family. As it was also difficult for her and her husband to have a stable job in Manila, they decided to try transferring to Cavite where there are factories that might absorb them for employment.

In Cavite, and at that point in time, Marissa decided to break the cycle of migrating in search for better income opportunities. She initially set up a small store in her house and sold in-demand commodities in the community.  In 2013, Marissa availed a loan from SEED which she used to start up a bed-spacing business. From where Marissa lives, factories abound and she knows that like her and her family, there is a big market of workers living outside Cavite who works in the area due to employment potentials. She used her first loan to construct bunker beds for bed-space rentals.

On her 6th loan now, Marissa wants to avail a PhP 30,000 loan which she will use to repair her store and renovate her bed-space rooms which are for rent. If repairs are done, her store will be more secured and would have better display shelves. On the other hand, her 6 rooms for rent will become 9 after the renovation. All in all, these would provide Marissa with increased incomes and her family a stable and better life.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs of her sari-sari store and renovate her bed-space rooms for rent to include installation of kitchen sinks.

loans.name: Emerilyn

texts.en:
Emerilyn has previously acquired a loan amounting to PhP 25,000 which she used to buy rice, canned goods, snack items and school supplies which was then demanded during the opening of the school year. From the capital infused, Emerilyn was able to finance the requirements of her business and has improved also her earnings. She was successfully able to pay back her loan and on top of this increased her weekly income by 15%.

Today, Emerilyn wants to take out a loan of PhP 30,000. Of which, she plans to buy more cavans of rice, processed meat products and canned goods. As with her previous loan, Emerilyn sees that the upcoming Christmas season is an opportune time to do invest more in her grocery store business specially as these products which she will finance are highly demanded by customers.

Emerilyn's ultimate goal is to save and be able to buy a house which her family can call their own as well as continuously support the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, processed meat and canned goods which are highly demanded for the Christmas Season.

loans.name: Maa Samalei Shg Group

texts.en:
Group Maa Samalei Shg is composed of eleven married women. They are on average 33 years old with three children. They live in nuclear families, in a rural area of Boudh district of Odisha, India.

They met through neighborly, friendship and trade relations. To increase their financial capacity and develop their business, they joined micro-finance institution Peoples Forum. This is their first loan and they committed to repay on time.

This group trades vegetables, fruits, fashion items and cosmetics. With her loan, Shanti is planning on purchasing cosmetics and fashion items from the wholesalers in Boudh. She sells from door-to-door to mixed-gender clients. She takes cash and offers payment facilities.

She is forecasting making good monthly profit which will be reinvested in the business once the loan is repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and fashion items from the wholesalers to resell.

loans.name: Poniyah

texts.en:
This is the story of Hartati, daughter of Poniyah:

"I was the second of two brothers. The economy of my family was minimal, due to meet daily needs, and it is not enough, especially for school fees.

"My parents are farmers and have no other income, while income from agriculture is also uncertain, because in my area also does not allow the conditions. Because of the bad weather, the yields obtained are not sufficient to meet the daily needs. If the weather is nice, the harvest can help our family needs.

"I am very grateful for the Kiva program so I can go to school. This program will be very useful and very helpful for my parents. In the picture, Hartati and Poniyah her mother.

"That is a glimpse profile my family. Thank you."

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other member of her family. She has been selling raw food and vegetables in the market at retail for the last two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, yams, potatoes (both sweet and Irish) and vegetables for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to buy a plot of land to start farming. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans.

She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, yams, Irish potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Hello world, meet Peter. Peter and his family live and practice farming in Nyamira which is a remote area in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Most of Nyamira’s constituents live in off-grid areas and rely on kerosene lamps to light up their homes. Peter’s family, for instance, is often forced to stay in the dark whenever there is a shortage of kerosene in the market. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which partnered with Micro Energy Credits to start a clean energy programme, Peter is seeking a loan to pay for a Pro 2 Solar lantern that will guarantee him a 100% saving on Kerosene. The new lamp has adjustable brightness that makes it possible for the lamp’s application to range from being a desk light for his children to complete homework, to a torch for patrolling his farmland at night. You can help Peter transform his livelihood by lending him a small amount of money that will enabling him to quit using a kerosene lamp that emits more toxins than light and go for an environmentally friendly source of lighting that his kids will enjoy using.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en: Hong’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Hong makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and he also does extra work as a tailor and village coordinator to support his family.In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, and fungicide to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a food vendor from Iloilo, Philippines.  She is 45 years old, married, and has six children.  She sells home cooked food to the people in her area as her source of income. 

Eva is asking for a loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and canned goods for her food vending business.  With this loan, Eva will be able to cook and sell more food to her customers.  In the future, Eva hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and canned goods for food vending.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Hello, lenders!

Meet Miriam, a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya.

Miriam is happily married and, together with her husband, blessed with three lovely children. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Miriam has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up: “I have to do something for my family,“ she said.

Miriam mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Miriam is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge leading to her suffering many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Miriam is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Miriam feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Miriam will never again suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, leading to increased income level.

Miriam is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping with farm work. With your loan, Miriam will improve her living conditions and assure a secure future for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to the market

loans.name: Eudia

texts.en:
Eudia is a rural farmer in Eldoret, Kenya, which is an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Eudia is blessed with three children, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years.

On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow, as well as poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize, and, when she is not farming, Eudia offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle.

To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she also often engages in a small personal business to make extra money. Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Eudia has said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!"

Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Eudia formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful), which produces milk daily that Eudia sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not really affected by sudden changes in the weather, if you have stored feed," said Eudia.

The money Eudia earned from selling her milk was sufficient to repay her last loan. Today she is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage.

With this loan, Eudia is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, with good health and a good livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Caroline. She is a small-hold farmer based in Eldoret, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Caroline and her husband have been blessed with one child.

For ten years, Caroline has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening.

In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful.

Caroline, however, is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her Retail shop, which sells essentials items like sugar, rice, beans and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, salt, maize flour and cooking oil, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business of this kind. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hello lenders, the above picture is of Hellen, a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Eldoret: a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has two lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

Hellen is a tough woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Eldoret area has conditions that favor dairy farming and Hellen has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her.

She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a breed that produces between 10-20 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Eldoret area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Hellen is going to reap more income and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow her to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a bio-gas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: To buy a quality exotic breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Chopsticks Group

texts.en:
Malea is the featured borrower of Chopsticks group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their home in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines.

Malea is a 26-year-old single woman who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved family and improve their living conditions, thus she is acquiring a Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to support her family in the Philippines by opening a mini market.

Malea is pictured in the photo, second from the left. With respect to the other group members, Emelita is the first from the left, Bebeyn is the first from the right, and Rosa is the second from the right of the photo.

loans.use: to support her family in the Philippines by opening a mini market.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Cynthia, from the Eldoret area of Kenya, left her job that paid “peanuts” to become a full-time small-hold farmer. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming.

Cynthia is married and blessed with three lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income.

Deciding to practice poultry farming was not difficult for Cynthia. “I was brought up around chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Cynthia said. “It is in my blood.”

For the past ten years, Cynthia has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry count, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry.

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates a business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is also profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Cynthia is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Cynthia is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María, de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos que viven con ellos.

María, actualmente ayuda a su pareja a trabajar en la agricultura, ademas de trabajar como empleada doméstica en la casa algunos vecinos. -Viaja junto a su esposo 4 kilómetros en bicicleta para poder llegar donde tienen la parcela y regresan a su casa a las 11:00 a.m.

El dinero del préstamo sera utilizado para comprar una novilla que en muy poco tiempo sera vaca.

Los sueños de María, son tener una vivienda  propia, porque actualmente alquilan; tener ganado de repasto y poder ver crecer a sus hijos y que sean personas de bien.- Con el ganado ella espera generar ingresos adicionales y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and studied through 9th grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works as a farmer. They have two children who live with them.

Maria helps her partner work at farming, and also works as a domestic employee in her neighbors' homes. With her spouse, she travels 4 kilometers on a bicycle to get to their piece of land. They finish working on the land at 11 AM. 

The loan money will be used to buy a calf that will grow into a cow in a very short time.

Maria's dreams are to have a home to live in since now they rent one; to have cattle grazing; and to see her children grow up and become good people.  With the cattle she hopes to generate extra income and improve their economic situation.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 42-year-old married man and a father of three children, living with his family in Taiz City, Yemen.

He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his wife works as a housewife.

Abdo's income is very limited and unfixed. His house needs a lot of furniture but he doesn't have enough money to furnish it. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for his home.

Abdo looks forward to making a better future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for his home.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 29-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.

He has been working for a construction business since nine years ago. He is specialized in painting houses and is an expert in his domain. Jihad is a hard worker who puts much effort into developing his business to provide his family a better standard of living.

Jihad is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua, in order to perform necessary maintenance on sewage pipes in his house. He needs to keep it a healthy living place for his beloved family. He hopes to continue to be capable of seeing to his family's needs.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on sewage pipes in his house

loans.name: Salustio Jr.

texts.en:
Salustio Jr is a married man from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 43 years old and has three children. Salustio Jr has been engaged in the photography business with his wife for more than 13 years now. He is standing next to a computer which he uses to edit pictures.

Salustio Jr. is asking to take out a loan to buy materials for photography, like film, and to pay for the repair of his camera. This loan will help him improve his business thereby allowing him to cater to more customers.

In the future, Salustio Jr. hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for photography like film and to pay for the repair of his camera

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 55 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 13 and 24 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 28 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more maize fertilizers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more maize fertilizers to sell

loans.name: Yeny De La Paz

texts.es:
Yeny, de 23 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios morales, los que la han llevado a ser una mujer muy reconocida en su comunidad, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar.- Además, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura, ella estudió hasta noveno grado. Su madre la impulsó para que pusiera un puesto de pupusas en la clínica que está cerca de su casa. 

Los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas  y los otros días de la semana se dedica a la venta de enchiladas, yuca, frescos naturales en un puesto frente al mercado del pueblo, tiene más de 5 años haciendo estas actividades y continuara haciéndolo ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una estufa para hacer pupusas, ya que la que tiene ya se encuentra muy deteriorada y necesita una nueva para que su negocio continúe y contribuir a mejorar su casa y apoyar en la educación de su hija.
 
Las sueños y metas que Yeny tiene para un futuro son: terminar de pagar el préstamo y hacer una nueva solicitud para montar una venta de panes con pollo que funcione de lunes a viernes, esto lo hará con ayudad e su madre.
texts.en:
Yeny, 32, is a person with excellent moral principles who is very well known in her community because of this.  In addition to the housework she does at home, on weekends she sells pupusas (filled tortillas).  She lives with her husband who is a farmer and she has a ninth grade education.  Her mother encouraged her to set up a pupusa stand at a clinic near her home.

On weekends she sells pupusas and the rest of the week she sells enchiladas, yucca, and natural beverages at a stall in front of the market of her village.  She has been in business for over five years and will continue with the work since it is her main source of income to cover basic household needs.

The loan will be used to buy a stove to make pupusas since the one she has is quite dilapidated and needs to be replaced so she can continue her business and contribute toward renovating the house and educating her daughter.

Yeny's dream is to pay off the loan and request another one to set up a bread and chicken business Monday through Friday together with her mother.

loans.use: To buy a stove to make pupusas (filled tortillas).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a small farm in the village of Barsombe in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. This area is a primary milk and maize producing area.

Elizabeth is involved in both milk and maize production to provide for her family of 5 children. She has also invested in poultry farming and other side-businesses to earn additional income.

Elizabeth has improved her 7-acre farm tremendously and employs three permanent staff to help her run the farm. She has a strategy in place that involves leveraging the business to ensure continuous growth of the farm into the future.

She is requesting a loan to promote crop production. She will be able to secure more land space and farm supplies once the loan request is granted. Come next year, when the season is over, she will be able to sell the harvest and make enough money to pay for the farm costs of subsequent seasons. This investment will raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma de 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, solo uno estudia. Ella estudió hasta 5°grado de educación básica, dejo sus estudios porque era la mayor de sus hermanos y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos de la familia.

Vilma se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas con su esposo, siembran granos básicos, también tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en donde vende productos comestibles. Solicita el préstamo  para comprar materiales de construcción, cemento, arena y ladrillo sobre todo para reparar su casa. Quiere dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudio que ella por causas de la vida no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Vilma, 37, is married and has two children, one of whom is a student.  She has a fifth grade education and left school because she was the eldest of her siblings and had to work to help cover family expenses.

Vilma works with her husband on the farm growing basic grains.  She also runs a small business from home selling groceries.  The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials: cement, sand and bricks to repair her house.  She wants her children to have the opportunity to get the education she was unable to have herself.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her late thirties is single with two kids, all of whom are still at school. She has been running a grocery business for fifteen years now. She works from 04am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hadija's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of sodas and drinking water. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay schools and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy empty crates and to increase her stock of drinks. She dreams of having a big business.

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group "Saiberia" which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy empty crates and increased stock of drinks.

loans.name: Begimai

texts.en:
Begimai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is her story:

“Last year I became a finalist in the FLEX Program and had the chance to live and study for one year in the U.S.A. I had a lot of new experiences which changed my view on life. This Program allowed me to explore other nations’ customs, cultures and mentalities. From my point of view, the USA’s multiplicity of nationalities created a new, strong passion in me to explore the varieties of relations of individuals, so that is how I came up with my future major: Sociology.

A sociology degree is a great foundation for many occupations such as social work, teaching, journalism, management and research. Through studying it one can expand his or her skillsets such as report writing, presentations and group work. Also she/he will have the opportunity to volunteer, to reflect on any paid work and to be involved in real research projects. AUCA’s staff and students always work on different projects and do research, which can be interesting and useful for me.

Due to my family’s limited income, they are not able to provide the necessary finances for my education. I greatly appreciate your support in my further education and, with confidence, I want to say that you will not be disappointed with me or with my GPA.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Alphred

texts.en:
Alphred is 42 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 12 years old, and all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 12 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize, which he sells. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his maize, which he sells.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 49 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 9 and 20 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy maize fertilizers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy maize fertilizers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo runs a beauty parlor and offers services like hair cutting, hair rebonding and other related services. He is a single man residing in the town of Dulag, Leyte. Aside from that, he also owns a videoke entertainment business.

Camilo is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy salon supplies like shampoo and treatment for hair rebonding, and additional capital for his videoke business. These supplies will produce a big change and will help him to manage his current livelihood. He will be able to provide better services to his customers, and this will hopefully generate higher income. Then he will be able to provide a healthy diet for the whole family.

In the future, he hopes that with proper management his business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies like shampoo and treatment for hair rebonding, and additional capital for his videoke business

loans.name: Akbaraly

texts.en:
Akbaraly was born in 1993. He lives and studies in Tajikistan. Akbaraly is a student in the 4th course level at Tajikistan National University. Akbaraly learns law and he does well. He dreams to be a successful and high-quality specialist and strives for it.

He must pay for tuition and with this aim he is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 46 years old. He is married with 6 children aged between 9 and 21 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy maize fertilizers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy maize fertilizers to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Su amor y dedicación por la tierra son características que identifican a Doña Domitila a quien le encanta pasar el tiempo entre sus cultivos de flores, jitomates, nopales, chiles y su lumbricaria (cría de lombrices).

Doña Domi, como le dicen de cariño, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada con el señor Juan todos sus hijos ya son independientes.

La producción de abono orgánico es uno de los negocios más fuertes de Domi y ofrece dos tipos: líquido y sólido. El abono es producido por sus lombrices, actividad conocida como lumbricaria, que consiste en alimentar a los pequeños animales únicamente con desperdicios orgánicos como fruta y verdura y así las lombrices transforman ese alimento en residuos. El abono resultante se puede aprovechar en cualquier tipo de cultivo lo que otorga grandes beneficios a los productos ya que es más saludable y no es dañino con el medio ambiente a diferencia de los fertilizantes químicos. 

Doña Domi ha practicado la lumbricaria durante 14 años y la inició con ayuda de un ingeniero agrónomo quien la capacitó, en el curso le prestaron las lombrices y medio año después ella tenía ya sus propios animales. 

Además, Domitila tambipen vendía raíces de flores como el alcatraz amarillo, que ofrecía en los mercados, después conoció a un cliente que le compró todas las raíces que tenía en ese momento y con las ganancias pudo iniciar su primer invernadero donde cultivó más tipos de bulbos. Ahora también utiliza las flores para crear arreglos para eventos especiales. Domi también ha recibido y aprovechado cursos de diseño floral para ganar más clientes: siempre la contratan para los mejores eventos de la comunidad o incluso de otros lugares. 

Doña Domi también se dedica al cultivo de haba, jitomate, nopales, duraznos y por el momento necesita un crédito para comprar rollos de plástico que empleará en la lumbricaria ya que necesita cambiar las protecciones que se encuentran en malas condiciones. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de utilizar el mismo abono que produce, lo que garantiza la calidad de todos sus cultivos “Para poder obtener tantos beneficios de la naturaleza debemos apreciarla, saber amarla” comentó Domi. 

Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund porque ha podido hacer crecer sus negocios y sin ellos sus hijos no hubieran podido terminar una carrera profesional. Aunque ellos ya están realizados Domi continúa el sueño de que todos los productores puedan elaborar su propio abono para que ya no contaminen más la tierra, también le encantaría tener algún día una camioneta bien equipada para poder hacer sus entregas ya que por el momento solo tiene una combi muy pequeña y vieja.

*La fotografía se tomó en al lado de la lumbricaria, justo cuando Domi destapaba el desperdicio para ver cuantas lombrices se han reproducido.
texts.en:
Her love and dedication to the earth are the traits that identify Domitila who loves to spend time growing flowers, tomatoes, prickly pears, chilis and worms.  Domi, as she is lovingly called, is 49 years old, married to Juan and their children are all independent.

Production of organic fertilizer is one of Domi's strongest businesses, and she sells two types: liquid and solid.  The fertilizer is produced by the worms that are fed organic waste such as fruit and vegetables.  The fertilizer can be used on any type of crop since it is healthier and less harmful than chemical products.

Domi has been raising worms for 14 years and she started out with the help of an agronomy engineer who trained her.  She was given the worms during the course and six months later she had raised her own.

Domitila also sells flower roots such as "alcatraz amarillo" (Zantedeschia elliottiana) at the markets.  With the profit she made from sales of all her roots to a customer she was able to set up the greenhouse where she grows other bulbs.  Now she also uses flowers to create arrangements for special events.  Domi has taken courses in floral design to attract more customers and she always has contracts for the best events in the community and other places.

Domi also grows broad beans, tomatoes, prickly pears, pears and is in need of a loan to buy rolls of plastic to cover her worm farm because the current protection is in disrepair.  She is very proud of using the fertilizer she produces which guarantees a quality crop.  "To obtain benefits from nature we must appreciate it and know how to love it.", says Domi.

She is very happy and grateful to VisionFund for helping grow her business.  Without their help her children could not have finished their university studies.  Domi continues with her dream of all producers making their own fertilizer so as not to pollute the earth more.  She also would like to have a well-equipped truck one day to make deliveries because now the one she has is small and old.

*The photograph was taken of her worm farm just as Domi was removing waste to see how many worms had reproduced.

loans.use: To buy two rolls of plastic.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
Ponciano is a fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 46 years old, married and has five children. 

Ponciano has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now, and this is the source of his income.

He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Ponciano hopes to make his fishing business successful.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se formó un grupo que lleva por nombre “Artesanas” los integrantes decidieron nombrarlo así porque tres de ellas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías: María Luisa, Isabel y Alma Rosy a quienes también une un lazo familiar. Doña Sofía, la cuarta integrante es vecina y amiga de las artesanas y se dedica a la cría de cerdos.

Doña Luisa tiene 57 años de edad, está casada con Don Nicasio y tienen 7 hijos aunuqe ya ninguno depende de ellos, ahora Doña Luisa y Nicasio disfrutan del cariño de sus 11 nietos.

En la comunidad donde viven las integrantes solían existir muchos artesanos entre ellos Don Nicasio quien desde su adolescencia aprendió a elaborar joyas de filigrana de plata. Con el tiempo desarrolló su habilidad y cuando decidió formar una familia, la actividad fue fundamental para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus niños. Doña Luisa pronto comenzó a elaborar sus propios aretitos y así comenzó su vida como artesana. Cada vez ayudaba más a su marido creando piezas o caminado por las calles para ofrecer casa por casa las artesanías. Tiempo después los hijos de la pareja también formaron parte del negocio familiar y ya han participado en grandes exposiciones y ferias en todo el país. 

Las Artesanas trabajan muchas veces bajo pedido y es cuando pasan más tiempo en su taller. Ellas están muy agradecidas por todo el apoyo que han recibido de VisionFund ya que principalmente les ha permitido comprar plata en grandes cantidades o más herramientas de trabajo. La familia aún suela con tener una gran tienda artesanal donde exhibir sus creaciones y están seguros de que con la ayuda financiera y su esfuerzo lograrán hacer este sueño realidad. 

*La fotografía se tomó en el taller de las artesanas, Alma Rosy se encuentra en la extrema derecha y viste una capa bordada, a su lado posa Doña Luisa, su madre.
texts.en:
In a community in the State of Mexico a communal bank group by the name "Artesanas" was formed.  The members decided on this name because the three of them are artisans who make crafts.  They are María Luisa, Isabel and Alma Rosy who are also relatives.  The fouth member, Sofía, is a neighbor and friend of the artisans and she raises pigs.

Luisa, 57, is married to Nicasio and they have seven children who are all independent.  Now, Luisa and Nicasio enjoy the love of their 11 grandchildren.

In the community where they live there used to be many artisans like Nicasio who learned to make silver filigree jewelry when he was an adolescent.  Over time he developed his skill and decided to establish a family.  The business was fundamental for covering household expenses and educating his children.  Luisa soon learned to make her own earrings and began her craft career.  She worked more and more helping her husband create jewelry or sold the crafts door-to-door.  Later on their children would also participate in the family business and go to large exhibits and trade fairs throughout the country.

The Artisans work quite a bit on an order basis, spending more time in the workshop.  They are very grateful for the support from VisionFund because it has allowed them to buy silver in large quantities or work tools.  The family still dreams of having a large craft shop to exhibit their creations and they are sure that with the financial help and hard work they will turn their dream into reality.

*The photograph was taken in the workshop.  Alma Rosy is on the far right in an embroidered cape.  Next to her is Luisa, her mother.

loans.use: To buy silver, stones, tweezers, etc.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en: Nazirjon works in a local market which is located in the northern part of Tajikistan. Nazirjon has been busy with buying and selling vegetables such as potatoes and carrots. He buys in bulk from local farmers and sells at retail in a market. He has worked in this way for four years and manages his business alone.  Little by little, Nazirjon has increased his working capital and maximized his profit. He is going to buy more vegetables to maximize his profit. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy vegetables. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Мария, 51 год, разведена, мать 3 детей. Образование-высшее, работает в сельской управе. С 1999 года Мария занимается сельским хозяйством - животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 1 бычок, 13 овец, 8 коз и 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль Марии составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Этого безусловно не хватает на достойную жизнь Марии и ее детей, поэтому она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник доходов. Мария обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 жеребцов. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Mariya is 51 years old, divorced and a mother of 3 children. She has a college education and works at the village council. Mariya has been involved in agriculture - animal husbandry since 1999. Her farm contains 3 cows, 1 bull, 13 sheep, 8 goats and 3 horses. Mariya's monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). This is certainly not enough for a decent life for Mariya and her children, and this is why she decided to develop her agricultural business because this is her only source of income. Mariya requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 3 colts. She will invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business in order to have an ability to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy three colts in order to invest in her business and increase her income

loans.name: Istatoy

texts.en: Istatoy is 29 years old. She is married and has a child. Istatoy is a very hardworking woman. She has always wanted to start her own business and to be successful in this way. One month ago, Istatoy started her own  bakery business. She cooks flatbreads and sells them in a local market. Istatoy’s husband helps her with baking and selling flatbreads. Istatoy learnt baking flatbreads from her mother. She bakes flatbreads in a "tanur" (oven) using coal. Istatoy wants to develop her newly created business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy flour, oil and coal. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil and coal for her new business

loans.name: Nakhue Group

texts.en: Vixai's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  Vixai is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Vixai due to the decrease in purchases of charcoal and bottled water and time spent foraging for wood. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mohammad Hussein

texts.en: Mohammad Hussein is a 20-year-old single man who has worked as a baker for three years to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Mohammad Hussein is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business. Thus, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to paint his bakery to attract customers, and to buy necessary flour and oil to increase his production. Mohammad Hussein hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to paint his bakery and to buy flour and oil

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: Carmen de 32 años de edad es separada y  tiene 03 hijos dependientes. El grupo “El Rosario” está conformado por 06 socias optimistas y visionarias. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas como agua de mesa. Hace más de 01 año que Carmen realiza sus actividades y ha mejorado su negocio por la mayor acogida que tiene por sus clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, agua minerales y frugos. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. El deseo de Carmen es de seguir implementando su negocio con abarrotes. El grupo “El Rosario” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva  por hacer posible este crédito. Carmen se encuentra de pie  es la  primera del lado izquierdo y viste bivirí rojo.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old and separated. She has three children who depend on her. Carmen is a member of the "El Rosario" group, which has six optimistic and visionary members.

Carmen makes a living selling drinks, including water. Carmen has been doing this work for more than a year and has improved her business, and has more customers. For this reason, Carmen is applying for a loan in order to buy water, fizzy drinks and juices. Thanks to her hard work, Carmen will be able to give her children a better education.

Carmen wants to continue starting up a business selling groceries. 

The "El Rosario" group is grateful to the Kiva lenders who are making this loan possible. 

In the photo, Carmen is standing up; she is the first on the left, wearing a stripey top.

loans.use: to buy water, fizzy drinks and juices.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a 64-year-old married man with six children from Mcarthur, Leyte.  Four of his children are still attending school. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish. He also grows tilapia (cichlid) fish as an additional source of income. 

Romeo has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing net and tilapia (cichlid) fingerlings. These materials will be of great help for Romeo to improve his catch. In the coming months, Romeo will be harvesting more tilapia fish. This could create higher earnings. As a result, he could provide his family with nutritious diets. 

In the future, Romeo hopes that he could handle both sources of income successfully to improve his living conditions and also to continue financing the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and tilapia (cichlid) fingerlings

loans.name: Fozila

texts.en: Fozila is widowed and she lives with her 2 children. Her children are non-adults. Fozila is the only provider for her children and she tries to earn money for living. She is going to start a new business of buying and selling children's clothes and in this way find a source of income. Fozila with this aim took part in a course: ‘To Get Ahead’, which was run by a women's organization and received a certificate. She will sell children's clothes in a local market. Fozila is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy children's clothes for her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make the necessary expansions to the house.

loans.name: Nasibaly
