texts.en: Nasibaly was born in 1957. She is married and has 2 children. Nasibaly is an industrious woman and she always endeavours for the well-being of her family. She has her own business. Nasibaly grows vegetables and sells them in a local market. Nasibaly has additional income from animal husbandry. She works hard every day to earn for a living. Nasibaly now needs financial support because she is ill and must buy medicines for her treatment. Nasibaly awaits your mercy and really needs your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Wadad

texts.en: Wadad is a 44-year-old married mother of four children, and she is the wife of one of Al Majmoua clients. Today, Wadad is acquiring this loan to pay her child's university tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance university and school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Wadad hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her child's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to progress further within five years.

loans.use: service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is thirty-eight years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, of which five are currently in school. For the past eight years, Richard has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, rice, beans and maize flour. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items for sale, and will help Richard to generate greater profits and buy some more basic needs for his family. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the shop. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Davlatmahmad

texts.en: Davlatmahmad was born in 1991. He lives and studies in the north part of Tajikistan. Davlatmahmad has applied to the World Economy of the Tajikistan State University Politic and Business after graduating school. He is a student of the 3rd course. Davlatmahmad studies well at the university. He dreams to be a highly qualified specialist after graduating university. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a business of rental houses. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are the general public. She also runs another business of selling milk. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of repair materials for renovation. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy paint for painting her rental houses and buy more milk to sell. Her business goal is to build more houses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy paint for painting her rental houses and buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he makes clothes for selling, especially school uniforms. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a trading centre and his primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of tailoring materials. His business goal is to open a tailoring school within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a larger income. This is his second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a tailoring school.

loans.use: buy more materials for use in his tailoring business

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Sixty-eight year old Rogelio earns a living by fishing. He goes fishing and sells fresh fish to the people in the nearby community. He has been fishing for 20 years already. He is in need of capital right now, to support his current source of income.

Rogelio is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy a pump boat, fishing net and pigs for a hog-raising start-up. In this way, he could now own a new pump boat that serves as the means to transport his catch and also improve his method of fishing. In addition he will also be able to raise and sell pigs. With the new income, he would be able to afford to buy healthy foods for the whole family.

In the future, Rogelio is hoping that these tools will enable him to attain a better status of living and source of sustainable income.

loans.use: to buy a pump boat, fishing net and pigs for a hog-raising start-up.

loans.name: La Ilusion Group

texts.es:
Doña Socorro pertenece al grupo “La Ilusión” para las demás integrantes ella es un gran ejemplo a seguir porque a pesar de ser mayor de edad, aun continúa con su negocio. Ella tiene 74 años de edad y está casada con el señor Emiliano, juntos formaron una familia con 8 hijos, todos ellos ya son independientes.

Desde hace 40 años, Socorro se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de cerditos, platica que inició este negocio porque hace años recibió ayuda de un programa de gobierno y le otorgaron una granja que aún conserva y donde mantiene a los animales. La actividad resultó de gran beneficio porque podía cuidar a los cerditos y estar al tanto de su hijos, además notó que con una buena alimentación y los cuidados adecuados, en cuatro meses (que es el tiempo que se queda con los cerditos) podría recibir las ganancias de los meses de dedicación. A pesar de que actualmente Doña Socorro ya no tiene gastos tan importantes como cuando sus hijos eran pequeños, ella desea continuar con su negocio para apoyar a su marido. 
Por el momento, Socorro necesita comprar más bultos de alimento. 

Igualmente las demás integrantes invertirán en su actividad: Ma Rosa, Juana, Elena, Teresa y Agustina quienes también crían animales, Sara M. invertirá en costuras; Sara G., en su carpintería y Gabriela, en su papelería. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio donde viven las clientes, Doña socorro viste un suéter morado.
texts.en:
Socorro belongs to the group “La Ilusión” (The Illusion). For the other members, she is a great role model, because, despite the fact that she is older, she remains in business. She is 74 years old and is married to Emiliano. Together she and her husband formed a family with 8 children, all of whom are now independent.  

For the last 40 years, Socorro has made a living raising and fattening pigs. She says that she started this business because years ago she received help from a governmental program and they gave her a farm that she still maintains and where she keeps her animals. This business was of great benefit because she could take care of the pigs and, at the same time, be with her children. Also, she noticed that with good nutrition and adequate care, in four months (which is the amount of time she keeps the pigs), she could receive the earnings from the months of dedication. Although she currently does not have expenses as important as when her children were younger, she wants to continue with her business to support her husband. 

Currently, Socorro needs to buy more sacks of food. 

Also, the other members will work in their businesses: Ma Rosa, Juana, Elena, Teresa and Agustina also raise animals; Sara M. sows; Sara G. does woodwork; and Gabriela sells stationery. 

* The photograph was taken in the garden of the town where the women live, Socorro is wearing a purple sweater.

loans.use: buy sacks of pig feed

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Eduar Alonso

texts.es:
Eduar un caballero que desea a toda costa iniciar su negocio de venta de alimentos, la razón que lo impulsa a tomar la decisión de ser independiente es que se cansó de buscar trabajo, ahora con la ayuda de unas recetas busca en las preparaciones de arroz y harina su medio de sustento y colaborar con su hijo que ya tiene 18 años de edad.
Por esta razón Eduar con ayuda de la alianza Kiva-Interactuar busca un apoyo para comprar Maíz, Arroz, Cuyos, empaques.
Su principal dificultad es el medio para iniciar el negocio pero ya tomo al decisión y tiene el apoyo de su familia, en 5 años espera tener un negocio consolidado y  próspero.
texts.en:
Eduar is a gentleman who wants to start his own food selling business at any cost. The reason that has driven him to make the decision to go off on his own is that he got tired of looking for a job. Now with the help of some recipes he seeks his means of support in the preparation of rice and flour. He will work with his son, who is 18 years old. 

That is why Eduar, with the help of the Kiva-Interactuar alliance, is seeking help to buy corn, rice, guinea pigs and packaging. His main difficulty is the means to start the business, but he already made the decision and he has the support of his family. In 5 years, he hopes to have a consolidated and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, guinea pigs and packaging for his food selling business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos: Es de Bilwi, es un hombre trabajador, amable, casado, tiene siete hijos de los cuales 4 todavía están estudiando en secundaria. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda que es de  madera y tambo. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.

En la fotografia se presenta al Sr. Carlos con su hija y esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos is from Bilwi. He is a hardworking, friendly, married man. He has seven children, four of whom are still in high school. In order to improve his living conditions and have a house that is more worthy and safe for his family, he is asking for a loan to make some improvements on his home, which is made from wood and on stilts. With the loan, he wants to buy construction materials such as wood, zinc sheeting, and nails, as well as to cover the cost of labor. His dream is to have a house made of concrete (cement) because it is more durable. 

The photograph shows Carlos with his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to make improvements on his home, which is made of wood and stilts.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” y está formado por 06 integrantes responsables y emprendedores. Dana de 27 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Dana se dedica a la venta de producto de belleza y cosmético. Hace más de 01 año que distribuye sus productos a pedidos, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su única hija. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de perfumes, colonias, talcos y desodorantes. El deseo de Dana contar con una tienda bazar para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios. Dana es la segunda del lado izquierdo y lleva en brazo a su hija.
texts.en:
This is the “Prosperidad y Amistad” (Prosperity and Friendship) Group. The group is made up of six responsible and entrepreneurial members. Dana is 27 years old and is separated with one dependent child. Dana makes a living selling beauty products and cosmetics. For more than one year, she has been delivering her products upon request. Thanks to her constant dedication, she can give a better quality of life to her only daughter. She is asking for the loan in order to purchase perfumes, colognes, talcum powder, and deodorant. Dana's wish is to have a Bazaar-like store in order to offer better service to her customers. 

The “Prosperidad y Amistad” ("Prosperity and Friendship") Group are grateful to the Kiva investors for giving them the opportunity to grow their businesses. 

Dana is the second from the left and is holding her daughter.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, talcum powder, and deodorant.

loans.name: Maria De La Flor Doris

texts.es:
Maria de la Flor Doris tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, con un hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Maria de la Flor Doris se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, chivos, conejos, entre otros), desde hace 08 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea comprar cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas, para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de la Flor Doris is 41 years old. She is a single mom with dependent children and lives in a family home in a rural area of the Oyotún district, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Perú. Her community is dedicated primarily to agriculture, livestock, and trade. 

Maria de la Flor Doris has made a living raising and selling farm animals (ducks, goats, rabbits, etc.) for the last 8 years. Her business is located in her home. She is asking for this loan for working capital, because she wants to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens in order to increase and diversify her stock of animals. This loan would help her have more of an investment with the aim of growing her business and satisfying her customers' needs. This would allow her, in the short run, to increase her income, increase profits, and, thus, improve her quality of life, along with the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy working capital, as she wishes to purchase pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens to increase and diversify her stock of animals

loans.name: Denys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Denys una comerciante de artículos y accesorios para dama y caballero que inicio su negocio en el año 2008, ayudada e impulsada por su esposo quien le recomendó ser independiente para tener su propio capital.
Es Madre de 4 hijos todos por la línea de los 20 años de edad, viven y depende de ella y de su esposo, su principal ventaja es que el negocio es el único en el sector y por ello tienen el objetivo de complacer a un público y traer mercancía variada para crear fidelidad ante la posible incursión de negocios que oferten servicios similares.
Buscando diversificar su oferta, tener productos nuevos busca una ayuda crediticia para invertirla en ropa, calzado, accesorios y cosméticos.
Su principal sueño es mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, vivir dignamente y que nunca les llegue a faltar un bocado de comida.
texts.en:
This is Denys, a seller of items and accessories for men and women. She started her business in 2008. She was helped and encouraged by her husband who recommended that she become independent to have her own capital.  

She is the mother of 4 children around 20 years old. They live and depend on her and her husband. Her main advantage is that the business is the only one in the area. That is why they have the goal of pleasing the public and bringing various merchandise to create loyalty against the possible entry of businesses that offer similar services. 

Seeking to diversify what she offers and have new products, she is looking for help with a loan to invest in clothing, shoes, accessories and cosmetics. Her main dream is to improve her family's living conditions, to live in a dignified way and for them to never lack even a bite of food.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothes, shoes, accessories and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es: Lesbia: Es una mujer cordial, tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo y ella son maestros de escuela primaria. Desde  hace 9 años habitan en una casa construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para cambiar madera rústica, madera cepilada, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Lesbia is a cordial woman. She is 37 years old, married and has a young 4 year old child. She and her husband are elementary school teachers. For 9 years, they have lived in a house made of wood and stilts. Right now, it needs repair. That is why they are asking for a loan to change the rough wood, planed wood, wooden posts, and nails, as well as to cover the labor costs. She and her husband dream os having a concrete house with better conditions for their children and above all more security.

loans.use: to change rough wood, planed wood, wooden posts, and nails, as well as to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo un respetado, honrado y trabajador hombre dedicado a la venta de madera, negocio que inicio por necesidad económica y pro faltas de oportunidades de empleo.
Es un hombre que por cuestiones de naturaleza quedo viudo a cargo de un hijo y es ese hijo quien le da los ánimos, la fuerza y el apoyo para superarse cada día y buscar un mejor mañana.
Jairo buscando mejorar su negocio solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de madera, y no solo eso comenzara a oferta servicios de jardinero por lo que quiere invertir parte del crédito en una guadañadora y utilizar sus tiempos muertos para dicho servicio.
La razón de sobrecargarse de trabajo es que quiere comprar una casa para dejarle a su hijo de herencia pues como la vida se llevó a su esposa en cualquier momento puede ser él.
texts.en:
Jairo is a respected, honest and hardworking man who sells wood. He started this activity because he needed money and there were few job opportunities. His wife died from natural causes and left him a son, who gives him the energy, strength and support he needs to get ahead and pursue a better future.

Jairo wants to improve his business. He is requesting a loan to buy wood. He will also start offering gardening services, so he wants to use the loan to buy a brush cutter to work during his idle hours.

This will mean more work for him, but he wants to buy a house for his son in case he dies. Life took his wife, but it could also happen to him anytime.

loans.use: to buy wood and a brush cutter.

loans.name: Mah  Jabeen

texts.en:
Thirty-six year old Mah Jabeen is married and the mother of three children. The family's only source of earning is from the rickshaw that her husband (shown in the picture) drives. 

Currently, Mah Jabeen has availed herself of a Murabaha loan (see below) for 30,000 Pakistani rupee for her husband. This has allowed him to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. 

He is positive that, by providing better facilities to his customers, he will be able to make better earnings for his family.

loans.use: to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Mateito (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mateito se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo de Crédito que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Gabriela, tiene 26 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 1 hija de 7 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador. 
Doña Gabriela para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de su pequeña se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de  todo tipo y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, sale todos los  días unas tres horas al día aprovechando las horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora su hija está en la escuela y se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y sobretodo ropa de niños. Lleva tres años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Mateito group meets every two weeks in Junín canton. This place is known for its friendly and hard-working people and because it is a place that makes the best aguardiente in the province and in Ecuador. 

This is a group of people who decided to get together and form this communal bank that has served them a lot to improve their small businesses. They work in a variety of jobs such as sales, services, and food sales among other activities. 

One of the members of this group is Gabriela. She is 26 years old and is in a common-law marriage in which she has one 7-year-old daughter who is in school. Her husband is a master welder.

Gabriela, to get her own income and with this help her husband with the household expenses and with her little one's schooling, works in sales. She sells clothing of all sorts and her manner of sales is door-to-door. She goes out every day for about three hours daily, taking advantage of the morning hours since at this time her daughter is in school and it is easier to make her rounds. She leaves the items on credit and collects every week. She started this business with her first loan that she got from the group, for which she is very grateful. 

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and above all children's clothing. She has been in the group for three years and she likes it because, with the loans, she began her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her little one.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ana Isabe

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña Ana hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible para ganarse lo suyo, ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo pero de preferencia ropa de mujer, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios, además también vende ropa de todo tipo la cual lo realiza puerta a puerta aunque le mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su  taller. Trabaja todos los días, ella entrega a crédito y cobra por semanas. Lleva más de 14 años dedicada a estas actividades y le va bastante bien.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo,  telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo communal bank group meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural richness and for its great crafts such as, for example, the straw hats known within and outside of the country. 

This is the place where Ana lives. She is 48 years old, married, and from this relationship has two adult children, one of them lives with her. Her husband is a driver.

A number of years ago, Ana learned to be a seamstress at a local school. She is a very hard-working woman who does everything possible to earn her way. She has a small sewing shop in her house where she works sewing all types of clothing, but her preference is women's clothing. She works based on orders from individual people who need her services. In addition, she sells all sorts of clothing, which she does door-to-door, although the larger part of her sales are done in her shop. She works every day, she delivers the items on credit and collects weekly. She has worked for more than 14 years in these jobs and it is going fairly well. 

This new loan will be used to purchase all sorts of clothing, fabric, thread, and other materials for sewing. She has been a member of the group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans are very necessary. Her dreams are to continue onward in her daily life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, fabric, thread and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en el Caserío de Nueva Alianza una zona de clima caluroso, que cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz y agua, su población se dedica a la agricultura de café y frutales, así como a la crianza de animales, ubicada en el Distrito de Pimpigos que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Antonio se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años cultiva principalmente cafeto de la variedad catimor, junto a su cónyuge se esfuerzan por mejorar su calidad de vida, es por eso que ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, patos y gallinas que los comercializa en su Distrito y contribuye con los gastos familiares. Antonio ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café que le permitirá tener una mejor producción para ofrecer un mejor precio en el mercado y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old and lives with his spouse in their own house made of rustic materials in the village of Nueva Alianza, an area with a warm climate, which has all the basic services of electricity and water. Its population works growing coffee and fruit treas, and also raising animals; it is located in the district of Pimpigos which is part of Cutervo province, part of Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Antonio has worked in agriculture for the past 5 years, primarily growing Catimor variety coffee. Along with his wife, they work hard to improve their quality of life, and for this she works raising small animals such as guinea pigs, ducks and hens, which she sells in her district and contributes to the family expenses.  Antonio has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer to take care of his coffee crop, which will permit him to have a better production to offer a better price in the market, and in this way have more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nohemí Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Nohemí, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad, ambos viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nohemí con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos por catálogos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace mas de 20 años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el grupo. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural richness and for its great crafts such as, for example, the straw hats known within and outside of the country.

In this place lives Nohemí. She is 43 years old, married and from this relationship has two children, ages 21 and 19; both live in her house. Her husband is a driver.

Nohemí, with the end of having her own income, works selling all sorts of clothing and products from Yanbal catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works three days a week, mostly in the morning, since these hours are easier for her to make her rounds. She sells door-to-door and by order, she leaves the items on credit and collects weekly. She loves to sell and she has been doing this for over 20 years, in which it has gone very well for her since she has many customers. What she sells most are cosmetics and perfumes. 

She will use this loan to purchase all sorts of clothing, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams. She has been a member from the beginning of this communal bank group and she likes it for the help it offers the group. Her dreams are to continuing improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.

loans.name: Ángela Trinidad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Ángela realiza el crédito para ella y para marido, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y hace poco con las ganancias que tuvo de la venta de sus pollos empezó con la venta de sabanas lo cual lo realiza puerta a puerta, las mismas que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas. Una parte del crédito utiliza su marido para arreglos del carro con el cual transporta al personal de ciertas empresas en Manta.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, alimento para los pollos y refacciones del carro. Lleva 16 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han dado con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un carro nuevo.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural richness and for its great crafts such as, for example, the straw hats known within and outside of the country.

In this place lives Ángela. She is 46 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children, one adult and two, ages 16 and 14, who are secondary school students. All the children still live in her house. Her husband is a driver.

Ángela is taking out the loan for herself and for her husband. She works raising chickens and a little while ago, with the earnings she had from the sale of the chickens, she began to sell sheets, which she does door-to-door. She leaves them on credit and collects weekly. One part of the loan will be used by her husband to do some repairs on the car with which he transports people from certain businesses in Manta.

This loan is to purchase sheets, chicken feed, and pay for car repairs. She has been in the communal bank group for 16 years and she likes it for the help that the loans have always been. Her dreams are to have a new car.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, chicken food, and car repairs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married, and has one child who is currently in school. For the past seven years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essentials items like sugar, rice, beans, and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items to sell, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and take care if her family's basic needs. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes tiene 24 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene una hijo de 5 años  que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro en construcción.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta ganar sus propios ingresos para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas por catalogo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres veces por semana unas tres horas por día y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva, la mayor parte de su mercadería siempre es para entregar ya que los clientes cuando sabe que va a viajar le encargan a su gusto. Tiene más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo. 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, camisetas, blusas, pantalones, entre otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Los Andes meets every two weeks in a sector known as El Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, a place of friendly, hard-working people dedicated to their families. 

In this place lives Mercedes. She is 24 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has a 5-year-old son who goes to school. Her husband is a master builder in construction. 

Mercedes is a woman who likes to earn her own income to help her husband with the household expenses. She works in sales, she sells all sorts of clothing and sandals by catalog and her sales method is door-to-door. She goes out three times per week, about 3 hours each day, and also sells from her house where her customers come when she has new merchandise. The large part of her merchandise is always by advance order since when her customers know she is going to travel, they put in their orders. She has been working in this job for more than 2 years, with which she helps her husband since he doesn't earn much from his work. 

This loan is to purchase sandals, shirts, blouses, and pants among other clothing that she sells. She has been in the communal bank group for three loan cycles and she likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, shirts, blouses, pants and other clothing.

loans.name: Mildred Yajaira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Mildred, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 7 y 1 año  de edad,  el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Mildred con la intención de ganar algo y con esto poder salir adelante y para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante junto a su querida familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar camisas, pantalones, blusas entre otras prendas. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Los Andes meets every two weeks in a sector known as El Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, a place of friendly, hard-working people dedicated to their families. 

In this place lives Mildred. She is 32 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 7 and 1. The older one goes to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Mildred, with the intention to earn something and with this be able to get ahead and to help her husband with the household expenses, works selling all sorts of clothing. Her method of sales is door-to-door. She goes out two or three times per week, and also sells in her house where her most known customers come. She leaves the items on credit and collects every two weeks. She has been doing this work for more than 5 years, with which she gets ahead along with her beloved family.

This loan will be used to purchase shirts, pants, and blouses among other clothing. She is a founding member of the communal bank group and she likes it for the help that the loans offer her. Her dream is to have a nice retail location.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothing.

loans.name: Jenny Amarilis

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 17, 14, 10 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian en colegio y uno en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jenny es una mujer que le de alguna u otra forma le ayuda a su marido a salir adelante, ellos se dedican a la fabricación y venta de tortillas de maíz o de yuca, ella prepara las tortillas en su casa y su marido se encarga de vender por la ciudad y en los buses de transporte, el se sube  a los buses que se desplazan a otras ciudades ya que es ahí donde mejores ventas tiene,  llevan más de 15 años con este negocio con el cual salen adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar maíz, yuca, queso y otros ingredientes necesarios para elaborar sus tortillas. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y fáciles de pagar. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Los Andes meets every two weeks in a sector known as El Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, a place of friendly, hard-working people dedicated to their families. 

In this place lives Jenny. She is 38 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has 4 children, ages 21, 17, 14 and 10, three of them are in secondary school and one is in primary school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Jenny is a woman who in one way or another helps her husband get ahead. They work making and selling corn or yucca tortillas. She makes the tortillas in her house and her husband is responsible for selling them in the city and on the buses. He boards the buses that go to other cities since it is there where he has the best sales. They have had this business for more than 15 years, with which they get ahead. 

This new loan will be used to purchase corn, yucca, cheese, and other ingredients necessary to make their tortillas. It is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank group and she likes it because the loans are fast and easy to pay. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn, yucca, cheese and other ingredients.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be courageous.

She operates a carpentry business, where she makes furniture. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a trading center and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be availability of carpentry materials.

She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more stock of timber for making furniture. Her business goal is to open another outlet within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Ma. Gialina

texts.en:
Ma. Gialina is a 47-year-old, married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She has five grown-up children.

Ma. Gialina has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, floaters, and hooks. With a loan, Ma. Gialina and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Ma. Gialina hopes to improve her fishing business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, floaters, and hooks

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. He operates a transport business where he transports customers. He has been involved in this business for six years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

George will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. 

He hopes that in the future he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Sara Aida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Sara, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de 12 años que  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es maestro en construcción. 
Doña Sara es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene contratos de construcción, el construye casas, cerramientos y muchas otras obras, trabaja a base de pedidos de clientes particulares que saben del buen trabajo que realiza su marido y le piden que les realice sus obras, ella por su parte también se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos ya sea por libras o enteros, ella compra en una granja, luego los pela y los vende a vecinos del lugar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar una carretilla, palas, materiales de construcción y pollos para la venta. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sentirse útil y ayudar a su marido a salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a su hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Los Andes meets every two weeks in a sector known as El Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, a place of friendly, hard-working people dedicated to their families. 

In this place lives Sara, she is 32 years old, married and in this relationship has one 12-year-old son who goes to secondary school. Her husband is a master builder.

Sara is a very good wife who, in order to help her husband, takes out the loan for him to use in his work. He has construction contracts, he builds houses, enclosures, and many other projects. He works based on customer orders who know the good work that her husband does and they ask him to do the projects. She, for her part, also works in buying and selling chickens, whether per pound or whole. She purchases them at a farm, then she plucks them and sells them to her neighbors.

This loan will be used to purchase a wheelbarrow, shovels, construction materials, and chickens to sell. She has been in the communal bank group for 5 loan cycles and she likes it because with the loans she can feel useful and help her husband get ahead. Her dream is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, shovels, construction materials, and chickens.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a Kiva borrower. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a tailoring shop, where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in demand.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his M-pesa float.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells mobile phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a trading centre, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

Ruth will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of mobile phone accessories. 

Her business goal is to open other business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future she will prosper. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 15 years to 21 years. He describes himself to be honest and determined. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, sugar, flour, and other household items. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales sometimes. 

Edward will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, milk, and other items. His business goal is to be operating a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand business and have better living standards. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business like a hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, milk, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bar soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, flour, and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, milk, and other items. Her business goal is to own a big, wholesale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice, milk, and other items

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz is a 32-year-old, separated woman and the mother of two children. In order to support her family she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income she generates. For the growth of her business, she has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three kids; two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Sami would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to reduce the electricity expenses and also provide hot water for his kids.

Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 56-year-old married man from Mcarthur, Leyte. He is the father of eleven children. Six of his children are still attending school. He is a fisherman. He goes fishing and sells tilapia (cichlid) fish to the nearby community.

Rogelio has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets and feeds for tilapia. In this manner, he can now acquire new fishing nets that are useful in his day-to-day fishing activities.

He can now catch more tilapia fish and eventually this will improve his earnings.

He can now settle his obligations and other household expenses, thus continuing to finance the schooling of his children.

In the future, Rogelio hopes that he can expand his fishing business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets and feeds for tilapia.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be persistent. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

James will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy new tires, spares for his motorcycle. 

His business goal is to have a large transport business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful in business. He will invest the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy new tires, spares for his motorcycle

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enhanced her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide the educational expense of her children, and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 42,000 PHP. This new loan will go to an additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Rowena also operates a computer shop business and she wishes to add more units to increase her profit. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Christopher will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. 

His business goal is to expand his transport business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will create employment. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sunil

texts.en: Sunil thanks all his Kiva lemders for supporting him to continue rice production. He has paid his loan fully and is requesting another loan of 3,000 SRD so that he can buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: María Geoconda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad, la menor vive con ella y estudia en colegio.
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para sentirse útil y así lograr sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia hace 1 año instalo un negocio de venta de recargas y tarjetas  telefónicas de todas las operadoras,  ella también vende estas recargas afuera de un hospital de la ciudad en la cual todos los días instala una mesa, ella con este crédito quiere comprar productos naturales para dedicarse también a vender estos productos los mismos que tienen mucha salida  
Este crédito es para comprar recargas, tarjetas telefónicas y productos naturales que espera vender. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora aun más su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Los Andes Communal Bank meets every two weeks in an area of the city of Portoviejo known as El Guabito.  It's a community of friendly, hardworking people who are devoted to their families.

María, 39, lives here.  She's the single mother of two children, 21 and 17; the younger one lives with her and attends school.  María's a very persevering woman who likes to work to feel useful and so she can earn her own income on behalf of her family.  A year ago she set up a business selling recharge cards and telephone cards for all the companies.  She also sells these recharge cards outside a hospital in the city, where she sets up a table every day.

With this loan she wants to buy natural products to devote herself to selling those products, too, because they sell well.  This loan is to buy recharge cards, telephone cards, and natural products that she's planning to sell.

María has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because she improves her business even more with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards, telephone cards, and natural products

loans.name: Sonia Yadira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Los Andes se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 años que son mellizos, uno de ellos  estudia en universidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Sonia con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su marido en los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatillas por catálogos de varias marcas, trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más 2 años en su negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatos y zapatillas de varios modelaos que ya tiene pedidos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias al los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Los Andes" communal bank meets every fortnight in the area known as El Guabito of the city of Portoviejo, a place of friendly people, who are hard-working and dedicated to their families.

Sonia lives here. She is 43 years old, married and from this relationship has two 19 year old twins, one of whom is studying in university. Her husband is a driver.

Sonia with the goal of having her own income and with it help her husband with the household expenses works selling shoes of a number of brands by catalog. She works 3 hours each week mainly in the morning hours as at this time it is easier to make her rounds. Her form of selling is going door-to-door or at her house when clients come. She sells on credit, collecting every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 2 years.

She will use this loan to buy shoes and slippers of a variety of models that she has orders for. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it as thanks to the loans she could start her business. Her dream is for her sons to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Najima

texts.en:
Najima, age 39, is a married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been involved in a business of manufacturing shoes for years. He is an energetic person, and makes enough to provide the basic necessities for his three children. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Najima has availed a Murabaha of 10,000 PKR for her husband to buy additional material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. 

In this way he can handle the growing demand for his shoes in the market.

loans.use: to buy additional material to make shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a divorced lady who lives with her father and has worked in selling clothes for the past seven years to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Houda is the sole earner of her family. She is sacrificing a lot to provide them with better living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to cover the expenses of her father's surgery. This loan is very important for Houda for it will cure her father's pain.

Houda wishes her father will get well soon, as she hopes to open her own clothes shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of her father's surgery

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 19 years old and single. He is an Iraqi citizen, who graduated a year ago and is employed as an accountant in a fruits and vegetables wholesale market. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, responsible for three other members. 

Ahmad is working hard but with his income cannot afford his planned engagement ceremony's expenses. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to pay for his engagement expenses and make his dream of having his own family come true. He is working hard to save some capital to start his own trading business.

loans.use: to pay for his engagement expenses

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Amina has a business selling cereals at the market. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of cow peas, beans and rice. She generates additional income from selling piped water. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability of her products.

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of dry beans, peas and rice.

loans.name: Maria Melida

texts.es: María Mélida: Es una mujer alegre, que tiene un pequeño negocio de ropa y calzado en el mercado municipal de la Ciudad de  Bilwi; tiene 46 años de edad, casada, tiene seis hijos: 2 mayores de edad y 4 en edad escolar. Su esposo es maestro. Ella tiene 9 años de experiencia como comerciante de venta de ropa nueva y calzado. Trabajó con pequeños créditos como integrante del Grupo Solidario Estrella, pero ahora se ha independizado y está solicitando un préstamo en la modalidad individual para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; esto le permitirá vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Bilwi y también incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
María Mélida is a cheerful woman who has a small business selling clothing and footwear in the municipal market of the city of Bilwi. She is 46 years old, married and has six children, 2 of them adults and four school-aged. Her husband is a teacher.

She has 9 years of experience as a businessperson selling new clothing and footwear. She has been getting small loans as a member of the Estrella communal bank but now she has gone on her own and is requesting an individual loan. She wants to increase her merchandise of clothing and footwear that she will buy in Managua and Masaya. This will allow her to sell at reasonable prices to her clients in Bilwi and to increase her income. Her dream is to have a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Isabelina

texts.en:
Isabelina is has a rolling store wherein she offers vegetables and other kinds of ingredients. She has been in this kind of business for three years.

Isabelina is a widow and has five children. With her situation as a single parent, she still aims for the continuous smooth flow of her business.To keep her business profitable, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy a variety of vegetables such as egg plant, cabbage and tomatoes to sell.

She hopes that with this loan amount she could increase her sales and sustain basic commodities.

loans.use: to buy a variety vegetables such as egg plant, cabbage and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes and bags

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has three children. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business selling clothes. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which affects business. 

Francis requested his first loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 46 years old, married, and has three children who attend college. She is a resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. She and her husband manage a fruit and vegetable stand to provide for their family's daily needs and for the education of their children. 

Cristy buys fresh fruits and vegetables from a local farm and sells them at retail. She sells pomelo, squash, citrus fruits, bananas, and other Filipino fruit staples. She also cooks banana cue, a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day. 

Cristy is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more varieties of fruits and vegetable to sell. She expects an increased demand of fruits and vegetables in preparation for Christmas. Cristy hopes to see her three children earn college degrees, which will give them better opportunities in life. She wants a happy and peaceful life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables such as pomelo, squash, citrus fruits, bananas, and other green leafy vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as capable. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics and also operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more beauty products to use in her salon and to sell. Her business goal is to prosper within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to use in her salon and to sell.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Shakila, 33, is the married mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shakila’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shakila has asked for a loan of 30000 PKR for her husband. It helped him purchase new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle so that he can provide better transport services to his passengers. Shakila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with automobile spare parts

loans.name: Soraya Gisella

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Por Un Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Soraya, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, 4 mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años que estudian en colegio y son los que aun viven con ella. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Soraya  es un ama de casa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el compra carros viejos los mismos que los arregla, los pinta y los vende. Con esto ella se gana sus ingresos que le sirven para el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y pintura que su marido necesita para arreglar un carro. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus metas son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the "Trabajando Por Un Futuro" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place known for it's delicious sweets that the locals make and are renown throughout the country. It is also known for the warmth of it's hard-working friendly people.

Soraya lives in this place. She is 43 years old, married and from this relationship has 6 children. Four of them are adults and two of them aged 15 and 17 study in school and still live with her. Her husband is a mechanic.

Soraya is a housewife who in order to help her husband with the household expenses works in commerce. She has a food store in her house where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent besides water, soft drinks, juices amongst other things. Doing this she makes her income which serves to help her family. She also gives part of her loan to her husband to use in his work. He buys old cars and fixes them himself, paints them and sells them.

She will use the loan to stock her store. She will buy foods and paint that her husband needs to fix up a car. She has been a member of the communal bank since it's beginning and she likes it as the loans give her much support. Her goals are to continue onwards.

loans.use: to buy food and paint.

loans.name: Laxmi Narayan Shg Group

texts.en:
Laxmi Narayan Shg is the name that these group members gave to their group, formed in a neighborhood located in a paddy region, where in the time of the harvest, it is possible to see the harvesting process and irrigation. 

The members of the group chose the name in honor of one of their favorite God names. All the members of this group are engaged in different activities such as milk selling, paddy cultivation, goat rearing, etc.

Jagyansini is 21 years old and married with one child. She says that four years ago, she opened a small grocery shop by setting up a room in her house, and she would sell through a large window. She makes 3,000 INR per month from this business, and now she wants to expand her business by adding more products in her grocery shop.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum, as she wants to renovate her grocery and add more products to the grocery store and have an income without neglecting her family. With the loan, she will buy flour, rice, sugar, oil, milk products, eggs, cookies, spices, onions, and sodas to fulfill the needs of her customers. 

“Thank you for a new opportunity. We will make the most of it, and we will grow together with our occupation,” Jagyansini said.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, oil, milk products, eggs, cookies, spices, onions, and sodas to fulfill the needs of her customers

loans.name: Sabitri Shg Group

texts.en:
The group is called Sabitri Shg, which means “relating to the sun” in English. They sell various products and they wish to expand their businesses and improve their future. 

Usha is the group leader, age 44. She is a divorced woman and has two children, age 19 and 24 years old, and both go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running it for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children. She is very grateful for this great support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
The members belong to the self help group, “Maa Saraswati Shg.” This group is located in the Boudh district, which is a rural area of the Odisha state in India.

Jharana is a member who is married, 30 years old, and has four children. She works as a daily laborer. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. She has been working as daily laborer for others for eight years, and now she is planning to open a fruit stall at a nearby market. Her dream is to have a big fruit-vending business. She is requesting the loan to buy fruits in bulk, as well as a bucket and a stall for her business. 

The other members make a living in businesses such as selling milk, carpentry, grocery stores, and a restaurant business. All are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk, as well as a bucket and a stall to start a fruit stall.

loans.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Por Un Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Paula,  tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 21 y 12 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio y es la que aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una planta de agua.
Doña Paula es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que trabaja para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella vende productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, su hija le ayuda con sus ventas. También  en su casa tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría de pollos, ella compra estos animalitos pequeños y los mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego venderlos a vecinos del lugar,  así realiza estas dos actividades que les sirven para ganar sus propios ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas  para los pollos y productos Avon. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una profesional
texts.en:
The members of the Trabajando Por Un Futuro communal bank meet every 15 days in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by its inhabitants.  The sweets are well-known in the whole country.  The place is also known form the warmth of its kind, hard-working people.

This is where Paula, age 43, lives.  She is in a common-law relationship, and they have three children, ages 23, 21, and 12.  The youngest goes to school and still lives with her.  Her husband works at a water plant.

Paula is a great housewife and a good wife who works in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works every day, and she sells by going door to door.  Her daughter helps with her sales.

Also, she has a small farm at her house, and she raises chickens there.  She buys these small animals, and she looks after them for three months.  This is an adequate amount of time for good growth.  She then sells them to neighbors in her area.  This way she engages in two business activities that serve for her to earn her own income.

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for the chickens and to buy Avon products.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginning.  She likes it because the loans are a big help.

Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the chickens and to buy Avon products.

loans.name: Maa Annapurna Shg Group

texts.en:
Sulochana is 28 years old and has only a fifth-grade education. Over the course of her life, she has worked in different activities, earning enough to pay for household expenses. This will be the first loan for Sulochana and her group with Peoples Forum.

For the last eight years, she has woken up early to buy fish from fishermen with the help of her husband. At 6 a.m., Sulochana leaves her house carrying a bucket of fishes on her head and goes up and down the streets in the area to serve the needs of hers clients. In the afternoons, she buys household items for her own use to prepare the next day's food for her family. "Many clients have told me to open a stall, but I like to go up and down the streets and give fishes on the spot," says Sulochana.

Sulochana needs to buy more fish to resell, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy fish in bulk and a big bucket for carrying fish. Sulochana is grateful for the support that has helped her reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk and a big bucket for carrying fish

loans.name: Janeth Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Por Un Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Janeth es una mujer que le gusta ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos y   zapatillas de catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  sale dos o tres días por semana dependiendo de sus clientes, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y zapatillas ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Trabajando por un Futuro Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton, known throughout the country for its delicious locally made sweets and for the warmth of the friendly and hardworking people there.

Janeth, 26, lives there.  She's married and has two children, ages 7 and 5, who attend school.  Her husband's a mechanic.

Janeth likes to earn her own income so she can help her husband with the household expenses.  She earns a living in commerce, making catalogue sales of shoes and sneakers.  She sells door-to-door two or three days a week, depending on her customers.  She also sells to her best customers at her home.  She leaves products on credit and collects weekly.  She has been in this business for two years, having started with a loan from the bank.
