This loan is to buy shoes and sneakers because she has several orders to fill.

She has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because she started her business with the loans.  Her dream is to keep making progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Laxmi Narayan Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
This 13-member group belongs to the Laxmi Narayan Shg, which was created on 19th September, 2014. The women of this group get along very well. Their main business activities are agriculture, trading and raising livestock.

Bhagyabati, the woman standing fourth from left hand side in first row, is 27 years old. She is a married mother of two children, one son and one daughter. She earns a living through selling children's clothing, which she has been doing for the past seven years. She gets her supplies from the town market and then sells them at the daily markets. In total, she spends 10,000 INR on children's clothing. The prices of these clothes vary between 50 INR to 300 INR. She then resells these clothes with 20 percent to 40 percent profit.

With the profits from this loan, she is planning on buying a baby goat, which she will raise herself and then resell. She will also use the profits to see to her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maa Tulashi Devi Shg Group

texts.en:
This self-help group is named “Maa Tulashi Devi SHG” (a goddess name). It includes 10 active, independent, and enterprising women. They have been able to maintain a strong and unified group. The members are from a small village of Boudh district, an area that is in a period of growth despite being very far from the capital part of Odisha. 

Mahalati stands out in this group for her entrepreneurship and her drive to succeed. She works as a seller of new and semi-new clothing. Mahalati makes sales in the surrounding village near her house. Her work requires her to make many sacrifices on behalf of her family. 

Mahalati is requesting this loan in order to buy various types of clothes so that she can continue with her sales just as before. As a result, she can keep improving her earnings.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes so that she can continue with her sales

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 54-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband; he has been running a nursery business (flower and plant sale outlet) for the last nine years. 

For the growth of her husband’s business, Nasreen has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR. It allowed him to purchase more seeds of different flowers, plants and pots. 

He wishes to use part of the revenues on the expansion of his business and wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds of different flowers, plants and pots.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a married man. He has two children aged 1 year and 7 years. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking gas. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of gas. His business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business across the country. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of gas

loans.name: Harishankar Group

texts.en:
Risigaon is a rural village of the Nuapada district of Odisha state in India. It is around 80 kilometers away from the district headquarters, Nuapada. This village is divided into two hamlets. Darlipada is one of them. All inhabitants of Darlipada belong to the weaver community. Their main source of income is weaving of saris and selling, either in the market or to the traders. 

Weavers always need money for purchasing of yarn so that their weaving will continue. Sometimes, due to lack of finance, they have to stop their work for some days and they incur losses due to this. Women play a vital role in processing of yarn and weaving of saris. 

In the year 2014, to carry on their weaving, ten women entrepreneurs from this hamlet stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their financial contributions. They formed a self-help group named Harishankar to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. 

Dalimba is one of the group members and she is standing with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband, three daughters of 22, 20 and 18 years and one son of 26 years, who helps in her business.
 
Dalimba is running a hand-loom unit in her house for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader 20 km away from their village. She gets 80 to 100 pieces of sari from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000 to 15,000 rupees (INR). Dalimba does the initial processing of the yarn to make it ready for weaving and after that, her husband fits it to the hand loom and weaves the sari. They only weave saris because of the demand in the market. Her family works around 8 to 10 hours a day and weaves two pieces of sari from it. 

Dalimba sells her products to the local traders on a weekly basis. She earns a monthly income of INR 5,000, which is not sufficient to maintain her six-member family along with business investment. So it is high time for her to increase the income for smooth management of her family. 

Now her son is also grown up and has the ability to manage another hand-loom unit. Therefore, from the present loan, Dalimba wants to buy another  hand-loom unit and procure thread/yarn in bulk for continuous weaving. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs. Dalimba wishes to grow her business and save enough to construct a house and plan for the marriage of her son and daughters. 

Out of the other nine members, seven members have also weaving businesses and two have cloth businesses. These members also want to invest their loans for the development of their enterprises.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of another hand-loom unit and procure thread/yarn in bulk for continuous weaving.

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en:
Waridi is so glad to know how Kiva lenders helped him with his rice cultivation.

He paid his loan in full and on time. With the profits, he could pay the fees of his children's tuition. He also started to raise chicks for selling.

Waridi wants to continue rice production; therefore, he needs a loan of SRD 7,500.

loans.use: To continue rice production by purchasing fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. 

For the past 13 years, Asuman has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, and rice. 

To help expand his business, Asuman has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items for sale, and it will help Asuman to generate greater profits and take care if his family's basic needs. 

Asuman hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase more stock. 

Asuman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asuman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items for sale.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
This is Nasiba. She is a dairy farmer in Tajikistan. She feeds mainly cows. The cows produce milk that she sells to the locals. She has worked in this field more than six years and her husband helps her with managing the business. They have four children and make all their best for them. 

Nasiba has plans to grow her business to become a recognized dairy farmer in Tajikistan. She will have a high milk production, higher income and also provide employment to many. A loan from Kiva will support her to increase working capital.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as patient. 

She operates a retail business where she sells drinks and water. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. 

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of used electronics, gas cylinders and other items for sale.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cooking gas. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as theft. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders. He will save the anticipated profits.	

His business goal is to be a distributor of gas within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a gas depot. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 38-year-old married woman doing a business of cattle purchase and sale with the help of her husband for the past eight years. 

After raising small animals for a year or two, her husband sells them in the local market. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. 

She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

For the growth of her business she has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children. For the past five years, she has been running a business of cattle sale and purchase, along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city.

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Dilshad has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR to buy more cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale purposes.

loans.name: Oui Group

texts.fr:
Mr TEED-WENDE PHILEMONT est le représentant du groupe OUI.  Marié, il est père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans et le moins âgé à 02 mois. Personne ne va à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charges.
Mr  est agriculteur depuis plus de 15ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché des villages environnants.
Il veut s’acheter  02 sacs d’engrais, 02boites d’insecticides, 03 boites de semence de choux.
Mr  veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Il  ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. TEED-WENDE PHILEMONT is the representative of the OUI group. He is married with three children whose ages range from 2 to 6 years old, none of whom attend school. He supports four people. 

He has been a farmer for over 15 years. He buys his supplies at the markets of surrounding villages. He wants to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers, 2 cartons of insecticides, and 3 boxes of cabbage seeds. 

He plans to add his profits to his savings in order to bolster his activity. His goal is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizers, 2 cartons of insecticides, and 3 boxes of cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Por Un Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 66 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo un hijo el cual ya es  mayor de edad pero aún viven con ella, el está casado y vive con su familia.
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace todo lo posible para que a su familia no les falte nada y aun mas después de la muerte de su querido esposo, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, en la época invernal siembra con la ayuda de su hijo arroz, maíz, maní y verduras, razón por lo cual está solicitando este crédito ya que necesita arreglar los terrenos que va a sembrar por que el invierno se acerca y espera tener todo listo para sembrar sus cultivos,  con esto y sus ventas ella se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar alimento para los pollos y para preparar los terrenos para la siembra. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of Trabajando por un Futuro Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton, known throughout the country for its delicious locally made sweets and for the warmth of the friendly and hardworking people there.

Rosa, 66, lives there.  Her husband died several years ago and she was widowed, but she had a son with him.  He's already an adult with his own wife and family, but they live with her.

Rosa's a very hardworking person who does everything she can for her family to have everything they need, and even more so after the death of her beloved husband.  She earns a living raising chickens, for which she has a small farm at her home.  In the winter she plants rice, peanuts, and vegetables with her son's help.  That's why she's requesting this loan, because she needs to prepare the land where she's going to plant.  Winter's coming and she hopes to have everything ready to plant her crops.  She earns her living with this and her sales.

She's going to use this loan to buy chicken feed and to prepare the land for planting.

Rosa has been in the communal bank for five years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and to prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Beogneere Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI est la représentante du groupe BEOGNERE.  Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé à 02 ans.  01 vont  à l’école.
Madame vend des céréales  depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 02 sacs de mil, 01 sac d’haricot et 01 sac d’arachide.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour le renforcement de son activité et ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. FATI is the representative of the BEOGNEERE group. She is married with three children whose ages range from 2 to 8 years old, one of whom attends school.

She has been selling cereals for 13 years. She buys her stock at surrounding markets. She wants to purchase two sacks of millet, one sack of beans and one sack of groundnuts. 

She plans to use her profits to bolster her activity. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of millet, one sack of beans and one sack of groundnuts.

loans.name: Industrial Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Industrial Poty está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento, es de una zona eminentemente rural que aun está en crecimiento.
La Sra. Clotilde es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante.  Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de animales y otros y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The loan group "Industrial Poty" is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, which is an area still in development. It is in a very rural zone that is still growing. 

Clotilde is one of the members. She raises small farm animals. She is a very hardworking person who is working hard to be able to get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to buy animals and others, and in this way she will be able to keep growing her business and provide her family with what they need to have a life without deprivation.

loans.use: to buy animals and others to raise

loans.name: Maraichers De Koubri Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur LAZAR est responsable du groupe MARAICHERS DE KOUBRI. Marié, il est père de 01 enfant âgé de 03ans. Il  a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mr  est jardinier depuis 04ans.  Il  s’approvisionne à Koubri et à Ouaga. 
Il veut s’acheter 02 sacs d’engrais, 03boites d’oignons, 02 boites d’insecticides.
Il désire utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans l’activité afin de bien le renforcer. Mr  ambitionne rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Mr. LAZAR is in charge of the group MARAICHERS DE KOUBRI. He is married with a 3-year-old child. He supports two people. 

Mr. Lazar became a gardener four years ago. He buys his supplies in Koubri and in Ouaga. He wants to buy two sack of fertilizers, three cartons of onions and 2 cartons of insecticides.

He plans to reinvest his profits in his activity in order to bolster his business. His goal is to ensure his family’s happiness.

loans.use: to buy two sack of fertilizers, three cartons of onions and 2 cartons of insecticides.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) works in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He supplies construction materials such as bamboos and timber, earning sufficient income to meet their family expenses. 

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Rashida requested a loan for her husband from Kashf Foundation for 30,000 PKR, which he will use loan to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate for the growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to diversify her products and buy fruits and vegetables in Managua

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en acción se llama este grupo, está integrado por 17 mujeres, cada una de ellas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que están luchando por sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabriela, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando por medio de su esfuerzo y su lucha diaria, ella vende prendas, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Mujeres en acción' (Women in action). It is made up of 17 women, each of them very hardworking and entrepreneurial, who are fighting on behalf of their families. 

One of the members is Gabriela, who showed in her last survey a poverty level within the third level, which means that she has been improving by her efforts and daily battles. She sells items of clothing, and through this work she has the means to be able to help her family and give them everything that she couldn't have.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other items, so she can continue with her work has she has been doing. They all give thanks for the opportunity they are receiving to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other items to sell

loans.name: Maritza Yolanda

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Por Un Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vice la señora Maritza, tiene 26 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no ha tenido hijos. Su esposo es chofer y agricultor.
Doña Maritza es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que trabaja para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas criollas,  tiene un pequeño corral en el cual mete sus animalitos, ella compra estos animalitos pequeños y los mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego venderlos a vecinos del lugar, así ella se gana algo sin salir de su casa de una forma honesta.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas  para los pollos y gallinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The members of Trabajando por un Futuro Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton, known throughout the country for its delicious locally made sweets and for the warmth of the friendly and hardworking people there.

Maritza, 26, lives there.  She's in a common-law relationship and hasn't had any children yet.  Her husband's a driver and farmer.

Maritza's a great housewife and a good wife who works to help her husband with the household expenses.  She works raising chickens and hens, and keeps her little animals in a small corral.  She buys and raises the animals for three months, enough time for them to have good growth so she can sell them to neighbors in the area.  That way she earns an honest living without having to leave the house.

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for the chickens and hens so they develop well.

She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are a big help to her.  Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for chickens and hens

loans.name: Danesa Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
La señora Danesa tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de 15 años  de edad el cual estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Danesa es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días por semana en sus recorridos pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas su hijo le ayuda a vender,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva 12 años dedicada al comercio con  el cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The "San Vicente" communal banks meets every fortnight in the Picoaza Parish of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known as a very commercial zone and for it's traditional festivals celebrating San Pedro and San Pablo and for the joy of it's inhabitants

Danesa is 33 years old. she is married and from this relationship has a 15 year old son who is studying in school. Her husband is a driver.

Danesa is a very good wife who in order to help her husband with the household expenses sells clothing of all types. She does this door-to-door and also sells from her house where the clients she knows best come. She works 3 days a week in her rounds but moreover in the mornings as at this time her son helps her with her sales. She leaves the goods on credit and collects every week=end. She has been doing this business for 12 years where she make her own income for the benefit of her family.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it as the loans are ver6y helpful. Her dreams are to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Juana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, carteras, entre otros productos que le envían desde Los Estados Unidos, Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres veces por semana y también vende en su casa, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, carteras, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank San Vicente meet fortnightly in an area called Picoaza, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its trade, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivities, and its joyful people.

This is where Juana, 56, lives. She is married and has four children who are independent adults. Her husband is a driver. Juana works as a housewife and wanted to make some money and help her husband with the home expenses, so she started selling shoes, bags and other products sent to her from the USA. She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door three days a week and also sells items from her home. She sells on credit and collects the money every week. She has been in this business for more than ten years, and helps her family with the income she receives.

With this loan, she will buy clothes, purses, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been a member of this group since the beginning. She likes to be a member because these loans help her a lot. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes, purses, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize.

loans.name: Maximandro

texts.es:
Maximandro tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y menores hijos en el Caserío de Pucará una zona de clima caluroso, su casa es de material rústico típico de la zona, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura como actividad principal, crianza de animales y comercio de frutales, ubicada a una hora del Distrito de Pimpingos que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, Departamento de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto de la variedad catimor, tiene una familia unida su cónyuge le apoya asistiendo a los jornaleros (preparando los alimentos) que contratan para dar mantenimiento a su finca, adicionalmente tienen 02 cabezas de ganado lechero que ordeñan y venden la leche fresca o preparado en quesos de manera artesanal, las ventas lo realizan a sus vecinos. Maximandro ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes y pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una buena producción y posteriormente mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maximandro is 44 years old and lives with his wife and minor children in Caserio de Pucará, an area with a hot climate. His house is made of rustic materials typical of the area. The inhabitants of the area make their living primarily in agriculture, raising livestock and selling fruit. This area is located one hour from the district of Pimpingos, which belongs to the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca department, in the northern mountain range of Peru. 

Maximandro makes his living in agriculture, growing coffee trees of the Catimor varietal. He has a close-knit family; his wife supports him by preparing food for the laborers that he hires to maintain his plantation. In addition, they have two heads of dairy cattle which they milk. They then sell the fresh milk, or use it to make traditional cheeses, which they sell to their neighbors. Maximandro is requesting this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles ($1,050 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase fertilizers and to pay the workers who maintain his coffee crop, and in this way, have good production and earn more money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay laborers for the maintenance of his coffee crops.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 15 años tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas medicinas popular por mayor y que le ha ido muy bien estos últimos meses y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ganancias..
texts.en: Ana, 47 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has worked selling over-the-counter medicines for the past 15 years. She has many clients due to the quality of her products. She is again requesting a loan to buy more over-the-counter medicines wholesale. Things have gone well for her in recent months, and in this way she can continue to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy more over-the-counter medicines wholesale

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en: Wycliff is a married father of a 5-year-old child. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, water, sweets, flour, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, sweets, milk and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, sweets, milk and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one more computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soil for making bricks

loans.name: King'oli

texts.en:
King'oli is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells tires. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

King'oli will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of tires. His business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a better life. He will use the anticipated profits to pay bills.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tires.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 34 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two currently in school. For the past 15 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells fresh meat. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more meat for sale, and will help Godfrey generate greater profits and provide his family with enough food and other basic needs. Godfrey hopes that in the future, he will be able to own other butcher shops. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant area, and his primary customers are of all types. He says his biggest business challenge is lack of capital. 

Fredrick will use the KES 40,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk-tuk within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Kerly Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Por Un Futuro, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señorita Kerly, tiene 22 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia secretariado ejecutivo en una universidad en Portoviejo. 
Doña Kerly es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudar a sus padres y para seguir con sus estudios ya que tiene que gastar mucho viajando todos los días hasta su universidad, ella realiza arreglos de belleza como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja en su casa y también realiza trabajos a domicilio. Lleva más de 2 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para seguir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, esmaltes y herramientas que aun necesita. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son ser profesional y tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The members of Trabajando por un Futuro Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton, known throughout the country for its delicious locally made sweets and for the warmth of the friendly and hardworking people there.

Kerly, 22, lives there.  She's single and lives in her parents' house.  She's studying executive secretarial studies at a university in Portoviejo.  She's a very hardworking young woman who likes to earn her own money to help her parents and to keep studying, because she has to spend a lot of money going back and forth to school.

Kerly gives beauty treatments, including dyes, cuts, and nails.  She works at her residence and does in-home jobs.  She has been doing this work for more than two years, and she earns her own money to get ahead.

She's going to use the loan to buy dye, polish, and tools she still needs.

She has been in the communal bank for four loan cycles and she likes it because of the help and benefits she gets from the bank.  Her dreams are to be a professional and to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, nail polish, and tools

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 62 years old and married with eight children.  Dioscora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, juice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Dioscora has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 41 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Dioscora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita is 60 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Enelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Enelita has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is a 34-year-old married mother of four children, ages 3 to 11 years, all in school. She has been farming for eight years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esterlita is 43 years old and her three children are in school.

Esterlita has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years. 

Esterlita requested a PHP 14500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.  In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en: Qamile's husband has been suffering from an organ disease and he must have a medical visitation to a heart specialist.  However, to achieve this, she needs a loan.

loans.use: pay for medical care

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en: Krishna and his wife thanks all Kiva lenders for helping them with their rice production. They could save money for their future with the profits from last season. But they don't have enough money to buy seed and diesel fuel to continue rice production. For this, they need another loan of SRD 10,000.

loans.use: To purchase seed and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 43-year-old married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by stitching clothes at her home for the people of her town as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Sakina is popularly known in her area for best providing stitching services. 

Due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and buttons. Sakina hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Soenil

texts.en:
Soenil wants to thank all Kiva lenders for helping him realize his long-term goals. 
He repaid his loan on time and could send his oldest child to town for studies. He paid his fees and wants to save more money to buy land so he does not have to rent.
He asks Kiva lenders once again for a loan of SRD 10,000 so he can continue rice production and save more for his family's future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Ruchelle

texts.en:
Originally hailing from Samar, Ruchelle grew up in a family that earns their keep through agriculture. At a young age, Ruchelle left the province and migrated to Cavite in her cousin's place to try her luck in employment. Ruchelle landed on various odd jobs until her marriage, which had her going back to her roots - farming. With his husband, Ruchelle contributes to the family income by helping her husband in swamp cabbage farming. This has been their primary source of income for 5 years now. 

Swamp cabbage farming requires proper soil preparation. As this vegetable grows in swampy areas, this entails ensuring that the land is watered constantly and that the soil is kept in a muddy state. Once the soil has been properly prepared, seeds or cuttings are planted by at least 6 inches apart and 6 inches deep. Ruchelle also ensures quality of the vegetable by adding in natural fertilizers from animal manure. Harvesting takes place after 1 to 2 months of planting. Ideally, the plant is cut from the stem at least 2 inches above the soil line in order to regenerate and grow new shoots. Swamp cabbages are vegetables that grow all year round with proper watering of the soil. With this process, Ruchelle's only investment is the rental of the land that they are farming. With a size of half hectare, Ruchelle pays the land lord PhP 193 per month while her gross sales is at PhP 2,500 per month. 

With due diligence in payment and savings, Ruchelle was able to buy a second hand tricycle which they use in the delivery of the harvested swamp cabbage to the nearby market. On the side, the tricycle is also being used to add up income to the family by servicing students going to and from the school.  On her 7th loan cycle now and with her business doing good, Ruchelle plans to expand the farm lot she and her husband is tending. They wanted to avail another half hectare for farming of the same vegetable. This would require them PhP 20,000 which would cover ental deposit and advance for the said farm lot. With this, Ruchelle will be able to double her sales and income.

Ruchelle dreams of buying their own farm lot and providing her four children a better future.

loans.use: To finance the initial rental for the farm lot expansion for growing swamp cabbage.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren has been with SEED since 2012. With his first loan, Efren was able to add up stocks for his meat shop business. Paying and managing his business diligently, he took on loan after each loan and was able to put his business into unparalleled growth. 

Currently, from the initial meat shop stall, Efren has now two stalls in different locations. He was also able to buy a second hand van to enable his buying and delivery of meat products to customers more convenient and economical. On top of this, Efren is able to establish a food house where he sells cooked food to workers near his place. 

While Efren's income has increased, Efren also had it in mind to give back to the community. In all of his business, Efren is able to give regular employment to four (4) neighbors who works for him as helpers. On his 6th loan now, Efren wants to avail PhP 150,000 to finance the procurement of an additional freezer in as much as meat demand is increasing owing to the growing number of customers in his 2 meat shops. Also, he wanted to buy a meat processor so that he can manufacture his own processed meat products to include local sausages. Efren notes that with the meat processor, he will be able to provide another neighbor for employment as well as provide more neighbors income generation when he subcontracts to them the selling of his own-manufactured processed meat.

In progress, Efren notes, it takes diligence, good habits in savings, good repayment record and also paying it forward by doing the local economy and community something good.

loans.use: To buy additional freezers  to store volumes of meat and meat products and to buy a meat processor so he can manufacture his own processed meat products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ibrahim has been working hard to manage his business selling products like maize flour and beans.

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize flour and beans for sale, and will help Ibrahim to generate greater profits and provide his family with enough food and other basic needs. Ibrahim hopes that in the future, he will be able to stay in the same business. 

Ibrahim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ibrahim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize flour and beans for sale,

loans.name: Ranil

texts.en:
Ranil engages in raising and selling hogs. He is a 38-year-old married man from Mcarthur, Leyte. He is a father of two children  ages 11 and 14. Aside from his hog raising business, he runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic merchandise like cooking oil, eggs, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

Ranil  is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy pig feed, vitamins and various grocery items for the store. This will help Ranil fill his store with various goods and in the coming few months, he could raise and sell more hogs. He could now continue to support the schooling of his children.

Ranil is hoping that in the near future, his business will be productive and stable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and various grocery items for the store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is Betty, 44, a resident of Coron, Palwan, Philippines. She is married to Dennis and has children. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for her family's daily needs.

Betty is a rice retailer. She buys sacks of rice from a wholesaler and sells them by the kilo. Rice is a staple of Filipino households so she makes a good income from it. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a tricycle and a tourist boat for rent. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Betty is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan which she will use to buy more sacks of rice to sell. She expects an increased demand for her rice since Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will surely help her meet the family's daily needs and support the education of her children. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Betty hopes to grow her business so she could help some of her children and save for her old age. She also hopes to be always healthy and fit for work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of rice to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rochell

texts.en:
Rochell is 30 years old and married with one child.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Rochell is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.   Rochell has been in pig fattening for 1 year and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.   She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed & vitamins
